223struct argf {
224 VALUE filename, current_file;
225 long last_lineno; /* $. */
226 long lineno;
227 VALUE argv;
228 VALUE inplace;
229 struct rb_io_enc_t encs;
230 int8_t init_p, next_p, binmode;
231};
232
233static rb_atomic_t max_file_descriptor = NOFILE;
234void
235rb_update_max_fd(int fd)
236{
237 rb_atomic_t afd = (rb_atomic_t)fd;
238 rb_atomic_t max_fd = max_file_descriptor;
239 int err;
240
241 if (fd < 0 || afd <= max_fd)
242 return;
243
244#if defined(HAVE_FCNTL) && defined(F_GETFL)
245 err = fcntl(fd, F_GETFL) == -1;
246#else
247 {
248 struct stat buf;
249 err = fstat(fd, &buf) != 0;
250 }
251#endif
252 if (err && errno == EBADF) {
253 rb_bug("rb_update_max_fd: invalid fd (%d) given.", fd);
254 }
255
256 while (max_fd < afd) {
257 max_fd = ATOMIC_CAS(max_file_descriptor, max_fd, afd);
258 }
259}
260
261void
262rb_maygvl_fd_fix_cloexec(int fd)
263{
264 /* MinGW don't have F_GETFD and FD_CLOEXEC. [ruby-core:40281] */
265#if defined(HAVE_FCNTL) && defined(F_GETFD) && defined(F_SETFD) && defined(FD_CLOEXEC)
266 int flags, flags2, ret;
267 flags = fcntl(fd, F_GETFD); /* should not fail except EBADF. */
268 if (flags == -1) {
269 rb_bug("rb_maygvl_fd_fix_cloexec: fcntl(%d, F_GETFD) failed: %s", fd, strerror(errno));
270 }
271 if (fd <= 2)
272 flags2 = flags & ~FD_CLOEXEC; /* Clear CLOEXEC for standard file descriptors: 0, 1, 2. */
273 else
274 flags2 = flags | FD_CLOEXEC; /* Set CLOEXEC for non-standard file descriptors: 3, 4, 5, ... */
275 if (flags != flags2) {
276 ret = fcntl(fd, F_SETFD, flags2);
277 if (ret != 0) {
278 rb_bug("rb_maygvl_fd_fix_cloexec: fcntl(%d, F_SETFD, %d) failed: %s", fd, flags2, strerror(errno));
279 }
280 }
281#endif
282}
283
284void
285rb_fd_fix_cloexec(int fd)
286{
287 rb_maygvl_fd_fix_cloexec(fd);
288 rb_update_max_fd(fd);
289}
290
291/* this is only called once */
292static int
293rb_fix_detect_o_cloexec(int fd)
294{
295#if defined(O_CLOEXEC) && defined(F_GETFD)
296 int flags = fcntl(fd, F_GETFD);
297
298 if (flags == -1)
299 rb_bug("rb_fix_detect_o_cloexec: fcntl(%d, F_GETFD) failed: %s", fd, strerror(errno));
300
301 if (flags & FD_CLOEXEC)
302 return 1;
303#endif /* fall through if O_CLOEXEC does not work: */
304 rb_maygvl_fd_fix_cloexec(fd);
305 return 0;
306}
307
308static inline bool
309io_again_p(int e)
310{
311 return (e == EWOULDBLOCK) || (e == EAGAIN);
312}
313
314int
315rb_cloexec_open(const char *pathname, int flags, mode_t mode)
316{
317 int ret;
318 static int o_cloexec_state = -1; /* <0: unknown, 0: ignored, >0: working */
319
320 static const int retry_interval = 0;
321 static const int retry_max_count = 10000;
322
323 int retry_count = 0;
324
325#ifdef O_CLOEXEC
326 /* O_CLOEXEC is available since Linux 2.6.23. Linux 2.6.18 silently ignore it. */
327 flags |= O_CLOEXEC;
328#elif defined O_NOINHERIT
329 flags |= O_NOINHERIT;
330#endif
331
332 while ((ret = open(pathname, flags, mode)) == -1) {
333 int e = errno;
334 if (!io_again_p(e)) break;
335 if (retry_count++ >= retry_max_count) break;
336
337 sleep(retry_interval);
338 }
339
340 if (ret < 0) return ret;
341 if (ret <= 2 || o_cloexec_state == 0) {
342 rb_maygvl_fd_fix_cloexec(ret);
343 }
344 else if (o_cloexec_state > 0) {
345 return ret;
346 }
347 else {
348 o_cloexec_state = rb_fix_detect_o_cloexec(ret);
349 }
350 return ret;
351}
352
353int
354rb_cloexec_dup(int oldfd)
355{
356 /* Don't allocate standard file descriptors: 0, 1, 2 */
357 return rb_cloexec_fcntl_dupfd(oldfd, 3);
358}
359
360int
361rb_cloexec_dup2(int oldfd, int newfd)
362{
363 int ret;
364
365 /* When oldfd == newfd, dup2 succeeds but dup3 fails with EINVAL.
366 * rb_cloexec_dup2 succeeds as dup2. */
367 if (oldfd == newfd) {
368 ret = newfd;
369 }
370 else {
371#if defined(HAVE_DUP3) && defined(O_CLOEXEC)
372 static int try_dup3 = 1;
373 if (2 < newfd && try_dup3) {
374 ret = dup3(oldfd, newfd, O_CLOEXEC);
375 if (ret != -1)
376 return ret;
377 /* dup3 is available since Linux 2.6.27, glibc 2.9. */
378 if (errno == ENOSYS) {
379 try_dup3 = 0;
380 ret = dup2(oldfd, newfd);
381 }
382 }
383 else {
384 ret = dup2(oldfd, newfd);
385 }
386#else
387 ret = dup2(oldfd, newfd);
388#endif
389 if (ret < 0) return ret;
390 }
391 rb_maygvl_fd_fix_cloexec(ret);
392 return ret;
393}
394
395static int
396rb_fd_set_nonblock(int fd)
397{
398#ifdef _WIN32
399 return rb_w32_set_nonblock(fd);
400#elif defined(F_GETFL)
401 int oflags = fcntl(fd, F_GETFL);
402
403 if (oflags == -1)
404 return -1;
405 if (oflags & O_NONBLOCK)
406 return 0;
407 oflags |= O_NONBLOCK;
408 return fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, oflags);
409#endif
410 return 0;
411}
412
413int
414rb_cloexec_pipe(int descriptors[2])
415{
416#ifdef HAVE_PIPE2
417 int result = pipe2(descriptors, O_CLOEXEC | O_NONBLOCK);
418#else
419 int result = pipe(descriptors);
420#endif
421
422 if (result < 0)
423 return result;
424
425#ifdef __CYGWIN__
426 if (result == 0 && descriptors[1] == -1) {
427 close(descriptors[0]);
428 descriptors[0] = -1;
429 errno = ENFILE;
430 return -1;
431 }
432#endif
433
434#ifndef HAVE_PIPE2
435 rb_maygvl_fd_fix_cloexec(descriptors[0]);
436 rb_maygvl_fd_fix_cloexec(descriptors[1]);
437
438#ifndef _WIN32
439 rb_fd_set_nonblock(descriptors[0]);
440 rb_fd_set_nonblock(descriptors[1]);
441#endif
442#endif
443
444 return result;
445}
446
447int
448rb_cloexec_fcntl_dupfd(int fd, int minfd)
449{
450 int ret;
451
452#if defined(HAVE_FCNTL) && defined(F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC) && defined(F_DUPFD)
453 static int try_dupfd_cloexec = 1;
454 if (try_dupfd_cloexec) {
455 ret = fcntl(fd, F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC, minfd);
456 if (ret != -1) {
457 if (ret <= 2)
458 rb_maygvl_fd_fix_cloexec(ret);
459 return ret;
460 }
461 /* F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC is available since Linux 2.6.24. Linux 2.6.18 fails with EINVAL */
462 if (errno == EINVAL) {
463 ret = fcntl(fd, F_DUPFD, minfd);
464 if (ret != -1) {
465 try_dupfd_cloexec = 0;
466 }
467 }
468 }
469 else {
470 ret = fcntl(fd, F_DUPFD, minfd);
471 }
472#elif defined(HAVE_FCNTL) && defined(F_DUPFD)
473 ret = fcntl(fd, F_DUPFD, minfd);
474#else
475 ret = dup(fd);
476 if (ret >= 0 && ret < minfd) {
477 const int prev_fd = ret;
478 ret = rb_cloexec_fcntl_dupfd(fd, minfd);
479 close(prev_fd);
480 }
481 return ret;
482#endif
483 if (ret < 0) return ret;
484 rb_maygvl_fd_fix_cloexec(ret);
485 return ret;
486}
487
488#define argf_of(obj) (*(struct argf *)DATA_PTR(obj))
489#define ARGF argf_of(argf)
490
491#define GetWriteIO(io) rb_io_get_write_io(io)
492
493#define READ_DATA_PENDING(fptr) ((fptr)->rbuf.len)
494#define READ_DATA_PENDING_COUNT(fptr) ((fptr)->rbuf.len)
495#define READ_DATA_PENDING_PTR(fptr) ((fptr)->rbuf.ptr+(fptr)->rbuf.off)
496#define READ_DATA_BUFFERED(fptr) READ_DATA_PENDING(fptr)
497
498#define READ_CHAR_PENDING(fptr) ((fptr)->cbuf.len)
499#define READ_CHAR_PENDING_COUNT(fptr) ((fptr)->cbuf.len)
500#define READ_CHAR_PENDING_PTR(fptr) ((fptr)->cbuf.ptr+(fptr)->cbuf.off)
501
502#if defined(_WIN32)
503#define WAIT_FD_IN_WIN32(fptr) \
504 (rb_w32_io_cancelable_p((fptr)->fd) ? Qnil : rb_io_wait(fptr->self, RB_INT2NUM(RUBY_IO_READABLE), Qnil))
505#else
506#define WAIT_FD_IN_WIN32(fptr)
507#endif
508
509#define READ_CHECK(fptr) do {\
510 if (!READ_DATA_PENDING(fptr)) {\
511 WAIT_FD_IN_WIN32(fptr);\
512 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);\
513 }\
514} while(0)
515
516#ifndef S_ISSOCK
517# ifdef _S_ISSOCK
518# define S_ISSOCK(m) _S_ISSOCK(m)
519# else
520# ifdef _S_IFSOCK
521# define S_ISSOCK(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == _S_IFSOCK)
522# else
523# ifdef S_IFSOCK
524# define S_ISSOCK(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFSOCK)
525# endif
526# endif
527# endif
528#endif

530static int io_fflush(rb_io_t *);
531static rb_io_t *flush_before_seek(rb_io_t *fptr);
532
533#define FMODE_PREP (1<<16)
534#define FMODE_SIGNAL_ON_EPIPE (1<<17)
535
536#define fptr_signal_on_epipe(fptr) \
537 (((fptr)->mode & FMODE_SIGNAL_ON_EPIPE) != 0)
538
539#define fptr_set_signal_on_epipe(fptr, flag) \
540 ((flag) ? \
541 (fptr)->mode |= FMODE_SIGNAL_ON_EPIPE : \
542 (fptr)->mode &= ~FMODE_SIGNAL_ON_EPIPE)
543
544extern ID ruby_static_id_signo;
545
546NORETURN(static void raise_on_write(rb_io_t *fptr, int e, VALUE errinfo));
547static void
548raise_on_write(rb_io_t *fptr, int e, VALUE errinfo)
549{
550#if defined EPIPE
551 if (fptr_signal_on_epipe(fptr) && (e == EPIPE)) {
552 const VALUE sig =
553# if defined SIGPIPE
554 INT2FIX(SIGPIPE) - INT2FIX(0) +
555# endif
556 INT2FIX(0);
557 rb_ivar_set(errinfo, ruby_static_id_signo, sig);
558 }
559#endif
560 rb_exc_raise(errinfo);
561}
562
563#define rb_sys_fail_on_write(fptr) \
564 do { \
565 int e = errno; \
566 raise_on_write(fptr, e, rb_syserr_new_path(e, (fptr)->pathv)); \
567 } while (0)
568
569#define NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ(fptr) ((fptr)->mode & FMODE_TEXTMODE)
570#define NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_WRITE(fptr) ((fptr)->mode & FMODE_TEXTMODE)
571#if defined(RUBY_TEST_CRLF_ENVIRONMENT) || defined(_WIN32)
572# define RUBY_CRLF_ENVIRONMENT 1
573#else
574# define RUBY_CRLF_ENVIRONMENT 0
575#endif
576
577#if RUBY_CRLF_ENVIRONMENT
578/* Windows */
579# define DEFAULT_TEXTMODE FMODE_TEXTMODE
580# define TEXTMODE_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_WRITE ECONV_CRLF_NEWLINE_DECORATOR
581/*
582 * CRLF newline is set as default newline decorator.
583 * If only CRLF newline conversion is needed, we use binary IO process
584 * with OS's text mode for IO performance improvement.
585 * If encoding conversion is needed or a user sets text mode, we use encoding
586 * conversion IO process and universal newline decorator by default.
587 */
588#define NEED_READCONV(fptr) ((fptr)->encs.enc2 != NULL || (fptr)->encs.ecflags & ~ECONV_CRLF_NEWLINE_DECORATOR)
589#define WRITECONV_MASK ( \
590 (ECONV_DECORATOR_MASK & ~ECONV_CRLF_NEWLINE_DECORATOR)|\
591 ECONV_STATEFUL_DECORATOR_MASK|\
592 0)
593#define NEED_WRITECONV(fptr) ( \
594 ((fptr)->encs.enc != NULL && (fptr)->encs.enc != rb_ascii8bit_encoding()) || \
595 ((fptr)->encs.ecflags & WRITECONV_MASK) || \
596 0)
597#define SET_BINARY_MODE(fptr) setmode((fptr)->fd, O_BINARY)
598
599#define NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ_CHECK(fptr) do {\
600 if (NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ(fptr)) {\
601 if (((fptr)->mode & FMODE_READABLE) &&\
602 !((fptr)->encs.ecflags & ECONV_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_MASK)) {\
603 setmode((fptr)->fd, O_BINARY);\
604 }\
605 else {\
606 setmode((fptr)->fd, O_TEXT);\
607 }\
608 }\
609} while(0)
610
611#define SET_UNIVERSAL_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_IF_ENC2(enc2, ecflags) do {\
612 if ((enc2) && ((ecflags) & ECONV_DEFAULT_NEWLINE_DECORATOR)) {\
613 (ecflags) |= ECONV_UNIVERSAL_NEWLINE_DECORATOR;\
614 }\
615} while(0)
616
617/*
618 * IO unread with taking care of removed '\r' in text mode.
619 */
620static void
621io_unread(rb_io_t *fptr)
622{
623 off_t r, pos;
624 ssize_t read_size;
625 long i;
626 long newlines = 0;
627 long extra_max;
628 char *p;
629 char *buf;
630
631 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
632 if (fptr->rbuf.len == 0 || fptr->mode & FMODE_DUPLEX) {
633 return;
634 }
635
636 errno = 0;
637 if (!rb_w32_fd_is_text(fptr->fd)) {
638 r = lseek(fptr->fd, -fptr->rbuf.len, SEEK_CUR);
639 if (r < 0 && errno) {
640 if (errno == ESPIPE)
641 fptr->mode |= FMODE_DUPLEX;
642 return;
643 }
644
645 fptr->rbuf.off = 0;
646 fptr->rbuf.len = 0;
647 return;
648 }
649
650 pos = lseek(fptr->fd, 0, SEEK_CUR);
651 if (pos < 0 && errno) {
652 if (errno == ESPIPE)
653 fptr->mode |= FMODE_DUPLEX;
654 return;
655 }
656
657 /* add extra offset for removed '\r' in rbuf */
658 extra_max = (long)(pos - fptr->rbuf.len);
659 p = fptr->rbuf.ptr + fptr->rbuf.off;
660
661 /* if the end of rbuf is '\r', rbuf doesn't have '\r' within rbuf.len */
662 if (*(fptr->rbuf.ptr + fptr->rbuf.capa - 1) == '\r') {
663 newlines++;
664 }
665
666 for (i = 0; i < fptr->rbuf.len; i++) {
667 if (*p == '\n') newlines++;
668 if (extra_max == newlines) break;
669 p++;
670 }
671
672 buf = ALLOC_N(char, fptr->rbuf.len + newlines);
673 while (newlines >= 0) {
674 r = lseek(fptr->fd, pos - fptr->rbuf.len - newlines, SEEK_SET);
675 if (newlines == 0) break;
676 if (r < 0) {
677 newlines--;
678 continue;
679 }
680 read_size = _read(fptr->fd, buf, fptr->rbuf.len + newlines);
681 if (read_size < 0) {
682 int e = errno;
683 free(buf);
684 rb_syserr_fail_path(e, fptr->pathv);
685 }
686 if (read_size == fptr->rbuf.len) {
687 lseek(fptr->fd, r, SEEK_SET);
688 break;
689 }
690 else {
691 newlines--;
692 }
693 }
694 free(buf);
695 fptr->rbuf.off = 0;
696 fptr->rbuf.len = 0;
697 return;
698}
699
700/*
701 * We use io_seek to back cursor position when changing mode from text to binary,
702 * but stdin and pipe cannot seek back. Stdin and pipe read should use encoding
703 * conversion for working properly with mode change.
704 *
705 * Return previous translation mode.
706 */
707static inline int
708set_binary_mode_with_seek_cur(rb_io_t *fptr)
709{
710 if (!rb_w32_fd_is_text(fptr->fd)) return O_BINARY;
711
712 if (fptr->rbuf.len == 0 || fptr->mode & FMODE_DUPLEX) {
713 return setmode(fptr->fd, O_BINARY);
714 }
715 flush_before_seek(fptr);
716 return setmode(fptr->fd, O_BINARY);
717}
718#define SET_BINARY_MODE_WITH_SEEK_CUR(fptr) set_binary_mode_with_seek_cur(fptr)
719
720#else
721/* Unix */
722# define DEFAULT_TEXTMODE 0
723#define NEED_READCONV(fptr) ((fptr)->encs.enc2 != NULL || NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ(fptr))
724#define NEED_WRITECONV(fptr) ( \
725 ((fptr)->encs.enc != NULL && (fptr)->encs.enc != rb_ascii8bit_encoding()) || \
726 NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_WRITE(fptr) || \
727 ((fptr)->encs.ecflags & (ECONV_DECORATOR_MASK|ECONV_STATEFUL_DECORATOR_MASK)) || \
728 0)
729#define SET_BINARY_MODE(fptr) (void)(fptr)
730#define NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ_CHECK(fptr) (void)(fptr)
731#define SET_UNIVERSAL_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_IF_ENC2(enc2, ecflags) ((void)(enc2), (void)(ecflags))
732#define SET_BINARY_MODE_WITH_SEEK_CUR(fptr) (void)(fptr)
733#endif
734
735#if !defined HAVE_SHUTDOWN && !defined shutdown
736#define shutdown(a,b) 0
737#endif
738
739#if defined(_WIN32)
740#define is_socket(fd, path) rb_w32_is_socket(fd)
741#elif !defined(S_ISSOCK)
742#define is_socket(fd, path) 0
743#else
744static int
745is_socket(int fd, VALUE path)
746{
747 struct stat sbuf;
748 if (fstat(fd, &sbuf) < 0)
749 rb_sys_fail_path(path);
750 return S_ISSOCK(sbuf.st_mode);
751}
752#endif
753
754static const char closed_stream[] = "closed stream";
755
756static void
757io_fd_check_closed(int fd)
758{
759 if (fd < 0) {
760 rb_thread_check_ints(); /* check for ruby_error_stream_closed */
761 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, closed_stream);
762 }
763}
764
765void
766rb_eof_error(void)
767{
768 rb_raise(rb_eEOFError, "end of file reached");
769}
770
771VALUE
772rb_io_taint_check(VALUE io)
773{
774 rb_check_frozen(io);
775 return io;
776}
777
778void
779rb_io_check_initialized(rb_io_t *fptr)
780{
781 if (!fptr) {
782 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "uninitialized stream");
783 }
784}
785
786void
787rb_io_check_closed(rb_io_t *fptr)
788{
789 rb_io_check_initialized(fptr);
790 io_fd_check_closed(fptr->fd);
791}
792
793static rb_io_t *
794rb_io_get_fptr(VALUE io)
795{
796 rb_io_t *fptr = RFILE(io)->fptr;
797 rb_io_check_initialized(fptr);
798 return fptr;
799}
800
801VALUE
802rb_io_get_io(VALUE io)
803{
804 return rb_convert_type_with_id(io, T_FILE, "IO", idTo_io);
805}
806
807VALUE
808rb_io_check_io(VALUE io)
809{
810 return rb_check_convert_type_with_id(io, T_FILE, "IO", idTo_io);
811}
812
813VALUE
814rb_io_get_write_io(VALUE io)
815{
816 VALUE write_io;
817 write_io = rb_io_get_fptr(io)->tied_io_for_writing;
818 if (write_io) {
819 return write_io;
820 }
821 return io;
822}
823
824VALUE
825rb_io_set_write_io(VALUE io, VALUE w)
826{
827 VALUE write_io;
828 rb_io_t *fptr = rb_io_get_fptr(io);
829 if (!RTEST(w)) {
830 w = 0;
831 }
832 else {
833 GetWriteIO(w);
834 }
835 write_io = fptr->tied_io_for_writing;
836 fptr->tied_io_for_writing = w;
837 return write_io ? write_io : Qnil;
838}
839
840/*
841 * call-seq:
842 * IO.try_convert(object) -> new_io or nil
843 *
844 * Attempts to convert +object+ into an \IO object via method +to_io+;
845 * returns the new \IO object if successful, or +nil+ otherwise:
846 *
847 * IO.try_convert(STDOUT) # => #<IO:<STDOUT>>
848 * IO.try_convert(ARGF) # => #<IO:<STDIN>>
849 * IO.try_convert('STDOUT') # => nil
850 *
851 */
852static VALUE
853rb_io_s_try_convert(VALUE dummy, VALUE io)
854{
855 return rb_io_check_io(io);
856}
857
858#if !RUBY_CRLF_ENVIRONMENT
859static void
860io_unread(rb_io_t *fptr)
861{
862 off_t r;
863 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
864 if (fptr->rbuf.len == 0 || fptr->mode & FMODE_DUPLEX)
865 return;
866 /* xxx: target position may be negative if buffer is filled by ungetc */
867 errno = 0;
868 r = lseek(fptr->fd, -fptr->rbuf.len, SEEK_CUR);
869 if (r < 0 && errno) {
870 if (errno == ESPIPE)
871 fptr->mode |= FMODE_DUPLEX;
872 return;
873 }
874 fptr->rbuf.off = 0;
875 fptr->rbuf.len = 0;
876 return;
877}
878#endif
879
880static rb_encoding *io_input_encoding(rb_io_t *fptr);
881
882static void
883io_ungetbyte(VALUE str, rb_io_t *fptr)
884{
885 long len = RSTRING_LEN(str);
886
887 if (fptr->rbuf.ptr == NULL) {
888 const int min_capa = IO_RBUF_CAPA_FOR(fptr);
889 fptr->rbuf.off = 0;
890 fptr->rbuf.len = 0;
891#if SIZEOF_LONG > SIZEOF_INT
892 if (len > INT_MAX)
893 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "ungetbyte failed");
894#endif
895 if (len > min_capa)
896 fptr->rbuf.capa = (int)len;
897 else
898 fptr->rbuf.capa = min_capa;
899 fptr->rbuf.ptr = ALLOC_N(char, fptr->rbuf.capa);
900 }
901 if (fptr->rbuf.capa < len + fptr->rbuf.len) {
902 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "ungetbyte failed");
903 }
904 if (fptr->rbuf.off < len) {
905 MEMMOVE(fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.capa-fptr->rbuf.len,
906 fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off,
907 char, fptr->rbuf.len);
908 fptr->rbuf.off = fptr->rbuf.capa-fptr->rbuf.len;
909 }
910 fptr->rbuf.off-=(int)len;
911 fptr->rbuf.len+=(int)len;
912 MEMMOVE(fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off, RSTRING_PTR(str), char, len);
913}
914
915static rb_io_t *
916flush_before_seek(rb_io_t *fptr)
917{
918 if (io_fflush(fptr) < 0)
919 rb_sys_fail_on_write(fptr);
920 io_unread(fptr);
921 errno = 0;
922 return fptr;
923}
924
925#define io_seek(fptr, ofs, whence) (errno = 0, lseek(flush_before_seek(fptr)->fd, (ofs), (whence)))
926#define io_tell(fptr) lseek(flush_before_seek(fptr)->fd, 0, SEEK_CUR)
927
928#ifndef SEEK_CUR
929# define SEEK_SET 0
930# define SEEK_CUR 1
931# define SEEK_END 2
932#endif
933
934void
935rb_io_check_char_readable(rb_io_t *fptr)
936{
937 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
938 if (!(fptr->mode & FMODE_READABLE)) {
939 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "not opened for reading");
940 }
941 if (fptr->wbuf.len) {
942 if (io_fflush(fptr) < 0)
943 rb_sys_fail_on_write(fptr);
944 }
945 if (fptr->tied_io_for_writing) {
946 rb_io_t *wfptr;
947 GetOpenFile(fptr->tied_io_for_writing, wfptr);
948 if (io_fflush(wfptr) < 0)
949 rb_sys_fail_on_write(wfptr);
950 }
951}
952
953void
954rb_io_check_byte_readable(rb_io_t *fptr)
955{
956 rb_io_check_char_readable(fptr);
957 if (READ_CHAR_PENDING(fptr)) {
958 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "byte oriented read for character buffered IO");
959 }
960}
961
962void
963rb_io_check_readable(rb_io_t *fptr)
964{
965 rb_io_check_byte_readable(fptr);
966}
967
968static rb_encoding*
969io_read_encoding(rb_io_t *fptr)
970{
971 if (fptr->encs.enc) {
972 return fptr->encs.enc;
973 }
974 return rb_default_external_encoding();
975}
976
977static rb_encoding*
978io_input_encoding(rb_io_t *fptr)
979{
980 if (fptr->encs.enc2) {
981 return fptr->encs.enc2;
982 }
983 return io_read_encoding(fptr);
984}
985
986void
987rb_io_check_writable(rb_io_t *fptr)
988{
989 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
990 if (!(fptr->mode & FMODE_WRITABLE)) {
991 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "not opened for writing");
992 }
993 if (fptr->rbuf.len) {
994 io_unread(fptr);
995 }
996}
997
998int
999rb_io_read_pending(rb_io_t *fptr)
1000{
1001 /* This function is used for bytes and chars. Confusing. */
1002 if (READ_CHAR_PENDING(fptr))
1003 return 1; /* should raise? */
1004 return READ_DATA_PENDING(fptr);
1005}
1006
1007void
1008rb_io_read_check(rb_io_t *fptr)
1009{
1010 if (!READ_DATA_PENDING(fptr)) {
1011 rb_io_wait(fptr->self, RB_INT2NUM(RUBY_IO_READABLE), Qnil);
1012 }
1013 return;
1014}
1015
1016int
1017rb_gc_for_fd(int err)
1018{
1019 if (err == EMFILE || err == ENFILE || err == ENOMEM) {
1020 rb_gc();
1021 return 1;
1022 }
1023 return 0;
1024}
1025
1026static int
1027ruby_dup(int orig)
1028{
1029 int fd;
1030
1031 fd = rb_cloexec_dup(orig);
1032 if (fd < 0) {
1033 int e = errno;
1034 if (rb_gc_for_fd(e)) {
1035 fd = rb_cloexec_dup(orig);
1036 }
1037 if (fd < 0) {
1038 rb_syserr_fail(e, 0);
1039 }
1040 }
1041 rb_update_max_fd(fd);
1042 return fd;
1043}
1044
1045static VALUE
1046io_alloc(VALUE klass)
1047{
1048 NEWOBJ_OF(io, struct RFile, klass, T_FILE);
1049
1050 io->fptr = 0;
1051
1052 return (VALUE)io;
1053}
1054
1055#ifndef S_ISREG
1056# define S_ISREG(m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFREG)
1057#endif
1058
1059struct io_internal_read_struct {
1060 VALUE th;
1061 rb_io_t *fptr;
1062 int nonblock;
1063 void *buf;
1064 size_t capa;
1065};
1066
1067struct io_internal_write_struct {
1068 int fd;
1069 const void *buf;
1070 size_t capa;
1071};
1072
1073#ifdef HAVE_WRITEV
1074struct io_internal_writev_struct {
1075 int fd;
1076 int iovcnt;
1077 const struct iovec *iov;
1078};
1079#endif
1080
1081static int nogvl_wait_for(VALUE th, rb_io_t *fptr, short events);
1082static VALUE
1083internal_read_func(void *ptr)
1084{
1085 struct io_internal_read_struct *iis = ptr;
1086 ssize_t r;
1087retry:
1088 r = read(iis->fptr->fd, iis->buf, iis->capa);
1089 if (r < 0 && !iis->nonblock) {
1090 int e = errno;
1091 if (io_again_p(e)) {
1092 if (nogvl_wait_for(iis->th, iis->fptr, RB_WAITFD_IN) != -1) {
1093 goto retry;
1094 }
1095 errno = e;
1096 }
1097 }
1098 return r;
1099}
1100
1101#if defined __APPLE__
1102# define do_write_retry(code) do {ret = code;} while (ret == -1 && errno == EPROTOTYPE)
1103#else
1104# define do_write_retry(code) ret = code
1105#endif
1106static VALUE
1107internal_write_func(void *ptr)
1108{
1109 struct io_internal_write_struct *iis = ptr;
1110 ssize_t ret;
1111 do_write_retry(write(iis->fd, iis->buf, iis->capa));
1112 return (VALUE)ret;
1113}
1114
1115#ifdef HAVE_WRITEV
1116static VALUE
1117internal_writev_func(void *ptr)
1118{
1119 struct io_internal_writev_struct *iis = ptr;
1120 ssize_t ret;
1121 do_write_retry(writev(iis->fd, iis->iov, iis->iovcnt));
1122 return (VALUE)ret;
1123}
1124#endif
1125
1126static ssize_t
1127rb_read_internal(rb_io_t *fptr, void *buf, size_t count)
1128{
1129 VALUE scheduler = rb_fiber_scheduler_current();
1130 if (scheduler != Qnil) {
1131 VALUE result = rb_fiber_scheduler_io_read_memory(scheduler, fptr->self, buf, count, 0);
1132
1133 if (result != Qundef) {
1134 return rb_fiber_scheduler_io_result_apply(result);
1135 }
1136 }
1137
1138 struct io_internal_read_struct iis = {
1139 .th = rb_thread_current(),
1140 .fptr = fptr,
1141 .nonblock = 0,
1142 .buf = buf,
1143 .capa = count
1144 };
1145
1146 return (ssize_t)rb_thread_io_blocking_region(internal_read_func, &iis, fptr->fd);
1147}
1148
1149static ssize_t
1150rb_write_internal(rb_io_t *fptr, const void *buf, size_t count)
1151{
1152 VALUE scheduler = rb_fiber_scheduler_current();
1153 if (scheduler != Qnil) {
1154 VALUE result = rb_fiber_scheduler_io_write_memory(scheduler, fptr->self, buf, count, 0);
1155
1156 if (result != Qundef) {
1157 return rb_fiber_scheduler_io_result_apply(result);
1158 }
1159 }
1160
1161 struct io_internal_write_struct iis = {
1162 .fd = fptr->fd,
1163 .buf = buf,
1164 .capa = count
1165 };
1166
1167 return (ssize_t)rb_thread_io_blocking_region(internal_write_func, &iis, fptr->fd);
1168}
1169
1170#ifdef HAVE_WRITEV
1171static ssize_t
1172rb_writev_internal(rb_io_t *fptr, const struct iovec *iov, int iovcnt)
1173{
1174 VALUE scheduler = rb_fiber_scheduler_current();
1175 if (scheduler != Qnil) {
1176 for (int i = 0; i < iovcnt; i += 1) {
1177 VALUE result = rb_fiber_scheduler_io_write_memory(scheduler, fptr->self, iov[i].iov_base, iov[i].iov_len, 0);
1178
1179 if (result != Qundef) {
1180 return rb_fiber_scheduler_io_result_apply(result);
1181 }
1182 }
1183 }
1184
1185 struct io_internal_writev_struct iis = {
1186 .fd = fptr->fd,
1187 .iov = iov,
1188 .iovcnt = iovcnt,
1189 };
1190
1191 return (ssize_t)rb_thread_io_blocking_region(internal_writev_func, &iis, fptr->fd);
1192}
1193#endif
1194
1195static VALUE
1196io_flush_buffer_sync(void *arg)
1197{
1198 rb_io_t *fptr = arg;
1199 long l = fptr->wbuf.len;
1200 ssize_t r = write(fptr->fd, fptr->wbuf.ptr+fptr->wbuf.off, (size_t)l);
1201
1202 if (fptr->wbuf.len <= r) {
1203 fptr->wbuf.off = 0;
1204 fptr->wbuf.len = 0;
1205 return 0;
1206 }
1207 if (0 <= r) {
1208 fptr->wbuf.off += (int)r;
1209 fptr->wbuf.len -= (int)r;
1210 errno = EAGAIN;
1211 }
1212 return (VALUE)-1;
1213}
1214
1215static VALUE
1216io_flush_buffer_async(VALUE arg)
1217{
1218 rb_io_t *fptr = (rb_io_t *)arg;
1219 return rb_thread_io_blocking_region(io_flush_buffer_sync, fptr, fptr->fd);
1220}
1221
1222static inline int
1223io_flush_buffer(rb_io_t *fptr)
1224{
1225 if (!NIL_P(fptr->write_lock) && rb_mutex_owned_p(fptr->write_lock)) {
1226 return (int)io_flush_buffer_async((VALUE)fptr);
1227 } else {
1228 return (int)rb_mutex_synchronize(fptr->write_lock, io_flush_buffer_async, (VALUE)fptr);
1229 }
1230}
1231
1232static int
1233io_fflush(rb_io_t *fptr)
1234{
1235 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
1236
1237 if (fptr->wbuf.len == 0)
1238 return 0;
1239
1240 while (fptr->wbuf.len > 0 && io_flush_buffer(fptr) != 0) {
1241 if (!rb_io_maybe_wait_writable(errno, fptr->self, Qnil))
1242 return -1;
1243
1244 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
1245 }
1246
1247 return 0;
1248}
1249
1250VALUE
1251rb_io_wait(VALUE io, VALUE events, VALUE timeout)
1252{
1253 VALUE scheduler = rb_fiber_scheduler_current();
1254
1255 if (scheduler != Qnil) {
1256 return rb_fiber_scheduler_io_wait(scheduler, io, events, timeout);
1257 }
1258
1259 rb_io_t * fptr = NULL;
1260 RB_IO_POINTER(io, fptr);
1261
1262 struct timeval tv_storage;
1263 struct timeval *tv = NULL;
1264
1265 if (timeout != Qnil) {
1266 tv_storage = rb_time_interval(timeout);
1267 tv = &tv_storage;
1268 }
1269
1270 int ready = rb_thread_wait_for_single_fd(fptr->fd, RB_NUM2INT(events), tv);
1271
1272 if (ready < 0) {
1273 rb_sys_fail(0);
1274 }
1275
1276 // Not sure if this is necessary:
1277 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
1278
1279 if (ready) {
1280 return RB_INT2NUM(ready);
1281 }
1282 else {
1283 return Qfalse;
1284 }
1285}
1286
1287static VALUE
1288io_from_fd(int fd)
1289{
1290 return prep_io(fd, FMODE_PREP, rb_cIO, NULL);
1291}
1292
1293static int
1294io_wait_for_single_fd(int fd, int events, struct timeval *timeout)
1295{
1296 VALUE scheduler = rb_fiber_scheduler_current();
1297
1298 if (scheduler != Qnil) {
1299 return RTEST(
1300 rb_fiber_scheduler_io_wait(scheduler, io_from_fd(fd), RB_INT2NUM(events), rb_fiber_scheduler_make_timeout(timeout))
1301 );
1302 }
1303
1304 return rb_thread_wait_for_single_fd(fd, events, timeout);
1305}
1306
1307int
1308rb_io_wait_readable(int f)
1309{
1310 io_fd_check_closed(f);
1311
1312 VALUE scheduler = rb_fiber_scheduler_current();
1313
1314 switch (errno) {
1315 case EINTR:
1316#if defined(ERESTART)
1317 case ERESTART:
1318#endif
1319 rb_thread_check_ints();
1320 return TRUE;
1321
1322 case EAGAIN:
1323#if EWOULDBLOCK != EAGAIN
1324 case EWOULDBLOCK:
1325#endif
1326 if (scheduler != Qnil) {
1327 return RTEST(
1328 rb_fiber_scheduler_io_wait_readable(scheduler, io_from_fd(f))
1329 );
1330 }
1331 else {
1332 io_wait_for_single_fd(f, RUBY_IO_READABLE, NULL);
1333 }
1334 return TRUE;
1335
1336 default:
1337 return FALSE;
1338 }
1339}
1340
1341int
1342rb_io_wait_writable(int f)
1343{
1344 io_fd_check_closed(f);
1345
1346 VALUE scheduler = rb_fiber_scheduler_current();
1347
1348 switch (errno) {
1349 case EINTR:
1350#if defined(ERESTART)
1351 case ERESTART:
1352#endif
1353 /*
1354 * In old Linux, several special files under /proc and /sys don't handle
1355 * select properly. Thus we need avoid to call if don't use O_NONBLOCK.
1356 * Otherwise, we face nasty hang up. Sigh.
1357 * e.g. https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=31b07093c44a7a442394d44423e21d783f5523b8
1358 * https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=31b07093c44a7a442394d44423e21d783f5523b8
1359 * In EINTR case, we only need to call RUBY_VM_CHECK_INTS_BLOCKING().
1360 * Then rb_thread_check_ints() is enough.
1361 */
1362 rb_thread_check_ints();
1363 return TRUE;
1364
1365 case EAGAIN:
1366#if EWOULDBLOCK != EAGAIN
1367 case EWOULDBLOCK:
1368#endif
1369 if (scheduler != Qnil) {
1370 return RTEST(
1371 rb_fiber_scheduler_io_wait_writable(scheduler, io_from_fd(f))
1372 );
1373 }
1374 else {
1375 io_wait_for_single_fd(f, RUBY_IO_WRITABLE, NULL);
1376 }
1377 return TRUE;
1378
1379 default:
1380 return FALSE;
1381 }
1382}
1383
1384int
1385rb_wait_for_single_fd(int fd, int events, struct timeval *timeout)
1386{
1387 return io_wait_for_single_fd(fd, events, timeout);
1388}
1389
1390int
1391rb_thread_wait_fd(int fd)
1392{
1393 return rb_wait_for_single_fd(fd, RUBY_IO_READABLE, NULL);
1394}
1395
1396int
1397rb_thread_fd_writable(int fd)
1398{
1399 return rb_wait_for_single_fd(fd, RUBY_IO_WRITABLE, NULL);
1400}
1401
1402VALUE
1403rb_io_maybe_wait(int error, VALUE io, VALUE events, VALUE timeout)
1404{
1405 // fptr->fd can be set to -1 at any time by another thread when the GVL is
1406 // released. Many code, e.g. `io_bufread` didn't check this correctly and
1407 // instead relies on `read(-1) -> -1` which causes this code path. We then
1408 // check here whether the IO was in fact closed. Probably it's better to
1409 // check that `fptr->fd != -1` before using it in syscall.
1410 rb_io_check_closed(RFILE(io)->fptr);
1411
1412 switch (error) {
1413 // In old Linux, several special files under /proc and /sys don't handle
1414 // select properly. Thus we need avoid to call if don't use O_NONBLOCK.
1415 // Otherwise, we face nasty hang up. Sigh.
1416 // e.g. https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=31b07093c44a7a442394d44423e21d783f5523b8
1417 // https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=31b07093c44a7a442394d44423e21d783f5523b8
1418 // In EINTR case, we only need to call RUBY_VM_CHECK_INTS_BLOCKING().
1419 // Then rb_thread_check_ints() is enough.
1420 case EINTR:
1421#if defined(ERESTART)
1422 case ERESTART:
1423#endif
1424 // We might have pending interrupts since the previous syscall was interrupted:
1425 rb_thread_check_ints();
1426
1427 // The operation was interrupted, so retry it immediately:
1428 return events;
1429
1430 case EAGAIN:
1431#if EWOULDBLOCK != EAGAIN
1432 case EWOULDBLOCK:
1433#endif
1434 // The operation would block, so wait for the specified events:
1435 return rb_io_wait(io, events, timeout);
1436
1437 default:
1438 // Non-specific error, no event is ready:
1439 return Qfalse;
1440 }
1441}
1442
1443int
1444rb_io_maybe_wait_readable(int error, VALUE io, VALUE timeout)
1445{
1446 VALUE result = rb_io_maybe_wait(error, io, RB_INT2NUM(RUBY_IO_READABLE), timeout);
1447
1448 if (RTEST(result)) {
1449 return RB_NUM2INT(result);
1450 }
1451 else {
1452 return 0;
1453 }
1454}
1455
1456int
1457rb_io_maybe_wait_writable(int error, VALUE io, VALUE timeout)
1458{
1459 VALUE result = rb_io_maybe_wait(error, io, RB_INT2NUM(RUBY_IO_WRITABLE), timeout);
1460
1461 if (RTEST(result)) {
1462 return RB_NUM2INT(result);
1463 }
1464 else {
1465 return 0;
1466 }
1467}
1468
1469static void
1470make_writeconv(rb_io_t *fptr)
1471{
1472 if (!fptr->writeconv_initialized) {
1473 const char *senc, *denc;
1474 rb_encoding *enc;
1475 int ecflags;
1476 VALUE ecopts;
1477
1478 fptr->writeconv_initialized = 1;
1479
1480 ecflags = fptr->encs.ecflags & ~ECONV_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_READ_MASK;
1481 ecopts = fptr->encs.ecopts;
1482
1483 if (!fptr->encs.enc || (fptr->encs.enc == rb_ascii8bit_encoding() && !fptr->encs.enc2)) {
1484 /* no encoding conversion */
1485 fptr->writeconv_pre_ecflags = 0;
1486 fptr->writeconv_pre_ecopts = Qnil;
1487 fptr->writeconv = rb_econv_open_opts("", "", ecflags, ecopts);
1488 if (!fptr->writeconv)
1489 rb_exc_raise(rb_econv_open_exc("", "", ecflags));
1490 fptr->writeconv_asciicompat = Qnil;
1491 }
1492 else {
1493 enc = fptr->encs.enc2 ? fptr->encs.enc2 : fptr->encs.enc;
1494 senc = rb_econv_asciicompat_encoding(rb_enc_name(enc));
1495 if (!senc && !(fptr->encs.ecflags & ECONV_STATEFUL_DECORATOR_MASK)) {
1496 /* single conversion */
1497 fptr->writeconv_pre_ecflags = ecflags;
1498 fptr->writeconv_pre_ecopts = ecopts;
1499 fptr->writeconv = NULL;
1500 fptr->writeconv_asciicompat = Qnil;
1501 }
1502 else {
1503 /* double conversion */
1504 fptr->writeconv_pre_ecflags = ecflags & ~ECONV_STATEFUL_DECORATOR_MASK;
1505 fptr->writeconv_pre_ecopts = ecopts;
1506 if (senc) {
1507 denc = rb_enc_name(enc);
1508 fptr->writeconv_asciicompat = rb_str_new2(senc);
1509 }
1510 else {
1511 senc = denc = "";
1512 fptr->writeconv_asciicompat = rb_str_new2(rb_enc_name(enc));
1513 }
1514 ecflags = fptr->encs.ecflags & (ECONV_ERROR_HANDLER_MASK|ECONV_STATEFUL_DECORATOR_MASK);
1515 ecopts = fptr->encs.ecopts;
1516 fptr->writeconv = rb_econv_open_opts(senc, denc, ecflags, ecopts);
1517 if (!fptr->writeconv)
1518 rb_exc_raise(rb_econv_open_exc(senc, denc, ecflags));
1519 }
1520 }
1521 }
1522}
1523
1524/* writing functions */
1525struct binwrite_arg {
1526 rb_io_t *fptr;
1527 VALUE str;
1528 const char *ptr;
1529 long length;
1530};
1531
1532struct write_arg {
1533 VALUE io;
1534 VALUE str;
1535 int nosync;
1536};
1537
1538#ifdef HAVE_WRITEV
1539static ssize_t
1540io_binwrite_string_internal(rb_io_t *fptr, const char *ptr, long length)
1541{
1542 if (fptr->wbuf.len) {
1543 struct iovec iov[2];
1544
1545 iov[0].iov_base = fptr->wbuf.ptr+fptr->wbuf.off;
1546 iov[0].iov_len = fptr->wbuf.len;
1547 iov[1].iov_base = (void*)ptr;
1548 iov[1].iov_len = length;
1549
1550 ssize_t result = rb_writev_internal(fptr, iov, 2);
1551
1552 if (result < 0)
1553 return result;
1554
1555 if (result >= fptr->wbuf.len) {
1556 // We wrote more than the internal buffer:
1557 result -= fptr->wbuf.len;
1558 fptr->wbuf.off = 0;
1559 fptr->wbuf.len = 0;
1560 }
1561 else {
1562 // We only wrote less data than the internal buffer:
1563 fptr->wbuf.off += (int)result;
1564 fptr->wbuf.len -= (int)result;
1565
1566 result = 0;
1567 }
1568
1569 return result;
1570 }
1571 else {
1572 return rb_write_internal(fptr, ptr, length);
1573 }
1574}
1575#else
1576static ssize_t
1577io_binwrite_string_internal(rb_io_t *fptr, const char *ptr, long length)
1578{
1579 long remaining = length;
1580
1581 if (fptr->wbuf.len) {
1582 if (fptr->wbuf.len+length <= fptr->wbuf.capa) {
1583 if (fptr->wbuf.capa < fptr->wbuf.off+fptr->wbuf.len+length) {
1584 MEMMOVE(fptr->wbuf.ptr, fptr->wbuf.ptr+fptr->wbuf.off, char, fptr->wbuf.len);
1585 fptr->wbuf.off = 0;
1586 }
1587
1588 MEMMOVE(fptr->wbuf.ptr+fptr->wbuf.off+fptr->wbuf.len, ptr, char, length);
1589 fptr->wbuf.len += (int)length;
1590
1591 // We copied the entire incoming data to the internal buffer:
1592 remaining = 0;
1593 }
1594
1595 // Flush the internal buffer:
1596 if (io_fflush(fptr) < 0) {
1597 return -1;
1598 }
1599
1600 // If all the data was buffered, we are done:
1601 if (remaining == 0) {
1602 return length;
1603 }
1604 }
1605
1606 // Otherwise, we should write the data directly:
1607 return rb_write_internal(fptr, ptr, length);
1608}
1609#endif
1610
1611static VALUE
1612io_binwrite_string(VALUE arg)
1613{
1614 struct binwrite_arg *p = (struct binwrite_arg *)arg;
1615
1616 const char *ptr = p->ptr;
1617 size_t remaining = p->length;
1618
1619 while (remaining) {
1620 // Write as much as possible:
1621 ssize_t result = io_binwrite_string_internal(p->fptr, ptr, remaining);
1622
1623 if (result > 0) {
1624 if ((size_t)result == remaining) break;
1625 ptr += result;
1626 remaining -= result;
1627 }
1628 // Wait for it to become writable:
1629 else if (rb_io_maybe_wait_writable(errno, p->fptr->self, Qnil)) {
1630 rb_io_check_closed(p->fptr);
1631 }
1632 else {
1633 // The error was unrelated to waiting for it to become writable, so we fail:
1634 return -1;
1635 }
1636 }
1637
1638 return p->length;
1639}
1640
1641inline static void
1642io_allocate_write_buffer(rb_io_t *fptr, int sync)
1643{
1644 if (fptr->wbuf.ptr == NULL && !(sync && (fptr->mode & FMODE_SYNC))) {
1645 fptr->wbuf.off = 0;
1646 fptr->wbuf.len = 0;
1647 fptr->wbuf.capa = IO_WBUF_CAPA_MIN;
1648 fptr->wbuf.ptr = ALLOC_N(char, fptr->wbuf.capa);
1649 }
1650
1651 if (NIL_P(fptr->write_lock)) {
1652 fptr->write_lock = rb_mutex_new();
1653 rb_mutex_allow_trap(fptr->write_lock, 1);
1654 }
1655}
1656
1657static inline int
1658io_binwrite_requires_flush_write(rb_io_t *fptr, long len, int nosync)
1659{
1660 // If the requested operation was synchronous and the output mode is synchronus or a TTY:
1661 if (!nosync && (fptr->mode & (FMODE_SYNC|FMODE_TTY)))
1662 return 1;
1663
1664 // If the amount of data we want to write exceeds the internal buffer:
1665 if (fptr->wbuf.ptr && fptr->wbuf.capa <= fptr->wbuf.len + len)
1666 return 1;
1667
1668 // Otherwise, we can append to the internal buffer:
1669 return 0;
1670}
1671
1672static long
1673io_binwrite(VALUE str, const char *ptr, long len, rb_io_t *fptr, int nosync)
1674{
1675 if (len <= 0) return len;
1676
1677 // Don't write anything if current thread has a pending interrupt:
1678 rb_thread_check_ints();
1679
1680 io_allocate_write_buffer(fptr, !nosync);
1681
1682 if (io_binwrite_requires_flush_write(fptr, len, nosync)) {
1683 struct binwrite_arg arg;
1684
1685 arg.fptr = fptr;
1686 arg.str = str;
1687 arg.ptr = ptr;
1688 arg.length = len;
1689
1690 if (!NIL_P(fptr->write_lock)) {
1691 return rb_mutex_synchronize(fptr->write_lock, io_binwrite_string, (VALUE)&arg);
1692 }
1693 else {
1694 return io_binwrite_string((VALUE)&arg);
1695 }
1696 } else {
1697 if (fptr->wbuf.off) {
1698 if (fptr->wbuf.len)
1699 MEMMOVE(fptr->wbuf.ptr, fptr->wbuf.ptr+fptr->wbuf.off, char, fptr->wbuf.len);
1700 fptr->wbuf.off = 0;
1701 }
1702
1703 MEMMOVE(fptr->wbuf.ptr+fptr->wbuf.off+fptr->wbuf.len, ptr, char, len);
1704 fptr->wbuf.len += (int)len;
1705
1706 return len;
1707 }
1708}
1709
1710# define MODE_BTMODE(a,b,c) ((fmode & FMODE_BINMODE) ? (b) : \
1711 (fmode & FMODE_TEXTMODE) ? (c) : (a))
1712
1713#define MODE_BTXMODE(a, b, c, d, e, f) ((fmode & FMODE_EXCL) ? \
1714 MODE_BTMODE(d, e, f) : \
1715 MODE_BTMODE(a, b, c))
1716
1717static VALUE
1718do_writeconv(VALUE str, rb_io_t *fptr, int *converted)
1719{
1720 if (NEED_WRITECONV(fptr)) {
1721 VALUE common_encoding = Qnil;
1722 SET_BINARY_MODE(fptr);
1723
1724 make_writeconv(fptr);
1725
1726 if (fptr->writeconv) {
1727#define fmode (fptr->mode)
1728 if (!NIL_P(fptr->writeconv_asciicompat))
1729 common_encoding = fptr->writeconv_asciicompat;
1730 else if (MODE_BTMODE(DEFAULT_TEXTMODE,0,1) && !rb_enc_asciicompat(rb_enc_get(str))) {
1731 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "ASCII incompatible string written for text mode IO without encoding conversion: %s",
1732 rb_enc_name(rb_enc_get(str)));
1733 }
1734#undef fmode
1735 }
1736 else {
1737 if (fptr->encs.enc2)
1738 common_encoding = rb_enc_from_encoding(fptr->encs.enc2);
1739 else if (fptr->encs.enc != rb_ascii8bit_encoding())
1740 common_encoding = rb_enc_from_encoding(fptr->encs.enc);
1741 }
1742
1743 if (!NIL_P(common_encoding)) {
1744 str = rb_str_encode(str, common_encoding,
1745 fptr->writeconv_pre_ecflags, fptr->writeconv_pre_ecopts);
1746 *converted = 1;
1747 }
1748
1749 if (fptr->writeconv) {
1750 str = rb_econv_str_convert(fptr->writeconv, str, ECONV_PARTIAL_INPUT);
1751 *converted = 1;
1752 }
1753 }
1754#if RUBY_CRLF_ENVIRONMENT
1755#define fmode (fptr->mode)
1756 else if (MODE_BTMODE(DEFAULT_TEXTMODE,0,1)) {
1757 if ((fptr->mode & FMODE_READABLE) &&
1758 !(fptr->encs.ecflags & ECONV_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_MASK)) {
1759 setmode(fptr->fd, O_BINARY);
1760 }
1761 else {
1762 setmode(fptr->fd, O_TEXT);
1763 }
1764 if (!rb_enc_asciicompat(rb_enc_get(str))) {
1765 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "ASCII incompatible string written for text mode IO without encoding conversion: %s",
1766 rb_enc_name(rb_enc_get(str)));
1767 }
1768 }
1769#undef fmode
1770#endif
1771 return str;
1772}
1773
1774static long
1775io_fwrite(VALUE str, rb_io_t *fptr, int nosync)
1776{
1777 int converted = 0;
1778 VALUE tmp;
1779 long n, len;
1780 const char *ptr;
1781
1782#ifdef _WIN32
1783 if (fptr->mode & FMODE_TTY) {
1784 long len = rb_w32_write_console(str, fptr->fd);
1785 if (len > 0) return len;
1786 }
1787#endif
1788
1789 str = do_writeconv(str, fptr, &converted);
1790 if (converted)
1791 OBJ_FREEZE(str);
1792
1793 tmp = rb_str_tmp_frozen_acquire(str);
1794 RSTRING_GETMEM(tmp, ptr, len);
1795 n = io_binwrite(tmp, ptr, len, fptr, nosync);
1796 rb_str_tmp_frozen_release(str, tmp);
1797
1798 return n;
1799}
1800
1801ssize_t
1802rb_io_bufwrite(VALUE io, const void *buf, size_t size)
1803{
1804 rb_io_t *fptr;
1805
1806 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
1807 rb_io_check_writable(fptr);
1808 return (ssize_t)io_binwrite(0, buf, (long)size, fptr, 0);
1809}
1810
1811static VALUE
1812io_write(VALUE io, VALUE str, int nosync)
1813{
1814 rb_io_t *fptr;
1815 long n;
1816 VALUE tmp;
1817
1818 io = GetWriteIO(io);
1819 str = rb_obj_as_string(str);
1820 tmp = rb_io_check_io(io);
1821
1822 if (NIL_P(tmp)) {
1823 /* port is not IO, call write method for it. */
1824 return rb_funcall(io, id_write, 1, str);
1825 }
1826
1827 io = tmp;
1828 if (RSTRING_LEN(str) == 0) return INT2FIX(0);
1829
1830 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
1831 rb_io_check_writable(fptr);
1832
1833 n = io_fwrite(str, fptr, nosync);
1834 if (n < 0L) rb_sys_fail_on_write(fptr);
1835
1836 return LONG2FIX(n);
1837}
1838
1839#ifdef HAVE_WRITEV
1840struct binwritev_arg {
1841 rb_io_t *fptr;
1842 struct iovec *iov;
1843 int iovcnt;
1844 size_t total;
1845};
1846
1847static VALUE
1848io_binwritev_internal(VALUE arg)
1849{
1850 struct binwritev_arg *p = (struct binwritev_arg *)arg;
1851
1852 size_t remaining = p->total;
1853 size_t offset = 0;
1854
1855 rb_io_t *fptr = p->fptr;
1856 struct iovec *iov = p->iov;
1857 int iovcnt = p->iovcnt;
1858
1859 while (remaining) {
1860 long result = rb_writev_internal(fptr, iov, iovcnt);
1861
1862 if (result > 0) {
1863 offset += result;
1864 if (fptr->wbuf.ptr && fptr->wbuf.len) {
1865 if (offset < (size_t)fptr->wbuf.len) {
1866 fptr->wbuf.off += result;
1867 fptr->wbuf.len -= result;
1868 }
1869 else {
1870 offset -= (size_t)fptr->wbuf.len;
1871 fptr->wbuf.off = 0;
1872 fptr->wbuf.len = 0;
1873 }
1874 }
1875
1876 if (offset == p->total) {
1877 return p->total;
1878 }
1879
1880 while (result >= (ssize_t)iov->iov_len) {
1881 /* iovcnt > 0 */
1882 result -= iov->iov_len;
1883 iov->iov_len = 0;
1884 iov++;
1885
1886 if (!--iovcnt) {
1887 // I don't believe this code path can ever occur.
1888 return offset;
1889 }
1890 }
1891
1892 iov->iov_base = (char *)iov->iov_base + result;
1893 iov->iov_len -= result;
1894 }
1895 else if (rb_io_maybe_wait_writable(errno, fptr->self, Qnil)) {
1896 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
1897 }
1898 else {
1899 return -1;
1900 }
1901 }
1902
1903 return offset;
1904}
1905
1906static long
1907io_binwritev(struct iovec *iov, int iovcnt, rb_io_t *fptr)
1908{
1909 // Don't write anything if current thread has a pending interrupt:
1910 rb_thread_check_ints();
1911
1912 if (iovcnt == 0) return 0;
1913
1914 size_t total = 0;
1915 for (int i = 1; i < iovcnt; i++) total += iov[i].iov_len;
1916
1917 io_allocate_write_buffer(fptr, 1);
1918
1919 if (fptr->wbuf.ptr && fptr->wbuf.len) {
1920 // The end of the buffered data:
1921 size_t offset = fptr->wbuf.off + fptr->wbuf.len;
1922
1923 if (offset + total <= (size_t)fptr->wbuf.capa) {
1924 for (int i = 1; i < iovcnt; i++) {
1925 memcpy(fptr->wbuf.ptr+offset, iov[i].iov_base, iov[i].iov_len);
1926 offset += iov[i].iov_len;
1927 }
1928
1929 fptr->wbuf.len += total;
1930
1931 return total;
1932 }
1933 else {
1934 iov[0].iov_base = fptr->wbuf.ptr + fptr->wbuf.off;
1935 iov[0].iov_len = fptr->wbuf.len;
1936 }
1937 }
1938 else {
1939 // The first iov is reserved for the internal buffer, and it's empty.
1940 iov++;
1941
1942 if (!--iovcnt) {
1943 // If there are no other io vectors we are done.
1944 return 0;
1945 }
1946 }
1947
1948 struct binwritev_arg arg;
1949 arg.fptr = fptr;
1950 arg.iov = iov;
1951 arg.iovcnt = iovcnt;
1952 arg.total = total;
1953
1954 if (!NIL_P(fptr->write_lock)) {
1955 return rb_mutex_synchronize(fptr->write_lock, io_binwritev_internal, (VALUE)&arg);
1956 }
1957 else {
1958 return io_binwritev_internal((VALUE)&arg);
1959 }
1960}
1961
1962static long
1963io_fwritev(int argc, const VALUE *argv, rb_io_t *fptr)
1964{
1965 int i, converted, iovcnt = argc + 1;
1966 long n;
1967 VALUE v1, v2, str, tmp, *tmp_array;
1968 struct iovec *iov;
1969
1970 iov = ALLOCV_N(struct iovec, v1, iovcnt);
1971 tmp_array = ALLOCV_N(VALUE, v2, argc);
1972
1973 for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
1974 str = rb_obj_as_string(argv[i]);
1975 converted = 0;
1976 str = do_writeconv(str, fptr, &converted);
1977
1978 if (converted)
1979 OBJ_FREEZE(str);
1980
1981 tmp = rb_str_tmp_frozen_acquire(str);
1982 tmp_array[i] = tmp;
1983
1984 /* iov[0] is reserved for buffer of fptr */
1985 iov[i+1].iov_base = RSTRING_PTR(tmp);
1986 iov[i+1].iov_len = RSTRING_LEN(tmp);
1987 }
1988
1989 n = io_binwritev(iov, iovcnt, fptr);
1990 if (v1) ALLOCV_END(v1);
1991
1992 for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
1993 rb_str_tmp_frozen_release(argv[i], tmp_array[i]);
1994 }
1995
1996 if (v2) ALLOCV_END(v2);
1997
1998 return n;
1999}
2000
2001static int
2002iovcnt_ok(int iovcnt)
2003{
2004#ifdef IOV_MAX
2005 return iovcnt < IOV_MAX;
2006#else /* GNU/Hurd has writev, but no IOV_MAX */
2007 return 1;
2008#endif
2009}
2010#endif /* HAVE_WRITEV */
2011
2012static VALUE
2013io_writev(int argc, const VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
2014{
2015 rb_io_t *fptr;
2016 long n;
2017 VALUE tmp, total = INT2FIX(0);
2018 int i, cnt = 1;
2019
2020 io = GetWriteIO(io);
2021 tmp = rb_io_check_io(io);
2022
2023 if (NIL_P(tmp)) {
2024 /* port is not IO, call write method for it. */
2025 return rb_funcallv(io, id_write, argc, argv);
2026 }
2027
2028 io = tmp;
2029
2030 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2031 rb_io_check_writable(fptr);
2032
2033 for (i = 0; i < argc; i += cnt) {
2034#ifdef HAVE_WRITEV
2035 if ((fptr->mode & (FMODE_SYNC|FMODE_TTY)) && iovcnt_ok(cnt = argc - i)) {
2036 n = io_fwritev(cnt, &argv[i], fptr);
2037 }
2038 else
2039#endif
2040 {
2041 cnt = 1;
2042 /* sync at last item */
2043 n = io_fwrite(rb_obj_as_string(argv[i]), fptr, (i < argc-1));
2044 }
2045
2046 if (n < 0L)
2047 rb_sys_fail_on_write(fptr);
2048
2049 total = rb_fix_plus(LONG2FIX(n), total);
2050 }
2051
2052 return total;
2053}
2054
2055/*
2056 * call-seq:
2057 * write(*objects) -> integer
2058 *
2059 * Writes each of the given +objects+ to +self+,
2060 * which must be opened for writing (see IO@Modes);
2061 * returns the total number bytes written;
2062 * each of +objects+ that is not a string is converted via method +to_s+:
2063 *
2064 * $stdout.write('Hello', ', ', 'World!', "\n") # => 14
2065 * $stdout.write('foo', :bar, 2, "\n") # => 8
2066 *
2067 * Output:
2068 *
2069 * Hello, World!
2070 * foobar2
2071 *
2072 */
2073
2074static VALUE
2075io_write_m(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
2076{
2077 if (argc != 1) {
2078 return io_writev(argc, argv, io);
2079 }
2080 else {
2081 VALUE str = argv[0];
2082 return io_write(io, str, 0);
2083 }
2084}
2085
2086VALUE
2087rb_io_write(VALUE io, VALUE str)
2088{
2089 return rb_funcallv(io, id_write, 1, &str);
2090}
2091
2092static VALUE
2093rb_io_writev(VALUE io, int argc, const VALUE *argv)
2094{
2095 if (argc > 1 && rb_obj_method_arity(io, id_write) == 1) {
2096 if (io != rb_ractor_stderr() && RTEST(ruby_verbose)) {
2097 VALUE klass = CLASS_OF(io);
2098 char sep = FL_TEST(klass, FL_SINGLETON) ? (klass = io, '.') : '#';
2099 rb_category_warning(
2100 RB_WARN_CATEGORY_DEPRECATED, "%+"PRIsVALUE"%c""write is outdated interface"
2101 " which accepts just one argument",
2102 klass, sep
2103 );
2104 }
2105
2106 do rb_io_write(io, *argv++); while (--argc);
2107
2108 return Qnil;
2109 }
2110
2111 return rb_funcallv(io, id_write, argc, argv);
2112}
2113
2114/*
2115 * call-seq:
2116 * self << object -> self
2117 *
2118 * Writes the given +object+ to +self+,
2119 * which must be opened for writing (see IO@Modes);
2120 * returns +self+;
2121 * if +object+ is not a string, it is converted via method +to_s+:
2122 *
2123 * $stdout << 'Hello' << ', ' << 'World!' << "\n"
2124 * $stdout << 'foo' << :bar << 2 << "\n"
2125 *
2126 * Output:
2127 *
2128 * Hello, World!
2129 * foobar2
2130 *
2131 */
2132
2133
2134VALUE
2135rb_io_addstr(VALUE io, VALUE str)
2136{
2137 rb_io_write(io, str);
2138 return io;
2139}
2140
2141#ifdef HAVE_FSYNC
2142static VALUE
2143nogvl_fsync(void *ptr)
2144{
2145 rb_io_t *fptr = ptr;
2146
2147#ifdef _WIN32
2148 if (GetFileType((HANDLE)rb_w32_get_osfhandle(fptr->fd)) != FILE_TYPE_DISK)
2149 return 0;
2150#endif
2151 return (VALUE)fsync(fptr->fd);
2152}
2153#endif
2154
2155VALUE
2156rb_io_flush_raw(VALUE io, int sync)
2157{
2158 rb_io_t *fptr;
2159
2160 if (!RB_TYPE_P(io, T_FILE)) {
2161 return rb_funcall(io, id_flush, 0);
2162 }
2163
2164 io = GetWriteIO(io);
2165 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2166
2167 if (fptr->mode & FMODE_WRITABLE) {
2168 if (io_fflush(fptr) < 0)
2169 rb_sys_fail_on_write(fptr);
2170 }
2171 if (fptr->mode & FMODE_READABLE) {
2172 io_unread(fptr);
2173 }
2174
2175 return io;
2176}
2177
2178/*
2179 * call-seq:
2180 * flush -> self
2181 *
2182 * Flushes data buffered in +self+ to the operating system
2183 * (but does not necessarily flush data buffered in the operating system):
2184 *
2185 * $stdout.print 'no newline' # Not necessarily flushed.
2186 * $stdout.flush # Flushed.
2187 *
2188 */
2189
2190VALUE
2191rb_io_flush(VALUE io)
2192{
2193 return rb_io_flush_raw(io, 1);
2194}
2195
2196/*
2197 * call-seq:
2198 * tell -> integer
2199 *
2200 * Returns the current position (in bytes) in +self+
2201 * (see {Position}[rdoc-ref:IO@Position]):
2202 *
2203 * f = File.open('t.txt')
2204 * f.tell # => 0
2205 * f.gets # => "First line\n"
2206 * f.tell # => 12
2207 * f.close
2208 *
2209 * Related: IO#pos=, IO#seek.
2210 *
2211 * IO#pos is an alias for IO#tell.
2212 *
2213 */
2214
2215static VALUE
2216rb_io_tell(VALUE io)
2217{
2218 rb_io_t *fptr;
2219 off_t pos;
2220
2221 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2222 pos = io_tell(fptr);
2223 if (pos < 0 && errno) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
2224 pos -= fptr->rbuf.len;
2225 return OFFT2NUM(pos);
2226}
2227
2228static VALUE
2229rb_io_seek(VALUE io, VALUE offset, int whence)
2230{
2231 rb_io_t *fptr;
2232 off_t pos;
2233
2234 pos = NUM2OFFT(offset);
2235 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2236 pos = io_seek(fptr, pos, whence);
2237 if (pos < 0 && errno) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
2238
2239 return INT2FIX(0);
2240}
2241
2242static int
2243interpret_seek_whence(VALUE vwhence)
2244{
2245 if (vwhence == sym_SET)
2246 return SEEK_SET;
2247 if (vwhence == sym_CUR)
2248 return SEEK_CUR;
2249 if (vwhence == sym_END)
2250 return SEEK_END;
2251#ifdef SEEK_DATA
2252 if (vwhence == sym_DATA)
2253 return SEEK_DATA;
2254#endif
2255#ifdef SEEK_HOLE
2256 if (vwhence == sym_HOLE)
2257 return SEEK_HOLE;
2258#endif
2259 return NUM2INT(vwhence);
2260}
2261
2262/*
2263 * call-seq:
2264 * seek(offset, whence = IO::SEEK_SET) -> 0
2265 *
2266 * Seeks to the position given by integer +offset+
2267 * (see {Position}[rdoc-ref:IO@Position])
2268 * and constant +whence+, which is one of:
2269 *
2270 * - +:CUR+ or <tt>IO::SEEK_CUR</tt>:
2271 * Repositions the stream to its current position plus the given +offset+:
2272 *
2273 * f = File.open('t.txt')
2274 * f.tell # => 0
2275 * f.seek(20, :CUR) # => 0
2276 * f.tell # => 20
2277 * f.seek(-10, :CUR) # => 0
2278 * f.tell # => 10
2279 * f.close
2280 *
2281 * - +:END+ or <tt>IO::SEEK_END</tt>:
2282 * Repositions the stream to its end plus the given +offset+:
2283 *
2284 * f = File.open('t.txt')
2285 * f.tell # => 0
2286 * f.seek(0, :END) # => 0 # Repositions to stream end.
2287 * f.tell # => 52
2288 * f.seek(-20, :END) # => 0
2289 * f.tell # => 32
2290 * f.seek(-40, :END) # => 0
2291 * f.tell # => 12
2292 * f.close
2293 *
2294 * - +:SET+ or <tt>IO:SEEK_SET</tt>:
2295 * Repositions the stream to the given +offset+:
2296 *
2297 * f = File.open('t.txt')
2298 * f.tell # => 0
2299 * f.seek(20, :SET) # => 0
2300 * f.tell # => 20
2301 * f.seek(40, :SET) # => 0
2302 * f.tell # => 40
2303 * f.close
2304 *
2305 * Related: IO#pos=, IO#tell.
2306 *
2307 */
2308
2309static VALUE
2310rb_io_seek_m(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
2311{
2312 VALUE offset, ptrname;
2313 int whence = SEEK_SET;
2314
2315 if (rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "11", &offset, &ptrname) == 2) {
2316 whence = interpret_seek_whence(ptrname);
2317 }
2318
2319 return rb_io_seek(io, offset, whence);
2320}
2321
2322/*
2323 * call-seq:
2324 * pos = new_position -> new_position
2325 *
2326 * Seeks to the given +new_position+ (in bytes);
2327 * see {Position}[rdoc-ref:IO@Position]:
2328 *
2329 * f = File.open('t.txt')
2330 * f.tell # => 0
2331 * f.pos = 20 # => 20
2332 * f.tell # => 20
2333 * f.close
2334 *
2335 * Related: IO#seek, IO#tell.
2336 *
2337 */
2338
2339static VALUE
2340rb_io_set_pos(VALUE io, VALUE offset)
2341{
2342 rb_io_t *fptr;
2343 off_t pos;
2344
2345 pos = NUM2OFFT(offset);
2346 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2347 pos = io_seek(fptr, pos, SEEK_SET);
2348 if (pos < 0 && errno) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
2349
2350 return OFFT2NUM(pos);
2351}
2352
2353static void clear_readconv(rb_io_t *fptr);
2354
2355/*
2356 * call-seq:
2357 * rewind -> 0
2358 *
2359 * Repositions the stream to its beginning,
2360 * setting both the position and the line number to zero;
2361 * see {Position}[rdoc-ref:IO@Position]
2362 * and {Line Number}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Number]:
2363 *
2364 * f = File.open('t.txt')
2365 * f.tell # => 0
2366 * f.lineno # => 0
2367 * f.gets # => "First line\n"
2368 * f.tell # => 12
2369 * f.lineno # => 1
2370 * f.rewind # => 0
2371 * f.tell # => 0
2372 * f.lineno # => 0
2373 * f.close
2374 *
2375 * Note that this method cannot be used with streams such as pipes, ttys, and sockets.
2376 *
2377 */
2378
2379static VALUE
2380rb_io_rewind(VALUE io)
2381{
2382 rb_io_t *fptr;
2383
2384 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2385 if (io_seek(fptr, 0L, 0) < 0 && errno) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
2386 if (io == ARGF.current_file) {
2387 ARGF.lineno -= fptr->lineno;
2388 }
2389 fptr->lineno = 0;
2390 if (fptr->readconv) {
2391 clear_readconv(fptr);
2392 }
2393
2394 return INT2FIX(0);
2395}
2396
2397static int
2398fptr_wait_readable(rb_io_t *fptr)
2399{
2400 int ret = rb_io_maybe_wait_readable(errno, fptr->self, Qnil);
2401
2402 if (ret)
2403 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
2404
2405 return ret;
2406}
2407
2408static int
2409io_fillbuf(rb_io_t *fptr)
2410{
2411 ssize_t r;
2412
2413 if (fptr->rbuf.ptr == NULL) {
2414 fptr->rbuf.off = 0;
2415 fptr->rbuf.len = 0;
2416 fptr->rbuf.capa = IO_RBUF_CAPA_FOR(fptr);
2417 fptr->rbuf.ptr = ALLOC_N(char, fptr->rbuf.capa);
2418#ifdef _WIN32
2419 fptr->rbuf.capa--;
2420#endif
2421 }
2422 if (fptr->rbuf.len == 0) {
2423 retry:
2424 r = rb_read_internal(fptr, fptr->rbuf.ptr, fptr->rbuf.capa);
2425
2426 if (r < 0) {
2427 if (fptr_wait_readable(fptr))
2428 goto retry;
2429
2430 int e = errno;
2431 VALUE path = rb_sprintf("fd:%d ", fptr->fd);
2432 if (!NIL_P(fptr->pathv)) {
2433 rb_str_append(path, fptr->pathv);
2434 }
2435
2436 rb_syserr_fail_path(e, path);
2437 }
2438 if (r > 0) rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
2439 fptr->rbuf.off = 0;
2440 fptr->rbuf.len = (int)r; /* r should be <= rbuf_capa */
2441 if (r == 0)
2442 return -1; /* EOF */
2443 }
2444 return 0;
2445}
2446
2447/*
2448 * call-seq:
2449 * eof -> true or false
2450 *
2451 * Returns +true+ if the stream is positioned at its end, +false+ otherwise;
2452 * see {Position}[rdoc-ref:IO@Position]:
2453 *
2454 * f = File.open('t.txt')
2455 * f.eof # => false
2456 * f.seek(0, :END) # => 0
2457 * f.eof # => true
2458 * f.close
2459 *
2460 * Raises an exception unless the stream is opened for reading;
2461 * see {Mode}[rdoc-ref:IO@Mode].
2462 *
2463 * If +self+ is a stream such as pipe or socket, this method
2464 * blocks until the other end sends some data or closes it:
2465 *
2466 * r, w = IO.pipe
2467 * Thread.new { sleep 1; w.close }
2468 * r.eof? # => true # After 1-second wait.
2469 *
2470 * r, w = IO.pipe
2471 * Thread.new { sleep 1; w.puts "a" }
2472 * r.eof? # => false # After 1-second wait.
2473 *
2474 * r, w = IO.pipe
2475 * r.eof? # blocks forever
2476 *
2477 * Note that this method reads data to the input byte buffer. So
2478 * IO#sysread may not behave as you intend with IO#eof?, unless you
2479 * call IO#rewind first (which is not available for some streams).
2480 *
2481 * I#eof? is an alias for IO#eof.
2482 *
2483 */
2484
2485VALUE
2486rb_io_eof(VALUE io)
2487{
2488 rb_io_t *fptr;
2489
2490 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2491 rb_io_check_char_readable(fptr);
2492
2493 if (READ_CHAR_PENDING(fptr)) return Qfalse;
2494 if (READ_DATA_PENDING(fptr)) return Qfalse;
2495 READ_CHECK(fptr);
2496#if RUBY_CRLF_ENVIRONMENT
2497 if (!NEED_READCONV(fptr) && NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ(fptr)) {
2498 return RBOOL(eof(fptr->fd));;
2499 }
2500#endif
2501 return RBOOL(io_fillbuf(fptr) < 0);
2502}
2503
2504/*
2505 * call-seq:
2506 * sync -> true or false
2507 *
2508 * Returns the current sync mode of the stream.
2509 * When sync mode is true, all output is immediately flushed to the underlying
2510 * operating system and is not buffered by Ruby internally. See also #fsync.
2511 *
2512 * f = File.open('t.tmp', 'w')
2513 * f.sync # => false
2514 * f.sync = true
2515 * f.sync # => true
2516 * f.close
2517 *
2518 */
2519
2520static VALUE
2521rb_io_sync(VALUE io)
2522{
2523 rb_io_t *fptr;
2524
2525 io = GetWriteIO(io);
2526 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2527 return RBOOL(fptr->mode & FMODE_SYNC);
2528}
2529
2530#ifdef HAVE_FSYNC
2531
2532/*
2533 * call-seq:
2534 * sync = boolean -> boolean
2535 *
2536 * Sets the _sync_ _mode_ for the stream to the given value;
2537 * returns the given value.
2538 *
2539 * Values for the sync mode:
2540 *
2541 * - +true+: All output is immediately flushed to the
2542 * underlying operating system and is not buffered internally.
2543 * - +false+: Output may be buffered internally.
2544 *
2545 * Example;
2546 *
2547 * f = File.open('t.tmp', 'w')
2548 * f.sync # => false
2549 * f.sync = true
2550 * f.sync # => true
2551 * f.close
2552 *
2553 * Related: IO#fsync.
2554 *
2555 */
2556
2557static VALUE
2558rb_io_set_sync(VALUE io, VALUE sync)
2559{
2560 rb_io_t *fptr;
2561
2562 io = GetWriteIO(io);
2563 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2564 if (RTEST(sync)) {
2565 fptr->mode |= FMODE_SYNC;
2566 }
2567 else {
2568 fptr->mode &= ~FMODE_SYNC;
2569 }
2570 return sync;
2571}
2572
2573/*
2574 * call-seq:
2575 * fsync -> 0
2576 *
2577 * Immediately writes to disk all data buffered in the stream,
2578 * via the operating system's <tt>fsync(2)</tt>.
2579
2580 * Note this difference:
2581 *
2582 * - IO#sync=: Ensures that data is flushed from the stream's internal buffers,
2583 * but does not guarantee that the operating system actually writes the data to disk.
2584 * - IO#fsync: Ensures both that data is flushed from internal buffers,
2585 * and that data is written to disk.
2586 *
2587 * Raises an exception if the operating system does not support <tt>fsync(2)</tt>.
2588 *
2589 */
2590
2591static VALUE
2592rb_io_fsync(VALUE io)
2593{
2594 rb_io_t *fptr;
2595
2596 io = GetWriteIO(io);
2597 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2598
2599 if (io_fflush(fptr) < 0)
2600 rb_sys_fail_on_write(fptr);
2601 if ((int)rb_thread_io_blocking_region(nogvl_fsync, fptr, fptr->fd) < 0)
2602 rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
2603 return INT2FIX(0);
2604}
2605#else
2606# define rb_io_fsync rb_f_notimplement
2607# define rb_io_sync rb_f_notimplement
2608static VALUE
2609rb_io_set_sync(VALUE io, VALUE sync)
2610{
2611 rb_notimplement();
2612 UNREACHABLE;
2613}
2614#endif
2615
2616#ifdef HAVE_FDATASYNC
2617static VALUE
2618nogvl_fdatasync(void *ptr)
2619{
2620 rb_io_t *fptr = ptr;
2621
2622#ifdef _WIN32
2623 if (GetFileType((HANDLE)rb_w32_get_osfhandle(fptr->fd)) != FILE_TYPE_DISK)
2624 return 0;
2625#endif
2626 return (VALUE)fdatasync(fptr->fd);
2627}
2628
2629/*
2630 * call-seq:
2631 * fdatasync -> 0
2632 *
2633 * Immediately writes to disk all data buffered in the stream,
2634 * via the operating system's: <tt>fdatasync(2)</tt>, if supported,
2635 * otherwise via <tt>fsync(2)</tt>, if supported;
2636 * otherwise raises an exception.
2637 *
2638 */
2639
2640static VALUE
2641rb_io_fdatasync(VALUE io)
2642{
2643 rb_io_t *fptr;
2644
2645 io = GetWriteIO(io);
2646 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2647
2648 if (io_fflush(fptr) < 0)
2649 rb_sys_fail_on_write(fptr);
2650
2651 if ((int)rb_thread_io_blocking_region(nogvl_fdatasync, fptr, fptr->fd) == 0)
2652 return INT2FIX(0);
2653
2654 /* fall back */
2655 return rb_io_fsync(io);
2656}
2657#else
2658#define rb_io_fdatasync rb_io_fsync
2659#endif
2660
2661/*
2662 * call-seq:
2663 * fileno -> integer
2664 *
2665 * Returns the integer file descriptor for the stream:
2666 *
2667 * $stdin.fileno # => 0
2668 * $stdout.fileno # => 1
2669 * $stderr.fileno # => 2
2670 * File.open('t.txt').fileno # => 10
2671 * f.close
2672 *
2673 * IO#to_i is an alias for IO#fileno.
2674 *
2675 */
2676
2677static VALUE
2678rb_io_fileno(VALUE io)
2679{
2680 rb_io_t *fptr = RFILE(io)->fptr;
2681 int fd;
2682
2683 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
2684 fd = fptr->fd;
2685 return INT2FIX(fd);
2686}
2687
2688int
2689rb_io_descriptor(VALUE io)
2690{
2691 if (RB_TYPE_P(io, T_FILE)) {
2692 rb_io_t *fptr = RFILE(io)->fptr;
2693 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
2694 return fptr->fd;
2695 }
2696 else {
2697 return RB_NUM2INT(rb_funcall(io, id_fileno, 0));
2698 }
2699}
2700
2701/*
2702 * call-seq:
2703 * pid -> integer or nil
2704 *
2705 * Returns the process ID of a child process associated with the stream,
2706 * which will have been set by IO#popen, or +nil+ if the stream was not
2707 * created by IO#popen:
2708 *
2709 * pipe = IO.popen("-")
2710 * if pipe
2711 * $stderr.puts "In parent, child pid is #{pipe.pid}"
2712 * else
2713 * $stderr.puts "In child, pid is #{$$}"
2714 * end
2715 *
2716 * Output:
2717 *
2718 * In child, pid is 26209
2719 * In parent, child pid is 26209
2720 *
2721 */
2722
2723static VALUE
2724rb_io_pid(VALUE io)
2725{
2726 rb_io_t *fptr;
2727
2728 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
2729 if (!fptr->pid)
2730 return Qnil;
2731 return PIDT2NUM(fptr->pid);
2732}
2733
2734
2735/*
2736 * call-seq:
2737 * inspect -> string
2738 *
2739 * Returns a string representation of +self+:
2740 *
2741 * f = File.open('t.txt')
2742 * f.inspect # => "#<File:t.txt>"
2743 * f.close
2744 *
2745 */
2746
2747static VALUE
2748rb_io_inspect(VALUE obj)
2749{
2750 rb_io_t *fptr;
2751 VALUE result;
2752 static const char closed[] = " (closed)";
2753
2754 fptr = RFILE(obj)->fptr;
2755 if (!fptr) return rb_any_to_s(obj);
2756 result = rb_str_new_cstr("#<");
2757 rb_str_append(result, rb_class_name(CLASS_OF(obj)));
2758 rb_str_cat2(result, ":");
2759 if (NIL_P(fptr->pathv)) {
2760 if (fptr->fd < 0) {
2761 rb_str_cat(result, closed+1, strlen(closed)-1);
2762 }
2763 else {
2764 rb_str_catf(result, "fd %d", fptr->fd);
2765 }
2766 }
2767 else {
2768 rb_str_append(result, fptr->pathv);
2769 if (fptr->fd < 0) {
2770 rb_str_cat(result, closed, strlen(closed));
2771 }
2772 }
2773 return rb_str_cat2(result, ">");
2774}
2775
2776/*
2777 * call-seq:
2778 * to_io -> self
2779 *
2780 * Returns +self+.
2781 *
2782 */
2783
2784static VALUE
2785rb_io_to_io(VALUE io)
2786{
2787 return io;
2788}
2789
2790/* reading functions */
2791static long
2792read_buffered_data(char *ptr, long len, rb_io_t *fptr)
2793{
2794 int n;
2795
2796 n = READ_DATA_PENDING_COUNT(fptr);
2797 if (n <= 0) return 0;
2798 if (n > len) n = (int)len;
2799 MEMMOVE(ptr, fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off, char, n);
2800 fptr->rbuf.off += n;
2801 fptr->rbuf.len -= n;
2802 return n;
2803}
2804
2805static long
2806io_bufread(char *ptr, long len, rb_io_t *fptr)
2807{
2808 long offset = 0;
2809 long n = len;
2810 long c;
2811
2812 if (READ_DATA_PENDING(fptr) == 0) {
2813 while (n > 0) {
2814 again:
2815 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
2816 c = rb_read_internal(fptr, ptr+offset, n);
2817 if (c == 0) break;
2818 if (c < 0) {
2819 if (fptr_wait_readable(fptr))
2820 goto again;
2821 return -1;
2822 }
2823 offset += c;
2824 if ((n -= c) <= 0) break;
2825 }
2826 return len - n;
2827 }
2828
2829 while (n > 0) {
2830 c = read_buffered_data(ptr+offset, n, fptr);
2831 if (c > 0) {
2832 offset += c;
2833 if ((n -= c) <= 0) break;
2834 }
2835 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
2836 if (io_fillbuf(fptr) < 0) {
2837 break;
2838 }
2839 }
2840 return len - n;
2841}
2842
2843static int io_setstrbuf(VALUE *str, long len);
2844
2845struct bufread_arg {
2846 char *str_ptr;
2847 long len;
2848 rb_io_t *fptr;
2849};
2850
2851static VALUE
2852bufread_call(VALUE arg)
2853{
2854 struct bufread_arg *p = (struct bufread_arg *)arg;
2855 p->len = io_bufread(p->str_ptr, p->len, p->fptr);
2856 return Qundef;
2857}
2858
2859static long
2860io_fread(VALUE str, long offset, long size, rb_io_t *fptr)
2861{
2862 long len;
2863 struct bufread_arg arg;
2864
2865 io_setstrbuf(&str, offset + size);
2866 arg.str_ptr = RSTRING_PTR(str) + offset;
2867 arg.len = size;
2868 arg.fptr = fptr;
2869 rb_str_locktmp_ensure(str, bufread_call, (VALUE)&arg);
2870 len = arg.len;
2871 if (len < 0) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
2872 return len;
2873}
2874
2875static long
2876remain_size(rb_io_t *fptr)
2877{
2878 struct stat st;
2879 off_t siz = READ_DATA_PENDING_COUNT(fptr);
2880 off_t pos;
2881
2882 if (fstat(fptr->fd, &st) == 0 && S_ISREG(st.st_mode)
2883#if defined(__HAIKU__)
2884 && (st.st_dev > 3)
2885#endif
2886 )
2887 {
2888 if (io_fflush(fptr) < 0)
2889 rb_sys_fail_on_write(fptr);
2890 pos = lseek(fptr->fd, 0, SEEK_CUR);
2891 if (st.st_size >= pos && pos >= 0) {
2892 siz += st.st_size - pos;
2893 if (siz > LONG_MAX) {
2894 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "file too big for single read");
2895 }
2896 }
2897 }
2898 else {
2899 siz += BUFSIZ;
2900 }
2901 return (long)siz;
2902}
2903
2904static VALUE
2905io_enc_str(VALUE str, rb_io_t *fptr)
2906{
2907 rb_enc_associate(str, io_read_encoding(fptr));
2908 return str;
2909}
2910
2911static void
2912make_readconv(rb_io_t *fptr, int size)
2913{
2914 if (!fptr->readconv) {
2915 int ecflags;
2916 VALUE ecopts;
2917 const char *sname, *dname;
2918 ecflags = fptr->encs.ecflags & ~ECONV_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_WRITE_MASK;
2919 ecopts = fptr->encs.ecopts;
2920 if (fptr->encs.enc2) {
2921 sname = rb_enc_name(fptr->encs.enc2);
2922 dname = rb_enc_name(fptr->encs.enc);
2923 }
2924 else {
2925 sname = dname = "";
2926 }
2927 fptr->readconv = rb_econv_open_opts(sname, dname, ecflags, ecopts);
2928 if (!fptr->readconv)
2929 rb_exc_raise(rb_econv_open_exc(sname, dname, ecflags));
2930 fptr->cbuf.off = 0;
2931 fptr->cbuf.len = 0;
2932 if (size < IO_CBUF_CAPA_MIN) size = IO_CBUF_CAPA_MIN;
2933 fptr->cbuf.capa = size;
2934 fptr->cbuf.ptr = ALLOC_N(char, fptr->cbuf.capa);
2935 }
2936}
2937
2938#define MORE_CHAR_SUSPENDED Qtrue
2939#define MORE_CHAR_FINISHED Qnil
2940static VALUE
2941fill_cbuf(rb_io_t *fptr, int ec_flags)
2942{
2943 const unsigned char *ss, *sp, *se;
2944 unsigned char *ds, *dp, *de;
2945 rb_econv_result_t res;
2946 int putbackable;
2947 int cbuf_len0;
2948 VALUE exc;
2949
2950 ec_flags |= ECONV_PARTIAL_INPUT;
2951
2952 if (fptr->cbuf.len == fptr->cbuf.capa)
2953 return MORE_CHAR_SUSPENDED; /* cbuf full */
2954 if (fptr->cbuf.len == 0)
2955 fptr->cbuf.off = 0;
2956 else if (fptr->cbuf.off + fptr->cbuf.len == fptr->cbuf.capa) {
2957 memmove(fptr->cbuf.ptr, fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off, fptr->cbuf.len);
2958 fptr->cbuf.off = 0;
2959 }
2960
2961 cbuf_len0 = fptr->cbuf.len;
2962
2963 while (1) {
2964 ss = sp = (const unsigned char *)fptr->rbuf.ptr + fptr->rbuf.off;
2965 se = sp + fptr->rbuf.len;
2966 ds = dp = (unsigned char *)fptr->cbuf.ptr + fptr->cbuf.off + fptr->cbuf.len;
2967 de = (unsigned char *)fptr->cbuf.ptr + fptr->cbuf.capa;
2968 res = rb_econv_convert(fptr->readconv, &sp, se, &dp, de, ec_flags);
2969 fptr->rbuf.off += (int)(sp - ss);
2970 fptr->rbuf.len -= (int)(sp - ss);
2971 fptr->cbuf.len += (int)(dp - ds);
2972
2973 putbackable = rb_econv_putbackable(fptr->readconv);
2974 if (putbackable) {
2975 rb_econv_putback(fptr->readconv, (unsigned char *)fptr->rbuf.ptr + fptr->rbuf.off - putbackable, putbackable);
2976 fptr->rbuf.off -= putbackable;
2977 fptr->rbuf.len += putbackable;
2978 }
2979
2980 exc = rb_econv_make_exception(fptr->readconv);
2981 if (!NIL_P(exc))
2982 return exc;
2983
2984 if (cbuf_len0 != fptr->cbuf.len)
2985 return MORE_CHAR_SUSPENDED;
2986
2987 if (res == econv_finished) {
2988 return MORE_CHAR_FINISHED;
2989 }
2990
2991 if (res == econv_source_buffer_empty) {
2992 if (fptr->rbuf.len == 0) {
2993 READ_CHECK(fptr);
2994 if (io_fillbuf(fptr) < 0) {
2995 if (!fptr->readconv) {
2996 return MORE_CHAR_FINISHED;
2997 }
2998 ds = dp = (unsigned char *)fptr->cbuf.ptr + fptr->cbuf.off + fptr->cbuf.len;
2999 de = (unsigned char *)fptr->cbuf.ptr + fptr->cbuf.capa;
3000 res = rb_econv_convert(fptr->readconv, NULL, NULL, &dp, de, 0);
3001 fptr->cbuf.len += (int)(dp - ds);
3002 rb_econv_check_error(fptr->readconv);
3003 break;
3004 }
3005 }
3006 }
3007 }
3008 if (cbuf_len0 != fptr->cbuf.len)
3009 return MORE_CHAR_SUSPENDED;
3010
3011 return MORE_CHAR_FINISHED;
3012}
3013
3014static VALUE
3015more_char(rb_io_t *fptr)
3016{
3017 VALUE v;
3018 v = fill_cbuf(fptr, ECONV_AFTER_OUTPUT);
3019 if (v != MORE_CHAR_SUSPENDED && v != MORE_CHAR_FINISHED)
3020 rb_exc_raise(v);
3021 return v;
3022}
3023
3024static VALUE
3025io_shift_cbuf(rb_io_t *fptr, int len, VALUE *strp)
3026{
3027 VALUE str = Qnil;
3028 if (strp) {
3029 str = *strp;
3030 if (NIL_P(str)) {
3031 *strp = str = rb_str_new(fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off, len);
3032 }
3033 else {
3034 rb_str_cat(str, fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off, len);
3035 }
3036 rb_enc_associate(str, fptr->encs.enc);
3037 }
3038 fptr->cbuf.off += len;
3039 fptr->cbuf.len -= len;
3040 /* xxx: set coderange */
3041 if (fptr->cbuf.len == 0)
3042 fptr->cbuf.off = 0;
3043 else if (fptr->cbuf.capa/2 < fptr->cbuf.off) {
3044 memmove(fptr->cbuf.ptr, fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off, fptr->cbuf.len);
3045 fptr->cbuf.off = 0;
3046 }
3047 return str;
3048}
3049
3050static int
3051io_setstrbuf(VALUE *str, long len)
3052{
3053#ifdef _WIN32
3054 len = (len + 1) & ~1L; /* round up for wide char */
3055#endif
3056 if (NIL_P(*str)) {
3057 *str = rb_str_new(0, len);
3058 return TRUE;
3059 }
3060 else {
3061 VALUE s = StringValue(*str);
3062 long clen = RSTRING_LEN(s);
3063 if (clen >= len) {
3064 rb_str_modify(s);
3065 return FALSE;
3066 }
3067 len -= clen;
3068 }
3069 rb_str_modify_expand(*str, len);
3070 return FALSE;
3071}
3072
3073#define MAX_REALLOC_GAP 4096
3074static void
3075io_shrink_read_string(VALUE str, long n)
3076{
3077 if (rb_str_capacity(str) - n > MAX_REALLOC_GAP) {
3078 rb_str_resize(str, n);
3079 }
3080}
3081
3082static void
3083io_set_read_length(VALUE str, long n, int shrinkable)
3084{
3085 if (RSTRING_LEN(str) != n) {
3086 rb_str_modify(str);
3087 rb_str_set_len(str, n);
3088 if (shrinkable) io_shrink_read_string(str, n);
3089 }
3090}
3091
3092static VALUE
3093read_all(rb_io_t *fptr, long siz, VALUE str)
3094{
3095 long bytes;
3096 long n;
3097 long pos;
3098 rb_encoding *enc;
3099 int cr;
3100 int shrinkable;
3101
3102 if (NEED_READCONV(fptr)) {
3103 int first = !NIL_P(str);
3104 SET_BINARY_MODE(fptr);
3105 shrinkable = io_setstrbuf(&str,0);
3106 make_readconv(fptr, 0);
3107 while (1) {
3108 VALUE v;
3109 if (fptr->cbuf.len) {
3110 if (first) rb_str_set_len(str, first = 0);
3111 io_shift_cbuf(fptr, fptr->cbuf.len, &str);
3112 }
3113 v = fill_cbuf(fptr, 0);
3114 if (v != MORE_CHAR_SUSPENDED && v != MORE_CHAR_FINISHED) {
3115 if (fptr->cbuf.len) {
3116 if (first) rb_str_set_len(str, first = 0);
3117 io_shift_cbuf(fptr, fptr->cbuf.len, &str);
3118 }
3119 rb_exc_raise(v);
3120 }
3121 if (v == MORE_CHAR_FINISHED) {
3122 clear_readconv(fptr);
3123 if (first) rb_str_set_len(str, first = 0);
3124 if (shrinkable) io_shrink_read_string(str, RSTRING_LEN(str));
3125 return io_enc_str(str, fptr);
3126 }
3127 }
3128 }
3129
3130 NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ_CHECK(fptr);
3131 bytes = 0;
3132 pos = 0;
3133
3134 enc = io_read_encoding(fptr);
3135 cr = 0;
3136
3137 if (siz == 0) siz = BUFSIZ;
3138 shrinkable = io_setstrbuf(&str, siz);
3139 for (;;) {
3140 READ_CHECK(fptr);
3141 n = io_fread(str, bytes, siz - bytes, fptr);
3142 if (n == 0 && bytes == 0) {
3143 rb_str_set_len(str, 0);
3144 break;
3145 }
3146 bytes += n;
3147 rb_str_set_len(str, bytes);
3148 if (cr != ENC_CODERANGE_BROKEN)
3149 pos += rb_str_coderange_scan_restartable(RSTRING_PTR(str) + pos, RSTRING_PTR(str) + bytes, enc, &cr);
3150 if (bytes < siz) break;
3151 siz += BUFSIZ;
3152 rb_str_modify_expand(str, BUFSIZ);
3153 }
3154 if (shrinkable) io_shrink_read_string(str, RSTRING_LEN(str));
3155 str = io_enc_str(str, fptr);
3156 ENC_CODERANGE_SET(str, cr);
3157 return str;
3158}
3159
3160void
3161rb_io_set_nonblock(rb_io_t *fptr)
3162{
3163 if (rb_fd_set_nonblock(fptr->fd) != 0) {
3164 rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
3165 }
3166}
3167
3168static VALUE
3169read_internal_call(VALUE arg)
3170{
3171 struct io_internal_read_struct *iis = (struct io_internal_read_struct *)arg;
3172
3173 VALUE scheduler = rb_fiber_scheduler_current();
3174 if (scheduler != Qnil) {
3175 VALUE result = rb_fiber_scheduler_io_read_memory(scheduler, iis->fptr->self, iis->buf, iis->capa, 0);
3176
3177 if (result != Qundef) {
3178 // This is actually returned as a pseudo-VALUE and later cast to a long:
3179 return (VALUE)rb_fiber_scheduler_io_result_apply(result);
3180 }
3181 }
3182
3183 return rb_thread_io_blocking_region(internal_read_func, iis, iis->fptr->fd);
3184}
3185
3186static long
3187read_internal_locktmp(VALUE str, struct io_internal_read_struct *iis)
3188{
3189 return (long)rb_str_locktmp_ensure(str, read_internal_call, (VALUE)iis);
3190}
3191
3192#define no_exception_p(opts) !rb_opts_exception_p((opts), TRUE)
3193
3194static VALUE
3195io_getpartial(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io, int no_exception, int nonblock)
3196{
3197 rb_io_t *fptr;
3198 VALUE length, str;
3199 long n, len;
3200 struct io_internal_read_struct iis;
3201 int shrinkable;
3202
3203 rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "11", &length, &str);
3204
3205 if ((len = NUM2LONG(length)) < 0) {
3206 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "negative length %ld given", len);
3207 }
3208
3209 shrinkable = io_setstrbuf(&str, len);
3210
3211 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
3212 rb_io_check_byte_readable(fptr);
3213
3214 if (len == 0) {
3215 io_set_read_length(str, 0, shrinkable);
3216 return str;
3217 }
3218
3219 if (!nonblock)
3220 READ_CHECK(fptr);
3221 n = read_buffered_data(RSTRING_PTR(str), len, fptr);
3222 if (n <= 0) {
3223 again:
3224 if (nonblock) {
3225 rb_io_set_nonblock(fptr);
3226 }
3227 io_setstrbuf(&str, len);
3228 iis.th = rb_thread_current();
3229 iis.fptr = fptr;
3230 iis.nonblock = nonblock;
3231 iis.buf = RSTRING_PTR(str);
3232 iis.capa = len;
3233 n = read_internal_locktmp(str, &iis);
3234 if (n < 0) {
3235 int e = errno;
3236 if (!nonblock && fptr_wait_readable(fptr))
3237 goto again;
3238 if (nonblock && (io_again_p(e))) {
3239 if (no_exception)
3240 return sym_wait_readable;
3241 else
3242 rb_readwrite_syserr_fail(RB_IO_WAIT_READABLE,
3243 e, "read would block");
3244 }
3245 rb_syserr_fail_path(e, fptr->pathv);
3246 }
3247 }
3248 io_set_read_length(str, n, shrinkable);
3249
3250 if (n == 0)
3251 return Qnil;
3252 else
3253 return str;
3254}
3255
3256/*
3257 * call-seq:
3258 * readpartial(maxlen) -> string
3259 * readpartial(maxlen, out_string) -> out_string
3260 *
3261 * Reads up to +maxlen+ bytes from the stream;
3262 * returns a string (either a new string or the given +out_string+).
3263 * Its encoding is:
3264 *
3265 * - The unchanged encoding of +out_string+, if +out_string+ is given.
3266 * - ASCII-8BIT, otherwise.
3267 *
3268 * - Contains +maxlen+ bytes from the stream, if available.
3269 * - Otherwise contains all available bytes, if any available.
3270 * - Otherwise is an empty string.
3271 *
3272 * With the single non-negative integer argument +maxlen+ given,
3273 * returns a new string:
3274 *
3275 * f = File.new('t.txt')
3276 * f.readpartial(20) # => "First line\nSecond l"
3277 * f.readpartial(20) # => "ine\n\nFourth line\n"
3278 * f.readpartial(20) # => "Fifth line\n"
3279 * f.readpartial(20) # Raises EOFError.
3280 * f.close
3281 *
3282 * With both argument +maxlen+ and string argument +out_string+ given,
3283 * returns modified +out_string+:
3284 *
3285 * f = File.new('t.txt')
3286 * s = 'foo'
3287 * f.readpartial(20, s) # => "First line\nSecond l"
3288 * s = 'bar'
3289 * f.readpartial(0, s) # => ""
3290 * f.close
3291 *
3292 * This method is useful for a stream such as a pipe, a socket, or a tty.
3293 * It blocks only when no data is immediately available.
3294 * This means that it blocks only when _all_ of the following are true:
3295 *
3296 * - The byte buffer in the stream is empty.
3297 * - The content of the stream is empty.
3298 * - The stream is not at EOF.
3299 *
3300 * When blocked, the method waits for either more data or EOF on the stream:
3301 *
3302 * - If more data is read, the method returns the data.
3303 * - If EOF is reached, the method raises EOFError.
3304 *
3305 * When not blocked, the method responds immediately:
3306 *
3307 * - Returns data from the buffer if there is any.
3308 * - Otherwise returns data from the stream if there is any.
3309 * - Otherwise raises EOFError if the stream has reached EOF.
3310 *
3311 * Note that this method is similar to sysread. The differences are:
3312 *
3313 * - If the byte buffer is not empty, read from the byte buffer
3314 * instead of "sysread for buffered IO (IOError)".
3315 * - It doesn't cause Errno::EWOULDBLOCK and Errno::EINTR. When
3316 * readpartial meets EWOULDBLOCK and EINTR by read system call,
3317 * readpartial retries the system call.
3318 *
3319 * The latter means that readpartial is non-blocking-flag insensitive.
3320 * It blocks on the situation IO#sysread causes Errno::EWOULDBLOCK as
3321 * if the fd is blocking mode.
3322 *
3323 * Examples:
3324 *
3325 * # # Returned Buffer Content Pipe Content
3326 * r, w = IO.pipe #
3327 * w << 'abc' # "" "abc".
3328 * r.readpartial(4096) # => "abc" "" ""
3329 * r.readpartial(4096) # (Blocks because buffer and pipe are empty.)
3330 *
3331 * # # Returned Buffer Content Pipe Content
3332 * r, w = IO.pipe #
3333 * w << 'abc' # "" "abc"
3334 * w.close # "" "abc" EOF
3335 * r.readpartial(4096) # => "abc" "" EOF
3336 * r.readpartial(4096) # raises EOFError
3337 *
3338 * # # Returned Buffer Content Pipe Content
3339 * r, w = IO.pipe #
3340 * w << "abc\ndef\n" # "" "abc\ndef\n"
3341 * r.gets # => "abc\n" "def\n" ""
3342 * w << "ghi\n" # "def\n" "ghi\n"
3343 * r.readpartial(4096) # => "def\n" "" "ghi\n"
3344 * r.readpartial(4096) # => "ghi\n" "" ""
3345 *
3346 */
3347
3348static VALUE
3349io_readpartial(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
3350{
3351 VALUE ret;
3352
3353 ret = io_getpartial(argc, argv, io, Qnil, 0);
3354 if (NIL_P(ret))
3355 rb_eof_error();
3356 return ret;
3357}
3358
3359static VALUE
3360io_nonblock_eof(int no_exception)
3361{
3362 if (!no_exception) {
3363 rb_eof_error();
3364 }
3365 return Qnil;
3366}
3367
3368/* :nodoc: */
3369static VALUE
3370io_read_nonblock(rb_execution_context_t *ec, VALUE io, VALUE length, VALUE str, VALUE ex)
3371{
3372 rb_io_t *fptr;
3373 long n, len;
3374 struct io_internal_read_struct iis;
3375 int shrinkable;
3376
3377 if ((len = NUM2LONG(length)) < 0) {
3378 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "negative length %ld given", len);
3379 }
3380
3381 shrinkable = io_setstrbuf(&str, len);
3382 rb_bool_expected(ex, "exception");
3383
3384 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
3385 rb_io_check_byte_readable(fptr);
3386
3387 if (len == 0) {
3388 io_set_read_length(str, 0, shrinkable);
3389 return str;
3390 }
3391
3392 n = read_buffered_data(RSTRING_PTR(str), len, fptr);
3393 if (n <= 0) {
3394 rb_io_set_nonblock(fptr);
3395 shrinkable |= io_setstrbuf(&str, len);
3396 iis.fptr = fptr;
3397 iis.nonblock = 1;
3398 iis.buf = RSTRING_PTR(str);
3399 iis.capa = len;
