3400 n = read_internal_locktmp(str, &iis);
3401 if (n < 0) {
3402 int e = errno;
3403 if (io_again_p(e)) {
3404 if (!ex) return sym_wait_readable;
3405 rb_readwrite_syserr_fail(RB_IO_WAIT_READABLE,
3406 e, "read would block");
3407 }
3408 rb_syserr_fail_path(e, fptr->pathv);
3409 }
3410 }
3411 io_set_read_length(str, n, shrinkable);
3412
3413 if (n == 0) {
3414 if (!ex) return Qnil;
3415 rb_eof_error();
3416 }
3417
3418 return str;
3419}
3420
3421/* :nodoc: */
3422static VALUE
3423io_write_nonblock(rb_execution_context_t *ec, VALUE io, VALUE str, VALUE ex)
3424{
3425 rb_io_t *fptr;
3426 long n;
3427
3428 if (!RB_TYPE_P(str, T_STRING))
3429 str = rb_obj_as_string(str);
3430 rb_bool_expected(ex, "exception");
3431
3432 io = GetWriteIO(io);
3433 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
3434 rb_io_check_writable(fptr);
3435
3436 if (io_fflush(fptr) < 0)
3437 rb_sys_fail_on_write(fptr);
3438
3439 rb_io_set_nonblock(fptr);
3440 n = write(fptr->fd, RSTRING_PTR(str), RSTRING_LEN(str));
3441 RB_GC_GUARD(str);
3442
3443 if (n < 0) {
3444 int e = errno;
3445 if (io_again_p(e)) {
3446 if (!ex) {
3447 return sym_wait_writable;
3448 }
3449 else {
3450 rb_readwrite_syserr_fail(RB_IO_WAIT_WRITABLE, e, "write would block");
3451 }
3452 }
3453 rb_syserr_fail_path(e, fptr->pathv);
3454 }
3455
3456 return LONG2FIX(n);
3457}
3458
3459/*
3460 * call-seq:
3461 * read(maxlen = nil) -> string or nil
3462 * read(maxlen = nil, out_string) -> out_string or nil
3463 *
3464 * Reads bytes from the stream (in binary mode):
3465 *
3466 * - If +maxlen+ is +nil+, reads all bytes.
3467 * - Otherwise reads +maxlen+ bytes, if available.
3468 * - Otherwise reads all bytes.
3469 *
3470 * Returns a string (either a new string or the given +out_string+)
3471 * containing the bytes read.
3472 * The encoding of the string depends on both +maxLen+ and +out_string+:
3473 *
3474 * - +maxlen+ is +nil+: uses internal encoding of +self+
3475 * (regardless of whether +out_string+ was given).
3476 * - +maxlen+ not +nil+:
3477 *
3478 * - +out_string+ given: encoding of +out_string+ not modified.
3479 * - +out_string+ not given: ASCII-8BIT is used.
3480 *
3481 * <b>Without Argument +out_string+</b>
3482 *
3483 * When argument +out_string+ is omitted,
3484 * the returned value is a new string:
3485 *
3486 * f = File.new('t.txt')
3487 * f.read
3488 * # => "First line\nSecond line\n\nFourth line\nFifth line\n"
3489 * f.rewind
3490 * f.read(30) # => "First line\r\nSecond line\r\n\r\nFou"
3491 * f.read(30) # => "rth line\r\nFifth line\r\n"
3492 * f.read(30) # => nil
3493 * f.close
3494 *
3495 * If +maxlen+ is zero, returns an empty string.
3496 *
3497 * <b> With Argument +out_string+</b>
3498 *
3499 * When argument +out_string+ is given,
3500 * the returned value is +out_string+, whose content is replaced:
3501 *
3502 * f = File.new('t.txt')
3503 * s = 'foo' # => "foo"
3504 * f.read(nil, s) # => "First line\nSecond line\n\nFourth line\nFifth line\n"
3505 * s # => "First line\nSecond line\n\nFourth line\nFifth line\n"
3506 * f.rewind
3507 * s = 'bar'
3508 * f.read(30, s) # => "First line\r\nSecond line\r\n\r\nFou"
3509 * s # => "First line\r\nSecond line\r\n\r\nFou"
3510 * s = 'baz'
3511 * f.read(30, s) # => "rth line\r\nFifth line\r\n"
3512 * s # => "rth line\r\nFifth line\r\n"
3513 * s = 'bat'
3514 * f.read(30, s) # => nil
3515 * s # => ""
3516 * f.close
3517 *
3518 * Note that this method behaves like the fread() function in C.
3519 * This means it retries to invoke read(2) system calls to read data
3520 * with the specified maxlen (or until EOF).
3521 *
3522 * This behavior is preserved even if the stream is in non-blocking mode.
3523 * (This method is non-blocking-flag insensitive as other methods.)
3524 *
3525 * If you need the behavior like a single read(2) system call,
3526 * consider #readpartial, #read_nonblock, and #sysread.
3527 *
3528 */
3529
3530static VALUE
3531io_read(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
3532{
3533 rb_io_t *fptr;
3534 long n, len;
3535 VALUE length, str;
3536 int shrinkable;
3537#if RUBY_CRLF_ENVIRONMENT
3538 int previous_mode;
3539#endif
3540
3541 rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "02", &length, &str);
3542
3543 if (NIL_P(length)) {
3544 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
3545 rb_io_check_char_readable(fptr);
3546 return read_all(fptr, remain_size(fptr), str);
3547 }
3548 len = NUM2LONG(length);
3549 if (len < 0) {
3550 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "negative length %ld given", len);
3551 }
3552
3553 shrinkable = io_setstrbuf(&str,len);
3554
3555 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
3556 rb_io_check_byte_readable(fptr);
3557 if (len == 0) {
3558 io_set_read_length(str, 0, shrinkable);
3559 return str;
3560 }
3561
3562 READ_CHECK(fptr);
3563#if RUBY_CRLF_ENVIRONMENT
3564 previous_mode = set_binary_mode_with_seek_cur(fptr);
3565#endif
3566 n = io_fread(str, 0, len, fptr);
3567 io_set_read_length(str, n, shrinkable);
3568#if RUBY_CRLF_ENVIRONMENT
3569 if (previous_mode == O_TEXT) {
3570 setmode(fptr->fd, O_TEXT);
3571 }
3572#endif
3573 if (n == 0) return Qnil;
3574
3575 return str;
3576}
3577
3578static void
3579rscheck(const char *rsptr, long rslen, VALUE rs)
3580{
3581 if (!rs) return;
3582 if (RSTRING_PTR(rs) != rsptr && RSTRING_LEN(rs) != rslen)
3583 rb_raise(rb_eRuntimeError, "rs modified");
3584}
3585
3586static int
3587appendline(rb_io_t *fptr, int delim, VALUE *strp, long *lp)
3588{
3589 VALUE str = *strp;
3590 long limit = *lp;
3591
3592 if (NEED_READCONV(fptr)) {
3593 SET_BINARY_MODE(fptr);
3594 make_readconv(fptr, 0);
3595 do {
3596 const char *p, *e;
3597 int searchlen = READ_CHAR_PENDING_COUNT(fptr);
3598 if (searchlen) {
3599 p = READ_CHAR_PENDING_PTR(fptr);
3600 if (0 < limit && limit < searchlen)
3601 searchlen = (int)limit;
3602 e = memchr(p, delim, searchlen);
3603 if (e) {
3604 int len = (int)(e-p+1);
3605 if (NIL_P(str))
3606 *strp = str = rb_str_new(p, len);
3607 else
3608 rb_str_buf_cat(str, p, len);
3609 fptr->cbuf.off += len;
3610 fptr->cbuf.len -= len;
3611 limit -= len;
3612 *lp = limit;
3613 return delim;
3614 }
3615
3616 if (NIL_P(str))
3617 *strp = str = rb_str_new(p, searchlen);
3618 else
3619 rb_str_buf_cat(str, p, searchlen);
3620 fptr->cbuf.off += searchlen;
3621 fptr->cbuf.len -= searchlen;
3622 limit -= searchlen;
3623
3624 if (limit == 0) {
3625 *lp = limit;
3626 return (unsigned char)RSTRING_PTR(str)[RSTRING_LEN(str)-1];
3627 }
3628 }
3629 } while (more_char(fptr) != MORE_CHAR_FINISHED);
3630 clear_readconv(fptr);
3631 *lp = limit;
3632 return EOF;
3633 }
3634
3635 NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ_CHECK(fptr);
3636 do {
3637 long pending = READ_DATA_PENDING_COUNT(fptr);
3638 if (pending > 0) {
3639 const char *p = READ_DATA_PENDING_PTR(fptr);
3640 const char *e;
3641 long last;
3642
3643 if (limit > 0 && pending > limit) pending = limit;
3644 e = memchr(p, delim, pending);
3645 if (e) pending = e - p + 1;
3646 if (!NIL_P(str)) {
3647 last = RSTRING_LEN(str);
3648 rb_str_resize(str, last + pending);
3649 }
3650 else {
3651 last = 0;
3652 *strp = str = rb_str_buf_new(pending);
3653 rb_str_set_len(str, pending);
3654 }
3655 read_buffered_data(RSTRING_PTR(str) + last, pending, fptr); /* must not fail */
3656 limit -= pending;
3657 *lp = limit;
3658 if (e) return delim;
3659 if (limit == 0)
3660 return (unsigned char)RSTRING_PTR(str)[RSTRING_LEN(str)-1];
3661 }
3662 READ_CHECK(fptr);
3663 } while (io_fillbuf(fptr) >= 0);
3664 *lp = limit;
3665 return EOF;
3666}
3667
3668static inline int
3669swallow(rb_io_t *fptr, int term)
3670{
3671 if (NEED_READCONV(fptr)) {
3672 rb_encoding *enc = io_read_encoding(fptr);
3673 int needconv = rb_enc_mbminlen(enc) != 1;
3674 SET_BINARY_MODE(fptr);
3675 make_readconv(fptr, 0);
3676 do {
3677 size_t cnt;
3678 while ((cnt = READ_CHAR_PENDING_COUNT(fptr)) > 0) {
3679 const char *p = READ_CHAR_PENDING_PTR(fptr);
3680 int i;
3681 if (!needconv) {
3682 if (*p != term) return TRUE;
3683 i = (int)cnt;
3684 while (--i && *++p == term);
3685 }
3686 else {
3687 const char *e = p + cnt;
3688 if (rb_enc_ascget(p, e, &i, enc) != term) return TRUE;
3689 while ((p += i) < e && rb_enc_ascget(p, e, &i, enc) == term);
3690 i = (int)(e - p);
3691 }
3692 io_shift_cbuf(fptr, (int)cnt - i, NULL);
3693 }
3694 } while (more_char(fptr) != MORE_CHAR_FINISHED);
3695 return FALSE;
3696 }
3697
3698 NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ_CHECK(fptr);
3699 do {
3700 size_t cnt;
3701 while ((cnt = READ_DATA_PENDING_COUNT(fptr)) > 0) {
3702 char buf[1024];
3703 const char *p = READ_DATA_PENDING_PTR(fptr);
3704 int i;
3705 if (cnt > sizeof buf) cnt = sizeof buf;
3706 if (*p != term) return TRUE;
3707 i = (int)cnt;
3708 while (--i && *++p == term);
3709 if (!read_buffered_data(buf, cnt - i, fptr)) /* must not fail */
3710 rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
3711 }
3712 READ_CHECK(fptr);
3713 } while (io_fillbuf(fptr) == 0);
3714 return FALSE;
3715}
3716
3717static VALUE
3718rb_io_getline_fast(rb_io_t *fptr, rb_encoding *enc, int chomp)
3719{
3720 VALUE str = Qnil;
3721 int len = 0;
3722 long pos = 0;
3723 int cr = 0;
3724
3725 do {
3726 int pending = READ_DATA_PENDING_COUNT(fptr);
3727
3728 if (pending > 0) {
3729 const char *p = READ_DATA_PENDING_PTR(fptr);
3730 const char *e;
3731 int chomplen = 0;
3732
3733 e = memchr(p, '\n', pending);
3734 if (e) {
3735 pending = (int)(e - p + 1);
3736 if (chomp) {
3737 chomplen = (pending > 1 && *(e-1) == '\r') + 1;
3738 }
3739 }
3740 if (NIL_P(str)) {
3741 str = rb_str_new(p, pending - chomplen);
3742 fptr->rbuf.off += pending;
3743 fptr->rbuf.len -= pending;
3744 }
3745 else {
3746 rb_str_resize(str, len + pending - chomplen);
3747 read_buffered_data(RSTRING_PTR(str)+len, pending - chomplen, fptr);
3748 fptr->rbuf.off += chomplen;
3749 fptr->rbuf.len -= chomplen;
3750 if (pending == 1 && chomplen == 1 && len > 0) {
3751 if (RSTRING_PTR(str)[len-1] == '\r') {
3752 rb_str_resize(str, --len);
3753 break;
3754 }
3755 }
3756 }
3757 len += pending - chomplen;
3758 if (cr != ENC_CODERANGE_BROKEN)
3759 pos += rb_str_coderange_scan_restartable(RSTRING_PTR(str) + pos, RSTRING_PTR(str) + len, enc, &cr);
3760 if (e) break;
3761 }
3762 READ_CHECK(fptr);
3763 } while (io_fillbuf(fptr) >= 0);
3764 if (NIL_P(str)) return Qnil;
3765
3766 str = io_enc_str(str, fptr);
3767 ENC_CODERANGE_SET(str, cr);
3768 fptr->lineno++;
3769
3770 return str;
3771}
3772
3773struct getline_arg {
3774 VALUE io;
3775 VALUE rs;
3776 long limit;
3777 unsigned int chomp: 1;
3778};
3779
3780static void
3781extract_getline_opts(VALUE opts, struct getline_arg *args)
3782{
3783 int chomp = FALSE;
3784 if (!NIL_P(opts)) {
3785 static ID kwds[1];
3786 VALUE vchomp;
3787 if (!kwds[0]) {
3788 kwds[0] = rb_intern_const("chomp");
3789 }
3790 rb_get_kwargs(opts, kwds, 0, -2, &vchomp);
3791 chomp = (vchomp != Qundef) && RTEST(vchomp);
3792 }
3793 args->chomp = chomp;
3794}
3795
3796static void
3797extract_getline_args(int argc, VALUE *argv, struct getline_arg *args)
3798{
3799 VALUE rs = rb_rs, lim = Qnil;
3800
3801 if (argc == 1) {
3802 VALUE tmp = Qnil;
3803
3804 if (NIL_P(argv[0]) || !NIL_P(tmp = rb_check_string_type(argv[0]))) {
3805 rs = tmp;
3806 }
3807 else {
3808 lim = argv[0];
3809 }
3810 }
3811 else if (2 <= argc) {
3812 rs = argv[0], lim = argv[1];
3813 if (!NIL_P(rs))
3814 StringValue(rs);
3815 }
3816 args->rs = rs;
3817 args->limit = NIL_P(lim) ? -1L : NUM2LONG(lim);
3818}
3819
3820static void
3821check_getline_args(VALUE *rsp, long *limit, VALUE io)
3822{
3823 rb_io_t *fptr;
3824 VALUE rs = *rsp;
3825
3826 if (!NIL_P(rs)) {
3827 rb_encoding *enc_rs, *enc_io;
3828
3829 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
3830 enc_rs = rb_enc_get(rs);
3831 enc_io = io_read_encoding(fptr);
3832 if (enc_io != enc_rs &&
3833 (rb_enc_str_coderange(rs) != ENC_CODERANGE_7BIT ||
3834 (RSTRING_LEN(rs) > 0 && !rb_enc_asciicompat(enc_io)))) {
3835 if (rs == rb_default_rs) {
3836 rs = rb_enc_str_new(0, 0, enc_io);
3837 rb_str_buf_cat_ascii(rs, "\n");
3838 *rsp = rs;
3839 }
3840 else {
3841 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "encoding mismatch: %s IO with %s RS",
3842 rb_enc_name(enc_io),
3843 rb_enc_name(enc_rs));
3844 }
3845 }
3846 }
3847}
3848
3849static void
3850prepare_getline_args(int argc, VALUE *argv, struct getline_arg *args, VALUE io)
3851{
3852 VALUE opts;
3853 argc = rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "02:", NULL, NULL, &opts);
3854 extract_getline_args(argc, argv, args);
3855 extract_getline_opts(opts, args);
3856 check_getline_args(&args->rs, &args->limit, io);
3857}
3858
3859static VALUE
3860rb_io_getline_0(VALUE rs, long limit, int chomp, rb_io_t *fptr)
3861{
3862 VALUE str = Qnil;
3863 int nolimit = 0;
3864 rb_encoding *enc;
3865
3866 rb_io_check_char_readable(fptr);
3867 if (NIL_P(rs) && limit < 0) {
3868 str = read_all(fptr, 0, Qnil);
3869 if (RSTRING_LEN(str) == 0) return Qnil;
3870 if (chomp) rb_str_chomp_string(str, rb_default_rs);
3871 }
3872 else if (limit == 0) {
3873 return rb_enc_str_new(0, 0, io_read_encoding(fptr));
3874 }
3875 else if (rs == rb_default_rs && limit < 0 && !NEED_READCONV(fptr) &&
3876 rb_enc_asciicompat(enc = io_read_encoding(fptr))) {
3877 NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ_CHECK(fptr);
3878 return rb_io_getline_fast(fptr, enc, chomp);
3879 }
3880 else {
3881 int c, newline = -1;
3882 const char *rsptr = 0;
3883 long rslen = 0;
3884 int rspara = 0;
3885 int extra_limit = 16;
3886 int chomp_cr = chomp;
3887
3888 SET_BINARY_MODE(fptr);
3889 enc = io_read_encoding(fptr);
3890
3891 if (!NIL_P(rs)) {
3892 rslen = RSTRING_LEN(rs);
3893 if (rslen == 0) {
3894 rsptr = "\n\n";
3895 rslen = 2;
3896 rspara = 1;
3897 swallow(fptr, '\n');
3898 rs = 0;
3899 if (!rb_enc_asciicompat(enc)) {
3900 rs = rb_usascii_str_new(rsptr, rslen);
3901 rs = rb_str_encode(rs, rb_enc_from_encoding(enc), 0, Qnil);
3902 OBJ_FREEZE(rs);
3903 rsptr = RSTRING_PTR(rs);
3904 rslen = RSTRING_LEN(rs);
3905 }
3906 }
3907 else {
3908 rsptr = RSTRING_PTR(rs);
3909 }
3910 newline = (unsigned char)rsptr[rslen - 1];
3911 chomp_cr = chomp && rslen == 1 && newline == '\n';
3912 }
3913
3914 /* MS - Optimization */
3915 while ((c = appendline(fptr, newline, &str, &limit)) != EOF) {
3916 const char *s, *p, *pp, *e;
3917
3918 if (c == newline) {
3919 if (RSTRING_LEN(str) < rslen) continue;
3920 s = RSTRING_PTR(str);
3921 e = RSTRING_END(str);
3922 p = e - rslen;
3923 pp = rb_enc_left_char_head(s, p, e, enc);
3924 if (pp != p) continue;
3925 if (!rspara) rscheck(rsptr, rslen, rs);
3926 if (memcmp(p, rsptr, rslen) == 0) {
3927 if (chomp) {
3928 if (chomp_cr && p > s && *(p-1) == '\r') --p;
3929 rb_str_set_len(str, p - s);
3930 }
3931 break;
3932 }
3933 }
3934 if (limit == 0) {
3935 s = RSTRING_PTR(str);
3936 p = RSTRING_END(str);
3937 pp = rb_enc_left_char_head(s, p-1, p, enc);
3938 if (extra_limit &&
3939 MBCLEN_NEEDMORE_P(rb_enc_precise_mbclen(pp, p, enc))) {
3940 /* relax the limit while incomplete character.
3941 * extra_limit limits the relax length */
3942 limit = 1;
3943 extra_limit--;
3944 }
3945 else {
3946 nolimit = 1;
3947 break;
3948 }
3949 }
3950 }
3951
3952 if (rspara && c != EOF)
3953 swallow(fptr, '\n');
3954 if (!NIL_P(str))
3955 str = io_enc_str(str, fptr);
3956 }
3957
3958 if (!NIL_P(str) && !nolimit) {
3959 fptr->lineno++;
3960 }
3961
3962 return str;
3963}
3964
3965static VALUE
3966rb_io_getline_1(VALUE rs, long limit, int chomp, VALUE io)
3967{
3968 rb_io_t *fptr;
3969 int old_lineno, new_lineno;
3970 VALUE str;
3971
3972 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
3973 old_lineno = fptr->lineno;
3974 str = rb_io_getline_0(rs, limit, chomp, fptr);
3975 if (!NIL_P(str) && (new_lineno = fptr->lineno) != old_lineno) {
3976 if (io == ARGF.current_file) {
3977 ARGF.lineno += new_lineno - old_lineno;
3978 ARGF.last_lineno = ARGF.lineno;
3979 }
3980 else {
3981 ARGF.last_lineno = new_lineno;
3982 }
3983 }
3984
3985 return str;
3986}
3987
3988static VALUE
3989rb_io_getline(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
3990{
3991 struct getline_arg args;
3992
3993 prepare_getline_args(argc, argv, &args, io);
3994 return rb_io_getline_1(args.rs, args.limit, args.chomp, io);
3995}
3996
3997VALUE
3998rb_io_gets(VALUE io)
3999{
4000 return rb_io_getline_1(rb_default_rs, -1, FALSE, io);
4001}
4002
4003VALUE
4004rb_io_gets_internal(VALUE io)
4005{
4006 rb_io_t *fptr;
4007 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
4008 return rb_io_getline_0(rb_default_rs, -1, FALSE, fptr);
4009}
4010
4011/*
4012 * call-seq:
4013 * gets(sep = $/, **line_opts) -> string or nil
4014 * gets(limit, **line_opts) -> string or nil
4015 * gets(sep, limit, **line_opts) -> string or nil
4016 *
4017 * Reads and returns a line from the stream
4018 * (see {Lines}[rdoc-ref:IO@Lines]);
4019 * assigns the return value to <tt>$_</tt>.
4020 *
4021 * With no arguments given, returns the next line
4022 * as determined by line separator <tt>$/</tt>, or +nil+ if none:
4023 *
4024 * f = File.open('t.txt')
4025 * f.gets # => "First line\n"
4026 * $_ # => "First line\n"
4027 * f.gets # => "\n"
4028 * f.gets # => "Fourth line\n"
4029 * f.gets # => "Fifth line\n"
4030 * f.gets # => nil
4031 * f.close
4032 *
4033 * With only string argument +sep+ given,
4034 * returns the next line as determined by line separator +sep+,
4035 * or +nil+ if none;
4036 * see {Line Separator}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Separator]:
4037 *
4038 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4039 * f.gets('l') # => "First l"
4040 * f.gets('li') # => "ine\nSecond li"
4041 * f.gets('lin') # => "ne\n\nFourth lin"
4042 * f.gets # => "e\n"
4043 * f.close
4044 *
4045 * The two special values for +sep+ are honored:
4046 *
4047 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4048 * # Get all.
4049 * f.gets(nil) # => "First line\nSecond line\n\nFourth line\nFifth line\n"
4050 * f.rewind
4051 * # Get paragraph (up to two line separators).
4052 * f.gets('') # => "First line\nSecond line\n\n"
4053 * f.close
4054 *
4055 * With only integer argument +limit+ given,
4056 * limits the number of bytes in the line;
4057 * see {Line Limit}}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Limit]:
4058 *
4059 * # No more than one line.
4060 * File.open('t.txt') {|f| f.gets(10) } # => "First line"
4061 * File.open('t.txt') {|f| f.gets(11) } # => "First line\n"
4062 * File.open('t.txt') {|f| f.gets(12) } # => "First line\n"
4063 *
4064 * With arguments +sep+ and +limit+ given,
4065 * combines the two behaviors:
4066 *
4067 * - Returns the next line as determined by line separator +sep+,
4068 * or +nil+ if none.
4069 * - But returns no more bytes than are allowed by the limit.
4070 *
4071 * For all forms above, optional keyword arguments +line_opts+ specify
4072 * {Line Options}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Options]:
4073 *
4074 * f = File.open('t.txt')
4075 * # Chomp the lines.
4076 * f.gets(chomp: true) # => "First line"
4077 * f.gets(chomp: true) # => "Second line"
4078 * f.gets(chomp: true) # => ""
4079 * f.gets(chomp: true) # => "Fourth line"
4080 * f.gets(chomp: true) # => "Fifth line"
4081 * f.gets(chomp: true) # => nil
4082 * f.close
4083 *
4084 */
4085
4086static VALUE
4087rb_io_gets_m(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
4088{
4089 VALUE str;
4090
4091 str = rb_io_getline(argc, argv, io);
4092 rb_lastline_set(str);
4093
4094 return str;
4095}
4096
4097/*
4098 * call-seq:
4099 * lineno -> integer
4100 *
4101 * Returns the current line number for the stream.
4102 * See {Line Number}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Number].
4103 *
4104 */
4105
4106static VALUE
4107rb_io_lineno(VALUE io)
4108{
4109 rb_io_t *fptr;
4110
4111 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
4112 rb_io_check_char_readable(fptr);
4113 return INT2NUM(fptr->lineno);
4114}
4115
4116/*
4117 * call-seq:
4118 * lineno = integer -> integer
4119 *
4120 * Sets and returns the line number for the stream.
4121 * See {Line Number}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Number].
4122 *
4123 */
4124
4125static VALUE
4126rb_io_set_lineno(VALUE io, VALUE lineno)
4127{
4128 rb_io_t *fptr;
4129
4130 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
4131 rb_io_check_char_readable(fptr);
4132 fptr->lineno = NUM2INT(lineno);
4133 return lineno;
4134}
4135
4136/*
4137 * call-seq:
4138 * readline(sep = $/, **line_opts) -> string
4139 * readline(limit, **line_opts) -> string
4140 * readline(sep, limit, **line_opts) -> string
4141 *
4142 * Reads a line as with IO#gets, but raises EOFError if already at end-of-file.
4143 *
4144 */
4145
4146static VALUE
4147rb_io_readline(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
4148{
4149 VALUE line = rb_io_gets_m(argc, argv, io);
4150
4151 if (NIL_P(line)) {
4152 rb_eof_error();
4153 }
4154 return line;
4155}
4156
4157static VALUE io_readlines(const struct getline_arg *arg, VALUE io);
4158
4159/*
4160 * call-seq:
4161 * readlines(sep = $/, **line_opts) -> array
4162 * readlines(limit, **line_opts) -> array
4163 * readlines(sep, limit, **line_opts) -> array
4164 *
4165 * Reads and returns all remaining line from the stream
4166 * (see {Lines}[rdoc-ref:IO@Lines]);
4167 * does not modify <tt>$_</tt>.
4168 *
4169 * With no arguments given, returns lines
4170 * as determined by line separator <tt>$/</tt>, or +nil+ if none:
4171 *
4172 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4173 * f.readlines
4174 * # => ["First line\n", "Second line\n", "\n", "Fourth line\n", "Fifth line\n"]
4175 * f.readlines # => []
4176 * f.close
4177 *
4178 * With only string argument +sep+ given,
4179 * returns lines as determined by line separator +sep+,
4180 * or +nil+ if none;
4181 * see {Line Separator}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Separator]:
4182 *
4183 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4184 * f.readlines('li')
4185 * # => ["First li", "ne\nSecond li", "ne\n\nFourth li", "ne\nFifth li", "ne\n"]
4186 * f.close
4187 *
4188 * The two special values for +sep+ are honored:
4189 *
4190 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4191 * # Get all into one string.
4192 * f.readlines(nil)
4193 * # => ["First line\nSecond line\n\nFourth line\nFifth line\n"]
4194 * # Get paragraphs (up to two line separators).
4195 * f.rewind
4196 * f.readlines('')
4197 * # => ["First line\nSecond line\n\n", "Fourth line\nFifth line\n"]
4198 * f.close
4199 *
4200 * With only integer argument +limit+ given,
4201 * limits the number of bytes in each line;
4202 * see {Line Limit}}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Limit]:
4203 *
4204 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4205 * f.readlines(8)
4206 * # => ["First li", "ne\n", "Second l", "ine\n", "\n", "Fourth l", "ine\n", "Fifth li", "ne\n"]
4207 * f.close
4208 *
4209 * With arguments +sep+ and +limit+ given,
4210 * combines the two behaviors:
4211 *
4212 * - Returns lines as determined by line separator +sep+.
4213 * - But returns no more bytes in a line than are allowed by the limit.
4214 *
4215 * For all forms above, optional keyword arguments +line_opts+ specify
4216 * {Line Options}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Options]:
4217 *
4218 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4219 * f.readlines(chomp: true)
4220 * # => ["First line", "Second line", "", "Fourth line", "Fifth line"]
4221 * f.close
4222 *
4223 */
4224
4225static VALUE
4226rb_io_readlines(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
4227{
4228 struct getline_arg args;
4229
4230 prepare_getline_args(argc, argv, &args, io);
4231 return io_readlines(&args, io);
4232}
4233
4234static VALUE
4235io_readlines(const struct getline_arg *arg, VALUE io)
4236{
4237 VALUE line, ary;
4238
4239 if (arg->limit == 0)
4240 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "invalid limit: 0 for readlines");
4241 ary = rb_ary_new();
4242 while (!NIL_P(line = rb_io_getline_1(arg->rs, arg->limit, arg->chomp, io))) {
4243 rb_ary_push(ary, line);
4244 }
4245 return ary;
4246}
4247
4248/*
4249 * call-seq:
4250 * each_line(sep = $/, **line_opts) {|line| ... } -> self
4251 * each_line(limit, **line_opts) {|line| ... } -> self
4252 * each_line(sep, limit, **line_opts) {|line| ... } -> self
4253 * each_line -> enumerator
4254 *
4255 * Calls the block with each remaining line read from the stream
4256 * (see {Lines}[rdoc-ref:IO@Lines]);
4257 * does nothing if already at end-of-file;
4258 * returns +self+.
4259 *
4260 * With no arguments given, reads lines
4261 * as determined by line separator <tt>$/</tt>:
4262 *
4263 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4264 * f.each_line {|line| p line }
4265 * f.each_line {|line| fail 'Cannot happen' }
4266 * f.close
4267 *
4268 * Output:
4269 *
4270 * "First line\n"
4271 * "Second line\n"
4272 * "\n"
4273 * "Fourth line\n"
4274 * "Fifth line\n"
4275 *
4276 * With only string argument +sep+ given,
4277 * reads lines as determined by line separator +sep+;
4278 * see {Line Separator}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Separator]:
4279 *
4280 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4281 * f.each_line('li') {|line| p line }
4282 * f.close
4283 *
4284 * Output:
4285 *
4286 * "First li"
4287 * "ne\nSecond li"
4288 * "ne\n\nFourth li"
4289 * "ne\nFifth li"
4290 * "ne\n"
4291 *
4292 * The two special values for +sep+ are honored:
4293 *
4294 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4295 * # Get all into one string.
4296 * f.each_line(nil) {|line| p line }
4297 * f.close
4298 *
4299 * Output:
4300 *
4301 * "First line\nSecond line\n\nFourth line\nFifth line\n"
4302 *
4303 * f.rewind
4304 * # Get paragraphs (up to two line separators).
4305 * f.each_line('') {|line| p line }
4306 *
4307 * Output:
4308 *
4309 * "First line\nSecond line\n\n"
4310 * "Fourth line\nFifth line\n"
4311 *
4312 * With only integer argument +limit+ given,
4313 * limits the number of bytes in each line;
4314 * see {Line Limit}}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Limit]:
4315 *
4316 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4317 * f.each_line(8) {|line| p line }
4318 * f.close
4319 *
4320 * Output:
4321 *
4322 * "First li"
4323 * "ne\n"
4324 * "Second l"
4325 * "ine\n"
4326 * "\n"
4327 * "Fourth l"
4328 * "ine\n"
4329 * "Fifth li"
4330 * "ne\n"
4331 *
4332 * With arguments +sep+ and +limit+ given,
4333 * combines the two behaviors:
4334 *
4335 * - Calls with the next line as determined by line separator +sep+.
4336 * - But returns no more bytes than are allowed by the limit.
4337 *
4338 * For all forms above, optional keyword arguments +line_opts+ specify
4339 * {Line Options}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Options]:
4340 *
4341 * f = File.new('t.txt')
4342 * f.each_line(chomp: true) {|line| p line }
4343 * f.close
4344 *
4345 * Output:
4346 *
4347 * "First line"
4348 * "Second line"
4349 * ""
4350 * "Fourth line"
4351 * "Fifth line"
4352 *
4353 * Returns an Enumerator if no block is given.
4354 *
4355 * IO#each is an alias for IO#each_line.
4356 *
4357 */
4358
4359static VALUE
4360rb_io_each_line(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
4361{
4362 VALUE str;
4363 struct getline_arg args;
4364
4365 RETURN_ENUMERATOR(io, argc, argv);
4366 prepare_getline_args(argc, argv, &args, io);
4367 if (args.limit == 0)
4368 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "invalid limit: 0 for each_line");
4369 while (!NIL_P(str = rb_io_getline_1(args.rs, args.limit, args.chomp, io))) {
4370 rb_yield(str);
4371 }
4372 return io;
4373}
4374
4375/*
4376 * call-seq:
4377 * each_byte {|byte| ... } -> self
4378 * each_byte -> enumerator
4379 *
4380 * Calls the given block with each byte (0..255) in the stream; returns +self+:
4381 *
4382 * f = File.new('t.rus')
4383 * a = []
4384 * f.each_byte {|b| a << b }
4385 * a # => [209, 130, 208, 181, 209, 129, 209, 130]
4386 * f.close
4387 *
4388 * Returns an Enumerator if no block is given.
4389 *
4390 * Related: IO#each_char, IO#each_codepoint.
4391 *
4392 */
4393
4394static VALUE
4395rb_io_each_byte(VALUE io)
4396{
4397 rb_io_t *fptr;
4398
4399 RETURN_ENUMERATOR(io, 0, 0);
4400 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
4401
4402 do {
4403 while (fptr->rbuf.len > 0) {
4404 char *p = fptr->rbuf.ptr + fptr->rbuf.off++;
4405 fptr->rbuf.len--;
4406 rb_yield(INT2FIX(*p & 0xff));
4407 rb_io_check_byte_readable(fptr);
4408 errno = 0;
4409 }
4410 READ_CHECK(fptr);
4411 } while (io_fillbuf(fptr) >= 0);
4412 return io;
4413}
4414
4415static VALUE
4416io_getc(rb_io_t *fptr, rb_encoding *enc)
4417{
4418 int r, n, cr = 0;
4419 VALUE str;
4420
4421 if (NEED_READCONV(fptr)) {
4422 rb_encoding *read_enc = io_read_encoding(fptr);
4423
4424 str = Qnil;
4425 SET_BINARY_MODE(fptr);
4426 make_readconv(fptr, 0);
4427
4428 while (1) {
4429 if (fptr->cbuf.len) {
4430 r = rb_enc_precise_mbclen(fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off,
4431 fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off+fptr->cbuf.len,
4432 read_enc);
4433 if (!MBCLEN_NEEDMORE_P(r))
4434 break;
4435 if (fptr->cbuf.len == fptr->cbuf.capa) {
4436 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "too long character");
4437 }
4438 }
4439
4440 if (more_char(fptr) == MORE_CHAR_FINISHED) {
4441 if (fptr->cbuf.len == 0) {
4442 clear_readconv(fptr);
4443 return Qnil;
4444 }
4445 /* return an unit of an incomplete character just before EOF */
4446 str = rb_enc_str_new(fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off, 1, read_enc);
4447 fptr->cbuf.off += 1;
4448 fptr->cbuf.len -= 1;
4449 if (fptr->cbuf.len == 0) clear_readconv(fptr);
4450 ENC_CODERANGE_SET(str, ENC_CODERANGE_BROKEN);
4451 return str;
4452 }
4453 }
4454 if (MBCLEN_INVALID_P(r)) {
4455 r = rb_enc_mbclen(fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off,
4456 fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off+fptr->cbuf.len,
4457 read_enc);
4458 io_shift_cbuf(fptr, r, &str);
4459 cr = ENC_CODERANGE_BROKEN;
4460 }
4461 else {
4462 io_shift_cbuf(fptr, MBCLEN_CHARFOUND_LEN(r), &str);
4463 cr = ENC_CODERANGE_VALID;
4464 if (MBCLEN_CHARFOUND_LEN(r) == 1 && rb_enc_asciicompat(read_enc) &&
4465 ISASCII(RSTRING_PTR(str)[0])) {
4466 cr = ENC_CODERANGE_7BIT;
4467 }
4468 }
4469 str = io_enc_str(str, fptr);
4470 ENC_CODERANGE_SET(str, cr);
4471 return str;
4472 }
4473
4474 NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ_CHECK(fptr);
4475 if (io_fillbuf(fptr) < 0) {
4476 return Qnil;
4477 }
4478 if (rb_enc_asciicompat(enc) && ISASCII(fptr->rbuf.ptr[fptr->rbuf.off])) {
4479 str = rb_str_new(fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off, 1);
4480 fptr->rbuf.off += 1;
4481 fptr->rbuf.len -= 1;
4482 cr = ENC_CODERANGE_7BIT;
4483 }
4484 else {
4485 r = rb_enc_precise_mbclen(fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off, fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off+fptr->rbuf.len, enc);
4486 if (MBCLEN_CHARFOUND_P(r) &&
4487 (n = MBCLEN_CHARFOUND_LEN(r)) <= fptr->rbuf.len) {
4488 str = rb_str_new(fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off, n);
4489 fptr->rbuf.off += n;
4490 fptr->rbuf.len -= n;
4491 cr = ENC_CODERANGE_VALID;
4492 }
4493 else if (MBCLEN_NEEDMORE_P(r)) {
4494 str = rb_str_new(fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off, fptr->rbuf.len);
4495 fptr->rbuf.len = 0;
4496 getc_needmore:
4497 if (io_fillbuf(fptr) != -1) {
4498 rb_str_cat(str, fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off, 1);
4499 fptr->rbuf.off++;
4500 fptr->rbuf.len--;
4501 r = rb_enc_precise_mbclen(RSTRING_PTR(str), RSTRING_PTR(str)+RSTRING_LEN(str), enc);
4502 if (MBCLEN_NEEDMORE_P(r)) {
4503 goto getc_needmore;
4504 }
4505 else if (MBCLEN_CHARFOUND_P(r)) {
4506 cr = ENC_CODERANGE_VALID;
4507 }
4508 }
4509 }
4510 else {
4511 str = rb_str_new(fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off, 1);
4512 fptr->rbuf.off++;
4513 fptr->rbuf.len--;
4514 }
4515 }
4516 if (!cr) cr = ENC_CODERANGE_BROKEN;
4517 str = io_enc_str(str, fptr);
4518 ENC_CODERANGE_SET(str, cr);
4519 return str;
4520}
4521
4522/*
4523 * call-seq:
4524 * each_char {|c| ... } -> self
4525 * each_char -> enumerator
4526 *
4527 * Calls the given block with each character in the stream; returns +self+:
4528 *
4529 * f = File.new('t.rus')
4530 * a = []
4531 * f.each_char {|c| a << c.ord }
4532 * a # => [1090, 1077, 1089, 1090]
4533 * f.close
4534 *
4535 * Returns an Enumerator if no block is given.
4536 *
4537 * Related: IO#each_byte, IO#each_codepoint.
4538 *
4539 */
4540
4541static VALUE
4542rb_io_each_char(VALUE io)
4543{
4544 rb_io_t *fptr;
4545 rb_encoding *enc;
4546 VALUE c;
4547
4548 RETURN_ENUMERATOR(io, 0, 0);
4549 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
4550 rb_io_check_char_readable(fptr);
4551
4552 enc = io_input_encoding(fptr);
4553 READ_CHECK(fptr);
4554 while (!NIL_P(c = io_getc(fptr, enc))) {
4555 rb_yield(c);
4556 }
4557 return io;
4558}
4559
4560/*
4561 * call-seq:
4562 * each_codepoint {|c| ... } -> self
4563 * each_codepoint -> enumerator
4564 *
4565 * Calls the given block with each codepoint in the stream; returns +self+:
4566 *
4567 * f = File.new('t.rus')
4568 * a = []
4569 * f.each_codepoint {|c| a << c }
4570 * a # => [1090, 1077, 1089, 1090]
4571 * f.close
4572 *
4573 * Returns an Enumerator if no block is given.
4574 *
4575 * Related: IO#each_byte, IO#each_char.
4576 *
4577 */
4578
4579static VALUE
4580rb_io_each_codepoint(VALUE io)
4581{
4582 rb_io_t *fptr;
4583 rb_encoding *enc;
4584 unsigned int c;
4585 int r, n;
4586
4587 RETURN_ENUMERATOR(io, 0, 0);
4588 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
4589 rb_io_check_char_readable(fptr);
4590
4591 READ_CHECK(fptr);
4592 if (NEED_READCONV(fptr)) {
4593 SET_BINARY_MODE(fptr);
4594 r = 1; /* no invalid char yet */
4595 for (;;) {
4596 make_readconv(fptr, 0);
4597 for (;;) {
4598 if (fptr->cbuf.len) {
4599 if (fptr->encs.enc)
4600 r = rb_enc_precise_mbclen(fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off,
4601 fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off+fptr->cbuf.len,
4602 fptr->encs.enc);
4603 else
4604 r = ONIGENC_CONSTRUCT_MBCLEN_CHARFOUND(1);
4605 if (!MBCLEN_NEEDMORE_P(r))
4606 break;
4607 if (fptr->cbuf.len == fptr->cbuf.capa) {
4608 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "too long character");
4609 }
4610 }
4611 if (more_char(fptr) == MORE_CHAR_FINISHED) {
4612 clear_readconv(fptr);
4613 if (!MBCLEN_CHARFOUND_P(r)) {
4614 enc = fptr->encs.enc;
4615 goto invalid;
4616 }
4617 return io;
4618 }
4619 }
4620 if (MBCLEN_INVALID_P(r)) {
4621 enc = fptr->encs.enc;
4622 goto invalid;
4623 }
4624 n = MBCLEN_CHARFOUND_LEN(r);
4625 if (fptr->encs.enc) {
4626 c = rb_enc_codepoint(fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off,
4627 fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off+fptr->cbuf.len,
4628 fptr->encs.enc);
4629 }
4630 else {
4631 c = (unsigned char)fptr->cbuf.ptr[fptr->cbuf.off];
4632 }
4633 fptr->cbuf.off += n;
4634 fptr->cbuf.len -= n;
4635 rb_yield(UINT2NUM(c));
4636 rb_io_check_byte_readable(fptr);
4637 }
4638 }
4639 NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ_CHECK(fptr);
4640 enc = io_input_encoding(fptr);
4641 while (io_fillbuf(fptr) >= 0) {
4642 r = rb_enc_precise_mbclen(fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off,
4643 fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off+fptr->rbuf.len, enc);
4644 if (MBCLEN_CHARFOUND_P(r) &&
4645 (n = MBCLEN_CHARFOUND_LEN(r)) <= fptr->rbuf.len) {
4646 c = rb_enc_codepoint(fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off,
4647 fptr->rbuf.ptr+fptr->rbuf.off+fptr->rbuf.len, enc);
4648 fptr->rbuf.off += n;
4649 fptr->rbuf.len -= n;
4650 rb_yield(UINT2NUM(c));
4651 }
4652 else if (MBCLEN_INVALID_P(r)) {
4653 goto invalid;
4654 }
4655 else if (MBCLEN_NEEDMORE_P(r)) {
4656 char cbuf[8], *p = cbuf;
4657 int more = MBCLEN_NEEDMORE_LEN(r);
4658 if (more > numberof(cbuf)) goto invalid;
4659 more += n = fptr->rbuf.len;
4660 if (more > numberof(cbuf)) goto invalid;
4661 while ((n = (int)read_buffered_data(p, more, fptr)) > 0 &&
4662 (p += n, (more -= n) > 0)) {
4663 if (io_fillbuf(fptr) < 0) goto invalid;
4664 if ((n = fptr->rbuf.len) > more) n = more;
4665 }
4666 r = rb_enc_precise_mbclen(cbuf, p, enc);
4667 if (!MBCLEN_CHARFOUND_P(r)) goto invalid;
4668 c = rb_enc_codepoint(cbuf, p, enc);
4669 rb_yield(UINT2NUM(c));
4670 }
4671 else {
4672 continue;
4673 }
4674 rb_io_check_byte_readable(fptr);
4675 }
4676 return io;
4677
4678 invalid:
4679 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "invalid byte sequence in %s", rb_enc_name(enc));
4680 UNREACHABLE_RETURN(Qundef);
4681}
4682
4683/*
4684 * call-seq:
4685 * getc -> character or nil
4686 *
4687 * Reads and returns the next 1-character string from the stream;
4688 * returns +nil+ if already at end-of-file:
4689 *
4690 * f = File.open('t.txt')
4691 * f.getc # => "F"
4692 * f.close
4693 * f = File.open('t.rus')
4694 * f.getc.ord # => 1090
4695 * f.close
4696 *
4697 * Related: IO#readchar (may raise EOFError).
4698 *
4699 */
4700
4701static VALUE
4702rb_io_getc(VALUE io)
4703{
4704 rb_io_t *fptr;
4705 rb_encoding *enc;
4706
4707 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
4708 rb_io_check_char_readable(fptr);
4709
4710 enc = io_input_encoding(fptr);
4711 READ_CHECK(fptr);
4712 return io_getc(fptr, enc);
4713}
4714
4715/*
4716 * call-seq:
4717 * readchar -> string
4718 *
4719 * Reads and returns the next 1-character string from the stream;
4720 * raises EOFError if already at end-of-file:
4721 *
4722 * f = File.open('t.txt')
4723 * f.readchar # => "F"
4724 * f.close
4725 * f = File.open('t.rus')
4726 * f.readchar.ord # => 1090
4727 * f.close
4728 *
4729 * Related: IO#getc (will not raise EOFError).
4730 *
4731 */
4732
4733static VALUE
4734rb_io_readchar(VALUE io)
4735{
4736 VALUE c = rb_io_getc(io);
4737
4738 if (NIL_P(c)) {
4739 rb_eof_error();
4740 }
4741 return c;
4742}
4743
4744/*
4745 * call-seq:
4746 * getbyte -> integer or nil
4747 *
4748 * Reads and returns the next byte (in range 0..255) from the stream;
4749 * returns +nil+ if already at end-of-file:
4750 *
4751 * f = File.open('t.txt')
4752 * f.getbyte # => 70
4753 * f.close
4754 * f = File.open('t.rus')
4755 * f.getbyte # => 209
4756 * f.close
4757 *
4758 * Related: IO#readbyte (may raise EOFError).
4759 *
4760 */
4761
4762VALUE
4763rb_io_getbyte(VALUE io)
4764{
4765 rb_io_t *fptr;
4766 int c;
4767
4768 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
4769 rb_io_check_byte_readable(fptr);
4770 READ_CHECK(fptr);
4771 VALUE r_stdout = rb_ractor_stdout();
4772 if (fptr->fd == 0 && (fptr->mode & FMODE_TTY) && RB_TYPE_P(r_stdout, T_FILE)) {
4773 rb_io_t *ofp;
4774 GetOpenFile(r_stdout, ofp);
4775 if (ofp->mode & FMODE_TTY) {
4776 rb_io_flush(r_stdout);
4777 }
4778 }
4779 if (io_fillbuf(fptr) < 0) {
4780 return Qnil;
4781 }
4782 fptr->rbuf.off++;
4783 fptr->rbuf.len--;
4784 c = (unsigned char)fptr->rbuf.ptr[fptr->rbuf.off-1];
4785 return INT2FIX(c & 0xff);
4786}
4787
4788/*
4789 * call-seq:
4790 * readbyte -> integer
4791 *
4792 * Reads and returns the next byte (in range 0..255) from the stream;
4793 * raises EOFError if already at end-of-file:
4794 *
4795 * f = File.open('t.txt')
4796 * f.readbyte # => 70
4797 * f.close
4798 * f = File.open('t.rus')
4799 * f.readbyte # => 209
4800 * f.close
4801 *
4802 * Related: IO#getbyte (will not raise EOFError).
4803 *
4804 */
4805
4806static VALUE
4807rb_io_readbyte(VALUE io)
4808{
4809 VALUE c = rb_io_getbyte(io);
4810
4811 if (NIL_P(c)) {
4812 rb_eof_error();
4813 }
4814 return c;
4815}
4816
4817/*
4818 * call-seq:
4819 * ungetbyte(integer) -> nil
4820 * ungetbyte(string) -> nil
4821 *
4822 * Pushes back ("unshifts") the given data onto the stream's buffer,
4823 * placing the data so that it is next to be read; returns +nil+.
4824 *
4825 * Note that:
4826 *
4827 * - Calling the method hs no effect with unbuffered reads (such as IO#sysread).
4828 * - Calling #rewind on the stream discards the pushed-back data.
4829 *
4830 * When argument +integer+ is given, uses only its low-order byte:
4831 *
4832 * File.write('t.tmp', '012')
4833 * f = File.open('t.tmp')
4834 * f.ungetbyte(0x41) # => nil
4835 * f.read # => "A012"
4836 * f.rewind
4837 * f.ungetbyte(0x4243) # => nil
4838 * f.read # => "C012"
4839 * f.close
4840 *
4841 * When argument +string+ is given, uses all bytes:
4842 *
4843 * File.write('t.tmp', '012')
4844 * f = File.open('t.tmp')
4845 * f.ungetbyte('A') # => nil
4846 * f.read # => "A012"
4847 * f.rewind
4848 * f.ungetbyte('BCDE') # => nil
4849 * f.read # => "BCDE012"
4850 * f.close
4851 *
4852 */
4853
4854VALUE
4855rb_io_ungetbyte(VALUE io, VALUE b)
4856{
4857 rb_io_t *fptr;
4858
4859 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
4860 rb_io_check_byte_readable(fptr);
4861 switch (TYPE(b)) {
4862 case T_NIL:
4863 return Qnil;
4864 case T_FIXNUM:
4865 case T_BIGNUM: ;
4866 VALUE v = rb_int_modulo(b, INT2FIX(256));
4867 unsigned char c = NUM2INT(v) & 0xFF;
4868 b = rb_str_new((const char *)&c, 1);
4869 break;
4870 default:
4871 SafeStringValue(b);
4872 }
4873 io_ungetbyte(b, fptr);
4874 return Qnil;
4875}
4876
4877/*
4878 * call-seq:
4879 * ungetc(integer) -> nil
4880 * ungetc(string) -> nil
4881 *
4882 * Pushes back ("unshifts") the given data onto the stream's buffer,
4883 * placing the data so that it is next to be read; returns +nil+.
4884 *
4885 * Note that:
4886 *
4887 * - Calling the method hs no effect with unbuffered reads (such as IO#sysread).
4888 * - Calling #rewind on the stream discards the pushed-back data.
4889 *
4890 * When argument +integer+ is given, interprets the integer as a character:
4891 *
4892 * File.write('t.tmp', '012')
4893 * f = File.open('t.tmp')
4894 * f.ungetc(0x41) # => nil
4895 * f.read # => "A012"
4896 * f.rewind
4897 * f.ungetc(0x0442) # => nil
4898 * f.getc.ord # => 1090
4899 * f.close
4900 *
4901 * When argument +string+ is given, uses all characters:
4902 *
4903 * File.write('t.tmp', '012')
4904 * f = File.open('t.tmp')
4905 * f.ungetc('A') # => nil
4906 * f.read # => "A012"
4907 * f.rewind
4908 * f.ungetc("\u0442\u0435\u0441\u0442") # => nil
4909 * f.getc.ord # => 1090
4910 * f.getc.ord # => 1077
4911 * f.getc.ord # => 1089
4912 * f.getc.ord # => 1090
4913 * f.close
4914 *
4915 */
4916
4917VALUE
4918rb_io_ungetc(VALUE io, VALUE c)
4919{
4920 rb_io_t *fptr;
4921 long len;
4922
4923 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
4924 rb_io_check_char_readable(fptr);
4925 if (FIXNUM_P(c)) {
4926 c = rb_enc_uint_chr(FIX2UINT(c), io_read_encoding(fptr));
4927 }
4928 else if (RB_BIGNUM_TYPE_P(c)) {
4929 c = rb_enc_uint_chr(NUM2UINT(c), io_read_encoding(fptr));
4930 }
4931 else {
4932 SafeStringValue(c);
4933 }
4934 if (NEED_READCONV(fptr)) {
4935 SET_BINARY_MODE(fptr);
4936 len = RSTRING_LEN(c);
4937#if SIZEOF_LONG > SIZEOF_INT
4938 if (len > INT_MAX)
4939 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "ungetc failed");
4940#endif
4941 make_readconv(fptr, (int)len);
4942 if (fptr->cbuf.capa - fptr->cbuf.len < len)
4943 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "ungetc failed");
4944 if (fptr->cbuf.off < len) {
4945 MEMMOVE(fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.capa-fptr->cbuf.len,
4946 fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off,
4947 char, fptr->cbuf.len);
4948 fptr->cbuf.off = fptr->cbuf.capa-fptr->cbuf.len;
4949 }
4950 fptr->cbuf.off -= (int)len;
4951 fptr->cbuf.len += (int)len;
4952 MEMMOVE(fptr->cbuf.ptr+fptr->cbuf.off, RSTRING_PTR(c), char, len);
4953 }
4954 else {
4955 NEED_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_READ_CHECK(fptr);
4956 io_ungetbyte(c, fptr);
4957 }
4958 return Qnil;
4959}
4960
4961/*
4962 * call-seq:
4963 * isatty -> true or false
4964 *
4965 * Returns +true+ if the stream is associated with a terminal device (tty),
4966 * +false+ otherwise:
4967 *
4968 * File.new('t.txt').isatty #=> false
4969 * File.new('/dev/tty').isatty #=> true
4970 *
4971 * IO#tty? is an alias for IO#isatty.
4972 *
4973 */
4974
4975static VALUE
4976rb_io_isatty(VALUE io)
4977{
4978 rb_io_t *fptr;
4979
4980 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
4981 return RBOOL(isatty(fptr->fd) != 0);
4982}
4983
4984#if defined(HAVE_FCNTL) && defined(F_GETFD) && defined(F_SETFD) && defined(FD_CLOEXEC)
4985/*
4986 * call-seq:
4987 * close_on_exec? -> true or false
4988 *
4989 * Returns +true+ if the stream will be closed on exec, +false+ otherwise:
4990 *
4991 * f = File.open('t.txt')
4992 * f.close_on_exec? # => true
4993 * f.close_on_exec = false
4994 * f.close_on_exec? # => false
4995 * f.close
4996 *
4997 */
4998
4999static VALUE
5000rb_io_close_on_exec_p(VALUE io)
5001{
5002 rb_io_t *fptr;
5003 VALUE write_io;
5004 int fd, ret;
5005
5006 write_io = GetWriteIO(io);
5007 if (io != write_io) {
5008 GetOpenFile(write_io, fptr);
5009 if (fptr && 0 <= (fd = fptr->fd)) {
5010 if ((ret = fcntl(fd, F_GETFD)) == -1) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5011 if (!(ret & FD_CLOEXEC)) return Qfalse;
5012 }
5013 }
5014
5015 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
5016 if (fptr && 0 <= (fd = fptr->fd)) {
5017 if ((ret = fcntl(fd, F_GETFD)) == -1) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5018 if (!(ret & FD_CLOEXEC)) return Qfalse;
5019 }
5020 return Qtrue;
5021}
5022#else
5023#define rb_io_close_on_exec_p rb_f_notimplement
5024#endif
5025
5026#if defined(HAVE_FCNTL) && defined(F_GETFD) && defined(F_SETFD) && defined(FD_CLOEXEC)
5027/*
5028 * call-seq:
5029 * self.close_on_exec = bool -> true or false
5030 *
5031 * Sets a close-on-exec flag.
5032 *
5033 * f = open("/dev/null")
5034 * f.close_on_exec = true
5035 * system("cat", "/proc/self/fd/#{f.fileno}") # cat: /proc/self/fd/3: No such file or directory
5036 * f.closed? #=> false
5037 *
5038 * Ruby sets close-on-exec flags of all file descriptors by default
5039 * since Ruby 2.0.0.
5040 * So you don't need to set by yourself.
5041 * Also, unsetting a close-on-exec flag can cause file descriptor leak
5042 * if another thread use fork() and exec() (via system() method for example).
5043 * If you really needs file descriptor inheritance to child process,
5044 * use spawn()'s argument such as fd=>fd.
5045 */
5046
5047static VALUE
5048rb_io_set_close_on_exec(VALUE io, VALUE arg)
5049{
5050 int flag = RTEST(arg) ? FD_CLOEXEC : 0;
5051 rb_io_t *fptr;
5052 VALUE write_io;
5053 int fd, ret;
5054
5055 write_io = GetWriteIO(io);
5056 if (io != write_io) {
5057 GetOpenFile(write_io, fptr);
5058 if (fptr && 0 <= (fd = fptr->fd)) {
5059 if ((ret = fcntl(fptr->fd, F_GETFD)) == -1) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5060 if ((ret & FD_CLOEXEC) != flag) {
5061 ret = (ret & ~FD_CLOEXEC) | flag;
5062 ret = fcntl(fd, F_SETFD, ret);
5063 if (ret != 0) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5064 }
5065 }
5066
5067 }
5068
5069 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
5070 if (fptr && 0 <= (fd = fptr->fd)) {
5071 if ((ret = fcntl(fd, F_GETFD)) == -1) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5072 if ((ret & FD_CLOEXEC) != flag) {
5073 ret = (ret & ~FD_CLOEXEC) | flag;
5074 ret = fcntl(fd, F_SETFD, ret);
5075 if (ret != 0) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5076 }
5077 }
5078 return Qnil;
5079}
5080#else
5081#define rb_io_set_close_on_exec rb_f_notimplement
5082#endif
5083
5084#define IS_PREP_STDIO(f) ((f)->mode & FMODE_PREP)
5085#define PREP_STDIO_NAME(f) (RSTRING_PTR((f)->pathv))
5086
5087static VALUE
5088finish_writeconv(rb_io_t *fptr, int noalloc)
5089{
5090 unsigned char *ds, *dp, *de;
5091 rb_econv_result_t res;
5092
5093 if (!fptr->wbuf.ptr) {
5094 unsigned char buf[1024];
5095
5096 res = econv_destination_buffer_full;
5097 while (res == econv_destination_buffer_full) {
5098 ds = dp = buf;
5099 de = buf + sizeof(buf);
5100 res = rb_econv_convert(fptr->writeconv, NULL, NULL, &dp, de, 0);
5101 while (dp-ds) {
5102 size_t remaining = dp-ds;
5103 long result = rb_write_internal(fptr, ds, remaining);
5104
5105 if (result > 0) {
5106 ds += result;
5107 if ((size_t)result == remaining) break;
5108 }
5109 else if (rb_io_maybe_wait_writable(errno, fptr->self, Qnil)) {
5110 if (fptr->fd < 0)
5111 return noalloc ? Qtrue : rb_exc_new3(rb_eIOError, rb_str_new_cstr(closed_stream));
5112 }
5113 else {
5114 return noalloc ? Qtrue : INT2NUM(errno);
5115 }
5116 }
5117 if (res == econv_invalid_byte_sequence ||
5118 res == econv_incomplete_input ||
5119 res == econv_undefined_conversion) {
5120 return noalloc ? Qtrue : rb_econv_make_exception(fptr->writeconv);
5121 }
5122 }
5123
5124 return Qnil;
5125 }
5126
5127 res = econv_destination_buffer_full;
5128 while (res == econv_destination_buffer_full) {
5129 if (fptr->wbuf.len == fptr->wbuf.capa) {
5130 if (io_fflush(fptr) < 0) {
5131 return noalloc ? Qtrue : INT2NUM(errno);
5132 }
5133 }
5134
5135 ds = dp = (unsigned char *)fptr->wbuf.ptr + fptr->wbuf.off + fptr->wbuf.len;
5136 de = (unsigned char *)fptr->wbuf.ptr + fptr->wbuf.capa;
5137 res = rb_econv_convert(fptr->writeconv, NULL, NULL, &dp, de, 0);
5138 fptr->wbuf.len += (int)(dp - ds);
5139 if (res == econv_invalid_byte_sequence ||
5140 res == econv_incomplete_input ||
5141 res == econv_undefined_conversion) {
5142 return noalloc ? Qtrue : rb_econv_make_exception(fptr->writeconv);
5143 }
5144 }
5145 return Qnil;
5146}
5147
5148struct finish_writeconv_arg {
5149 rb_io_t *fptr;
5150 int noalloc;
5151};
5152
5153static VALUE
5154finish_writeconv_sync(VALUE arg)
5155{
5156 struct finish_writeconv_arg *p = (struct finish_writeconv_arg *)arg;
5157 return finish_writeconv(p->fptr, p->noalloc);
5158}
5159
5160static void*
5161nogvl_close(void *ptr)
5162{
5163 int *fd = ptr;
5164
5165 return (void*)(intptr_t)close(*fd);
5166}
5167
5168static int
5169maygvl_close(int fd, int keepgvl)
5170{
5171 if (keepgvl)
5172 return close(fd);
5173
5174 /*
5175 * close() may block for certain file types (NFS, SO_LINGER sockets,
5176 * inotify), so let other threads run.
5177 */
5178 return (int)(intptr_t)rb_thread_call_without_gvl(nogvl_close, &fd, RUBY_UBF_IO, 0);
5179}
5180
5181static void*
5182nogvl_fclose(void *ptr)
5183{
5184 FILE *file = ptr;
5185
5186 return (void*)(intptr_t)fclose(file);
5187}
5188
5189static int
5190maygvl_fclose(FILE *file, int keepgvl)
5191{
5192 if (keepgvl)
5193 return fclose(file);
5194
5195 return (int)(intptr_t)rb_thread_call_without_gvl(nogvl_fclose, file, RUBY_UBF_IO, 0);
5196}
5197
5198static void free_io_buffer(rb_io_buffer_t *buf);
5199static void clear_codeconv(rb_io_t *fptr);
5200
5201static void
5202fptr_finalize_flush(rb_io_t *fptr, int noraise, int keepgvl,
5203 struct ccan_list_head *busy)
5204{
5205 VALUE error = Qnil;
5206 int fd = fptr->fd;
5207 FILE *stdio_file = fptr->stdio_file;
5208 int mode = fptr->mode;
5209
5210 if (fptr->writeconv) {
5211 if (!NIL_P(fptr->write_lock) && !noraise) {
5212 struct finish_writeconv_arg arg;
5213 arg.fptr = fptr;
5214 arg.noalloc = noraise;
5215 error = rb_mutex_synchronize(fptr->write_lock, finish_writeconv_sync, (VALUE)&arg);
5216 }
5217 else {
5218 error = finish_writeconv(fptr, noraise);
5219 }
5220 }
5221 if (fptr->wbuf.len) {
5222 if (noraise) {
5223 io_flush_buffer_sync(fptr);
5224 }
5225 else {
5226 if (io_fflush(fptr) < 0 && NIL_P(error)) {
5227 error = INT2NUM(errno);
5228 }
5229 }
5230 }
5231
5232 int done = 0;
5233
5234 if (IS_PREP_STDIO(fptr) || fd <= 2) {
5235 // Need to keep FILE objects of stdin, stdout and stderr, so we are done:
5236 done = 1;
5237 }
5238
5239 fptr->fd = -1;
5240 fptr->stdio_file = 0;
5241 fptr->mode &= ~(FMODE_READABLE|FMODE_WRITABLE);
5242
5243 // Ensure waiting_fd users do not hit EBADF.
5244 if (busy) {
5245 // Wait for them to exit before we call close().
5246 do rb_thread_schedule(); while (!ccan_list_empty(busy));
5247 }
5248
5249 // Disable for now.
5250 // if (!done && fd >= 0) {
5251 // VALUE scheduler = rb_fiber_scheduler_current();
5252 // if (scheduler != Qnil) {
5253 // VALUE result = rb_fiber_scheduler_io_close(scheduler, fptr->self);
5254 // if (result != Qundef) done = 1;
5255 // }
5256 // }
5257
5258 if (!done && stdio_file) {
5259 // stdio_file is deallocated anyway even if fclose failed.
5260 if ((maygvl_fclose(stdio_file, noraise) < 0) && NIL_P(error)) {
5261 if (!noraise) {
5262 error = INT2NUM(errno);
5263 }
5264 }
5265
5266 done = 1;
5267 }
5268
5269 if (!done && fd >= 0) {
5270 // fptr->fd may be closed even if close fails. POSIX doesn't specify it.
5271 // We assumes it is closed.
5272
5273 keepgvl |= !(mode & FMODE_WRITABLE);
5274 keepgvl |= noraise;
5275 if ((maygvl_close(fd, keepgvl) < 0) && NIL_P(error)) {
5276 if (!noraise) {
5277 error = INT2NUM(errno);
5278 }
5279 }
5280
5281 done = 1;
5282 }
5283
5284 if (!NIL_P(error) && !noraise) {
5285 if (RB_INTEGER_TYPE_P(error))
5286 rb_syserr_fail_path(NUM2INT(error), fptr->pathv);
5287 else
5288 rb_exc_raise(error);
5289 }
5290}
5291
5292static void
5293fptr_finalize(rb_io_t *fptr, int noraise)
5294{
5295 fptr_finalize_flush(fptr, noraise, FALSE, 0);
5296 free_io_buffer(&fptr->rbuf);
5297 free_io_buffer(&fptr->wbuf);
5298 clear_codeconv(fptr);
5299}
5300
5301static void
5302rb_io_fptr_cleanup(rb_io_t *fptr, int noraise)
5303{
5304 if (fptr->finalize) {
5305 (*fptr->finalize)(fptr, noraise);
5306 }
5307 else {
5308 fptr_finalize(fptr, noraise);
5309 }
5310}
5311
5312static void
5313free_io_buffer(rb_io_buffer_t *buf)
5314{
5315 if (buf->ptr) {
5316 ruby_sized_xfree(buf->ptr, (size_t)buf->capa);
5317 buf->ptr = NULL;
5318 }
5319}
5320
5321static void
5322clear_readconv(rb_io_t *fptr)
5323{
5324 if (fptr->readconv) {
5325 rb_econv_close(fptr->readconv);
5326 fptr->readconv = NULL;
5327 }
5328 free_io_buffer(&fptr->cbuf);
5329}
5330
5331static void
5332clear_writeconv(rb_io_t *fptr)
5333{
5334 if (fptr->writeconv) {
5335 rb_econv_close(fptr->writeconv);
5336 fptr->writeconv = NULL;
5337 }
5338 fptr->writeconv_initialized = 0;
5339}
5340
5341static void
5342clear_codeconv(rb_io_t *fptr)
5343{
5344 clear_readconv(fptr);
5345 clear_writeconv(fptr);
5346}
5347
5348void
5349rb_io_fptr_finalize_internal(void *ptr)
5350{
5351 rb_io_t *fptr = ptr;
5352
5353 if (!ptr) return;
5354 fptr->pathv = Qnil;
5355 if (0 <= fptr->fd)
5356 rb_io_fptr_cleanup(fptr, TRUE);
5357 fptr->write_lock = Qnil;
5358 free_io_buffer(&fptr->rbuf);
5359 free_io_buffer(&fptr->wbuf);
5360 clear_codeconv(fptr);
5361 free(fptr);
5362}
5363
5364#undef rb_io_fptr_finalize
5365int
5366rb_io_fptr_finalize(rb_io_t *fptr)
5367{
5368 if (!fptr) {
5369 return 0;
5370 }
5371 else {
5372 rb_io_fptr_finalize_internal(fptr);
5373 return 1;
5374 }
5375}
5376#define rb_io_fptr_finalize(fptr) rb_io_fptr_finalize_internal(fptr)
5377
5378RUBY_FUNC_EXPORTED size_t
5379rb_io_memsize(const rb_io_t *fptr)
5380{
5381 size_t size = sizeof(rb_io_t);
5382 size += fptr->rbuf.capa;
5383 size += fptr->wbuf.capa;
5384 size += fptr->cbuf.capa;
5385 if (fptr->readconv) size += rb_econv_memsize(fptr->readconv);
5386 if (fptr->writeconv) size += rb_econv_memsize(fptr->writeconv);
5387 return size;
5388}
5389
5390#ifdef _WIN32
5391/* keep GVL while closing to prevent crash on Windows */
5392# define KEEPGVL TRUE
5393#else
5394# define KEEPGVL FALSE
5395#endif
5396
5397int rb_notify_fd_close(int fd, struct ccan_list_head *);
5398static rb_io_t *
5399io_close_fptr(VALUE io)
5400{
5401 rb_io_t *fptr;
5402 VALUE write_io;
5403 rb_io_t *write_fptr;
5404 struct ccan_list_head busy;
5405
5406 ccan_list_head_init(&busy);
5407 write_io = GetWriteIO(io);
5408 if (io != write_io) {
5409 write_fptr = RFILE(write_io)->fptr;
5410 if (write_fptr && 0 <= write_fptr->fd) {
5411 rb_io_fptr_cleanup(write_fptr, TRUE);
5412 }
5413 }
5414
5415 fptr = RFILE(io)->fptr;
5416 if (!fptr) return 0;
5417 if (fptr->fd < 0) return 0;
5418
5419 if (rb_notify_fd_close(fptr->fd, &busy)) {
5420 /* calls close(fptr->fd): */
5421 fptr_finalize_flush(fptr, FALSE, KEEPGVL, &busy);
5422 }
5423 rb_io_fptr_cleanup(fptr, FALSE);
5424 return fptr;
5425}
5426
5427static void
5428fptr_waitpid(rb_io_t *fptr, int nohang)
5429{
5430 int status;
5431 if (fptr->pid) {
5432 rb_last_status_clear();
5433 rb_waitpid(fptr->pid, &status, nohang ? WNOHANG : 0);
5434 fptr->pid = 0;
5435 }
5436}
5437
5438VALUE
5439rb_io_close(VALUE io)
5440{
5441 rb_io_t *fptr = io_close_fptr(io);
5442 if (fptr) fptr_waitpid(fptr, 0);
5443 return Qnil;
5444}
5445
5446/*
5447 * call-seq:
5448 * close -> nil
5449 *
5450 * Closes the stream, if it is open, after flushing any buffered writes
5451 * to the operating system; does nothing if the stream is already closed.
5452 * A stream is automatically closed when claimed by the garbage collector.
5453 *
5454 * If the stream was opened by IO.popen, #close sets global variable <tt>$?</tt>.
5455 *
5456 */
5457
5458static VALUE
5459rb_io_close_m(VALUE io)
5460{
5461 rb_io_t *fptr = rb_io_get_fptr(io);
5462 if (fptr->fd < 0) {
5463 return Qnil;
5464 }
5465 rb_io_close(io);
5466 return Qnil;
5467}
5468
5469static VALUE
5470io_call_close(VALUE io)
5471{
5472 rb_check_funcall(io, rb_intern("close"), 0, 0);
5473 return io;
5474}
5475
5476static VALUE
5477ignore_closed_stream(VALUE io, VALUE exc)
5478{
5479 enum {mesg_len = sizeof(closed_stream)-1};
5480 VALUE mesg = rb_attr_get(exc, idMesg);
5481 if (!RB_TYPE_P(mesg, T_STRING) ||
5482 RSTRING_LEN(mesg) != mesg_len ||
5483 memcmp(RSTRING_PTR(mesg), closed_stream, mesg_len)) {
5484 rb_exc_raise(exc);
5485 }
5486 return io;
5487}
5488
5489static VALUE
5490io_close(VALUE io)
5491{
5492 VALUE closed = rb_check_funcall(io, rb_intern("closed?"), 0, 0);
5493 if (closed != Qundef && RTEST(closed)) return io;
5494 rb_rescue2(io_call_close, io, ignore_closed_stream, io,
5495 rb_eIOError, (VALUE)0);
5496 return io;
5497}
5498
5499/*
5500 * call-seq:
5501 * closed? -> true or false
5502 *
5503 * Returns +true+ if the stream is closed for both reading and writing,
5504 * +false+ otherwise:
5505 *
5506 * f = File.new('t.txt')
5507 * f.close # => nil
5508 * f.closed? # => true
5509 * f = IO.popen('/bin/sh','r+')
5510 * f.close_write # => nil
5511 * f.closed? # => false
5512 * f.close_read # => nil
5513 * f.closed? # => true
5514 *
5515 */
5516
5517
5518static VALUE
5519rb_io_closed(VALUE io)
5520{
5521 rb_io_t *fptr;
5522 VALUE write_io;
5523 rb_io_t *write_fptr;
5524
5525 write_io = GetWriteIO(io);
5526 if (io != write_io) {
5527 write_fptr = RFILE(write_io)->fptr;
5528 if (write_fptr && 0 <= write_fptr->fd) {
5529 return Qfalse;
5530 }
5531 }
5532
5533 fptr = rb_io_get_fptr(io);
5534 return RBOOL(0 > fptr->fd);
5535}
5536
5537/*
5538 * call-seq:
5539 * close_read -> nil
5540 *
5541 * Closes the read end of a duplexed stream (i.e., one that is both readable
5542 * and writable, such as a pipe); does nothing if already closed:
5543 *
5544 * f = IO.popen('/bin/sh','r+')
5545 * f.close_read
5546 * f.readlines # Raises IOError
5547 *
5548 * Raises an exception if the stream is not duplexed.
5549 *
5550 */
5551
5552static VALUE
5553rb_io_close_read(VALUE io)
5554{
5555 rb_io_t *fptr;
5556 VALUE write_io;
5557
5558 fptr = rb_io_get_fptr(rb_io_taint_check(io));
5559 if (fptr->fd < 0) return Qnil;
5560 if (is_socket(fptr->fd, fptr->pathv)) {
5561#ifndef SHUT_RD
5562# define SHUT_RD 0
5563#endif
5564 if (shutdown(fptr->fd, SHUT_RD) < 0)
5565 rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5566 fptr->mode &= ~FMODE_READABLE;
5567 if (!(fptr->mode & FMODE_WRITABLE))
5568 return rb_io_close(io);
5569 return Qnil;
5570 }
5571
5572 write_io = GetWriteIO(io);
5573 if (io != write_io) {
5574 rb_io_t *wfptr;
5575 wfptr = rb_io_get_fptr(rb_io_taint_check(write_io));
5576 wfptr->pid = fptr->pid;
5577 fptr->pid = 0;
5578 RFILE(io)->fptr = wfptr;
5579 /* bind to write_io temporarily to get rid of memory/fd leak */
5580 fptr->tied_io_for_writing = 0;
5581 RFILE(write_io)->fptr = fptr;
5582 rb_io_fptr_cleanup(fptr, FALSE);
5583 /* should not finalize fptr because another thread may be reading it */
5584 return Qnil;
5585 }
5586
5587 if ((fptr->mode & (FMODE_DUPLEX|FMODE_WRITABLE)) == FMODE_WRITABLE) {
5588 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "closing non-duplex IO for reading");
5589 }
5590 return rb_io_close(io);
5591}
5592
5593/*
5594 * call-seq:
5595 * close_write -> nil
5596 *
5597 * Closes the write end of a duplexed stream (i.e., one that is both readable
5598 * and writable, such as a pipe); does nothing if already closed:
5599 *
5600 * f = IO.popen('/bin/sh', 'r+')
5601 * f.close_write
5602 * f.print 'nowhere' # Raises IOError.
5603 *
5604 */
5605
5606static VALUE
5607rb_io_close_write(VALUE io)
5608{
5609 rb_io_t *fptr;
5610 VALUE write_io;
5611
5612 write_io = GetWriteIO(io);
5613 fptr = rb_io_get_fptr(rb_io_taint_check(write_io));
5614 if (fptr->fd < 0) return Qnil;
5615 if (is_socket(fptr->fd, fptr->pathv)) {
5616#ifndef SHUT_WR
5617# define SHUT_WR 1
5618#endif
5619 if (shutdown(fptr->fd, SHUT_WR) < 0)
5620 rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5621 fptr->mode &= ~FMODE_WRITABLE;
5622 if (!(fptr->mode & FMODE_READABLE))
5623 return rb_io_close(write_io);
5624 return Qnil;
5625 }
5626
5627 if ((fptr->mode & (FMODE_DUPLEX|FMODE_READABLE)) == FMODE_READABLE) {
5628 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "closing non-duplex IO for writing");
5629 }
5630
5631 if (io != write_io) {
5632 fptr = rb_io_get_fptr(rb_io_taint_check(io));
5633 fptr->tied_io_for_writing = 0;
5634 }
5635 rb_io_close(write_io);
5636 return Qnil;
5637}
5638
5639/*
5640 * call-seq:
5641 * sysseek(offset, whence = IO::SEEK_SET) -> integer
5642 *
5643 * Behaves like IO#seek, except that it:
5644 *
5645 * - Uses low-level system functions.
5646 * - Returns the new position.
5647 *
5648 */
5649
5650static VALUE
5651rb_io_sysseek(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
5652{
5653 VALUE offset, ptrname;
5654 int whence = SEEK_SET;
5655 rb_io_t *fptr;
5656 off_t pos;
5657
5658 if (rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "11", &offset, &ptrname) == 2) {
5659 whence = interpret_seek_whence(ptrname);
5660 }
5661 pos = NUM2OFFT(offset);
5662 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
5663 if ((fptr->mode & FMODE_READABLE) &&
5664 (READ_DATA_BUFFERED(fptr) || READ_CHAR_PENDING(fptr))) {
5665 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "sysseek for buffered IO");
5666 }
5667 if ((fptr->mode & FMODE_WRITABLE) && fptr->wbuf.len) {
5668 rb_warn("sysseek for buffered IO");
5669 }
5670 errno = 0;
5671 pos = lseek(fptr->fd, pos, whence);
5672 if (pos < 0 && errno) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5673
5674 return OFFT2NUM(pos);
5675}
5676
5677/*
5678 * call-seq:
5679 * syswrite(object) -> integer
5680 *
5681 * Writes the given +object+ to self, which must be opened for writing (see Modes);
5682 * returns the number bytes written.
5683 * If +object+ is not a string is converted via method to_s:
5684 *
5685 * f = File.new('t.tmp', 'w')
5686 * f.syswrite('foo') # => 3
5687 * f.syswrite(30) # => 2
5688 * f.syswrite(:foo) # => 3
5689 * f.close
5690 *
5691 * This methods should not be used with other stream-writer methods.
5692 *
5693 */
5694
5695static VALUE
5696rb_io_syswrite(VALUE io, VALUE str)
5697{
5698 VALUE tmp;
5699 rb_io_t *fptr;
5700 long n, len;
5701 const char *ptr;
5702
5703 if (!RB_TYPE_P(str, T_STRING))
5704 str = rb_obj_as_string(str);
5705
5706 io = GetWriteIO(io);
5707 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
5708 rb_io_check_writable(fptr);
5709
5710 if (fptr->wbuf.len) {
5711 rb_warn("syswrite for buffered IO");
5712 }
5713
5714 tmp = rb_str_tmp_frozen_acquire(str);
5715 RSTRING_GETMEM(tmp, ptr, len);
5716 n = rb_write_internal(fptr, ptr, len);
5717 if (n < 0) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5718 rb_str_tmp_frozen_release(str, tmp);
5719
5720 return LONG2FIX(n);
5721}
5722
5723/*
5724 * call-seq:
5725 * sysread(maxlen) -> string
5726 * sysread(maxlen, out_string) -> string
5727 *
5728 * Behaves like IO#readpartial, except that it uses low-level system functions.
5729 *
5730 * This method should not be used with other stream-reader methods.
5731 *
5732 */
5733
5734static VALUE
5735rb_io_sysread(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
5736{
5737 VALUE len, str;
5738 rb_io_t *fptr;
5739 long n, ilen;
5740 struct io_internal_read_struct iis;
5741 int shrinkable;
5742
5743 rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "11", &len, &str);
5744 ilen = NUM2LONG(len);
5745
5746 shrinkable = io_setstrbuf(&str, ilen);
5747 if (ilen == 0) return str;
5748
5749 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
5750 rb_io_check_byte_readable(fptr);
5751
5752 if (READ_DATA_BUFFERED(fptr)) {
5753 rb_raise(rb_eIOError, "sysread for buffered IO");
5754 }
5755
5756 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
5757
5758 io_setstrbuf(&str, ilen);
5759 iis.th = rb_thread_current();
5760 iis.fptr = fptr;
5761 iis.nonblock = 0;
5762 iis.buf = RSTRING_PTR(str);
5763 iis.capa = ilen;
5764 n = read_internal_locktmp(str, &iis);
5765
5766 if (n < 0) {
5767 rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5768 }
5769
5770 io_set_read_length(str, n, shrinkable);
5771
5772 if (n == 0 && ilen > 0) {
5773 rb_eof_error();
5774 }
5775
5776 return str;
5777}
5778
5779#if defined(HAVE_PREAD) || defined(HAVE_PWRITE)
5780struct prdwr_internal_arg {
5781 int fd;
5782 void *buf;
5783 size_t count;
5784 off_t offset;
5785};
5786#endif /* HAVE_PREAD || HAVE_PWRITE */
5787
5788#if defined(HAVE_PREAD)
5789static VALUE
5790internal_pread_func(void *arg)
5791{
5792 struct prdwr_internal_arg *p = arg;
5793 return (VALUE)pread(p->fd, p->buf, p->count, p->offset);
5794}
5795
5796static VALUE
5797pread_internal_call(VALUE arg)
5798{
5799 struct prdwr_internal_arg *p = (struct prdwr_internal_arg *)arg;
5800 return rb_thread_io_blocking_region(internal_pread_func, p, p->fd);
5801}
5802
5803/*
5804 * call-seq:
5805 * pread(maxlen, offset) -> string
5806 * pread(maxlen, offset, out_string) -> string
5807 *
5808 * Behaves like IO#readpartial, except that it:
5809 *
5810 * - Reads at the given +offset+ (in bytes).
5811 * - Disregards, and does not modify, the stream's position
5812 * (see {Position}[rdoc-ref:IO@Position]).
5813 * - Bypasses any user space buffering in the stream.
5814 *
5815 * Because this method does not disturb the stream's state
5816 * (its position, in particular), +pread+ allows multiple threads and processes
5817 * to use the same \IO object for reading at various offsets.
5818 *
5819 * f = File.open('t.txt')
5820 * f.read # => "First line\nSecond line\n\nFourth line\nFifth line\n"
5821 * f.pos # => 52
5822 * # Read 12 bytes at offset 0.
5823 * f.pread(12, 0) # => "First line\n"
5824 * # Read 9 bytes at offset 8.
5825 * f.pread(9, 8) # => "ne\nSecon"
5826 * f.close
5827 *
5828 * Not available on some platforms.
5829 *
5830 */
5831static VALUE
5832rb_io_pread(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
5833{
5834 VALUE len, offset, str;
5835 rb_io_t *fptr;
5836 ssize_t n;
5837 struct prdwr_internal_arg arg;
5838 int shrinkable;
5839
5840 rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "21", &len, &offset, &str);
5841 arg.count = NUM2SIZET(len);
5842 arg.offset = NUM2OFFT(offset);
5843
5844 shrinkable = io_setstrbuf(&str, (long)arg.count);
5845 if (arg.count == 0) return str;
5846 arg.buf = RSTRING_PTR(str);
5847
5848 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
5849 rb_io_check_byte_readable(fptr);
5850
5851 arg.fd = fptr->fd;
5852 rb_io_check_closed(fptr);
5853
5854 rb_str_locktmp(str);
5855 n = (ssize_t)rb_ensure(pread_internal_call, (VALUE)&arg, rb_str_unlocktmp, str);
5856
5857 if (n < 0) {
5858 rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5859 }
5860 io_set_read_length(str, n, shrinkable);
5861 if (n == 0 && arg.count > 0) {
5862 rb_eof_error();
5863 }
5864
5865 return str;
5866}
5867#else
5868# define rb_io_pread rb_f_notimplement
5869#endif /* HAVE_PREAD */
5870
5871#if defined(HAVE_PWRITE)
5872static VALUE
5873internal_pwrite_func(void *ptr)
5874{
5875 struct prdwr_internal_arg *arg = ptr;
5876
5877 return (VALUE)pwrite(arg->fd, arg->buf, arg->count, arg->offset);
5878}
5879
5880/*
5881 * call-seq:
5882 * pwrite(object, offset) -> integer
5883 *
5884 * Behaves like IO#write, except that it:
5885 *
5886 * - Writes at the given +offset+ (in bytes).
5887 * - Disregards, and does not modify, the stream's position
5888 * (see {Position}[rdoc-ref:IO@Position]).
5889 * - Bypasses any user space buffering in the stream.
5890 *
5891 * Because this method does not disturb the stream's state
5892 * (its position, in particular), +pwrite+ allows multiple threads and processes
5893 * to use the same \IO object for writing at various offsets.
5894 *
5895 * f = File.open('t.tmp', 'w+')
5896 * # Write 6 bytes at offset 3.
5897 * f.pwrite('ABCDEF', 3) # => 6
5898 * f.rewind
5899 * f.read # => "\u0000\u0000\u0000ABCDEF"
5900 * f.close
5901 *
5902 * Not available on some platforms.
5903 *
5904 */
5905static VALUE
5906rb_io_pwrite(VALUE io, VALUE str, VALUE offset)
5907{
5908 rb_io_t *fptr;
5909 ssize_t n;
5910 struct prdwr_internal_arg arg;
5911 VALUE tmp;
5912
5913 if (!RB_TYPE_P(str, T_STRING))
5914 str = rb_obj_as_string(str);
5915
5916 arg.offset = NUM2OFFT(offset);
5917
5918 io = GetWriteIO(io);
5919 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
5920 rb_io_check_writable(fptr);
5921 arg.fd = fptr->fd;
5922
5923 tmp = rb_str_tmp_frozen_acquire(str);
5924 arg.buf = RSTRING_PTR(tmp);
5925 arg.count = (size_t)RSTRING_LEN(tmp);
5926
5927 n = (ssize_t)rb_thread_io_blocking_region(internal_pwrite_func, &arg, fptr->fd);
5928 if (n < 0) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
5929 rb_str_tmp_frozen_release(str, tmp);
5930
5931 return SSIZET2NUM(n);
5932}
5933#else
5934# define rb_io_pwrite rb_f_notimplement
5935#endif /* HAVE_PWRITE */
5936
5937VALUE
5938rb_io_binmode(VALUE io)
5939{
5940 rb_io_t *fptr;
5941
5942 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
5943 if (fptr->readconv)
5944 rb_econv_binmode(fptr->readconv);
5945 if (fptr->writeconv)
5946 rb_econv_binmode(fptr->writeconv);
5947 fptr->mode |= FMODE_BINMODE;
5948 fptr->mode &= ~FMODE_TEXTMODE;
5949 fptr->writeconv_pre_ecflags &= ~ECONV_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_MASK;
5950#ifdef O_BINARY
5951 if (!fptr->readconv) {
5952 SET_BINARY_MODE_WITH_SEEK_CUR(fptr);
5953 }
5954 else {
5955 setmode(fptr->fd, O_BINARY);
5956 }
5957#endif
5958 return io;
5959}
5960
5961static void
5962io_ascii8bit_binmode(rb_io_t *fptr)
5963{
5964 if (fptr->readconv) {
5965 rb_econv_close(fptr->readconv);
5966 fptr->readconv = NULL;
5967 }
5968 if (fptr->writeconv) {
5969 rb_econv_close(fptr->writeconv);
5970 fptr->writeconv = NULL;
5971 }
5972 fptr->mode |= FMODE_BINMODE;
5973 fptr->mode &= ~FMODE_TEXTMODE;
5974 SET_BINARY_MODE_WITH_SEEK_CUR(fptr);
5975
5976 fptr->encs.enc = rb_ascii8bit_encoding();
5977 fptr->encs.enc2 = NULL;
5978 fptr->encs.ecflags = 0;
5979 fptr->encs.ecopts = Qnil;
5980 clear_codeconv(fptr);
5981}
5982
5983VALUE
5984rb_io_ascii8bit_binmode(VALUE io)
5985{
5986 rb_io_t *fptr;
5987
5988 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
5989 io_ascii8bit_binmode(fptr);
5990
5991 return io;
5992}
5993
5994/*
5995 * call-seq:
5996 * binmode -> self
5997 *
5998 * Sets the stream's data mode as binary
5999 * (see {Data Mode}[rdoc-ref:IO@Data+Mode]).
6000 *
6001 * A stream's data mode may not be changed from binary to text.
6002 *
6003 */
6004
6005static VALUE
6006rb_io_binmode_m(VALUE io)
6007{
6008 VALUE write_io;
6009
6010 rb_io_ascii8bit_binmode(io);
6011
6012 write_io = GetWriteIO(io);
6013 if (write_io != io)
6014 rb_io_ascii8bit_binmode(write_io);
6015 return io;
6016}
6017
6018/*
6019 * call-seq:
6020 * binmode? -> true or false
6021 *
6022 * Returns +true+ if the stream is on binary mode, +false+ otherwise.
6023 * See {Data Mode}[rdoc-ref:IO@Data+Mode].
6024 *
6025 */
6026static VALUE
6027rb_io_binmode_p(VALUE io)
6028{
6029 rb_io_t *fptr;
6030 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
6031 return RBOOL(fptr->mode & FMODE_BINMODE);
6032}
6033
6034static const char*
6035rb_io_fmode_modestr(int fmode)
6036{
6037 if (fmode & FMODE_APPEND) {
6038 if ((fmode & FMODE_READWRITE) == FMODE_READWRITE) {
6039 return MODE_BTMODE("a+", "ab+", "at+");
6040 }
6041 return MODE_BTMODE("a", "ab", "at");
6042 }
6043 switch (fmode & FMODE_READWRITE) {
6044 default:
6045 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "invalid access fmode 0x%x", fmode);
6046 case FMODE_READABLE:
6047 return MODE_BTMODE("r", "rb", "rt");
6048 case FMODE_WRITABLE:
6049 return MODE_BTXMODE("w", "wb", "wt", "wx", "wbx", "wtx");
6050 case FMODE_READWRITE:
6051 if (fmode & FMODE_CREATE) {
6052 return MODE_BTXMODE("w+", "wb+", "wt+", "w+x", "wb+x", "wt+x");
6053 }
6054 return MODE_BTMODE("r+", "rb+", "rt+");
6055 }
6056}
6057
6058static const char bom_prefix[] = "bom|";
6059static const char utf_prefix[] = "utf-";
6060enum {bom_prefix_len = (int)sizeof(bom_prefix) - 1};
6061enum {utf_prefix_len = (int)sizeof(utf_prefix) - 1};
6062
6063static int
6064io_encname_bom_p(const char *name, long len)
6065{
6066 return len > bom_prefix_len && STRNCASECMP(name, bom_prefix, bom_prefix_len) == 0;
6067}
6068
6069int
6070rb_io_modestr_fmode(const char *modestr)
6071{
6072 int fmode = 0;
6073 const char *m = modestr, *p = NULL;
6074
6075 switch (*m++) {
6076 case 'r':
6077 fmode |= FMODE_READABLE;
6078 break;
6079 case 'w':
6080 fmode |= FMODE_WRITABLE | FMODE_TRUNC | FMODE_CREATE;
6081 break;
6082 case 'a':
6083 fmode |= FMODE_WRITABLE | FMODE_APPEND | FMODE_CREATE;
6084 break;
6085 default:
6086 goto error;
6087 }
6088
6089 while (*m) {
6090 switch (*m++) {
6091 case 'b':
6092 fmode |= FMODE_BINMODE;
6093 break;
6094 case 't':
6095 fmode |= FMODE_TEXTMODE;
6096 break;
6097 case '+':
6098 fmode |= FMODE_READWRITE;
6099 break;
6100 case 'x':
6101 if (modestr[0] != 'w')
6102 goto error;
6103 fmode |= FMODE_EXCL;
6104 break;
6105 default:
6106 goto error;
6107 case ':':
6108 p = strchr(m, ':');
6109 if (io_encname_bom_p(m, p ? (long)(p - m) : (long)strlen(m)))
6110 fmode |= FMODE_SETENC_BY_BOM;
6111 goto finished;
6112 }
6113 }
6114
6115 finished:
6116 if ((fmode & FMODE_BINMODE) && (fmode & FMODE_TEXTMODE))
6117 goto error;
6118
6119 return fmode;
6120
6121 error:
6122 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "invalid access mode %s", modestr);
6123 UNREACHABLE_RETURN(Qundef);
6124}
6125
6126int
6127rb_io_oflags_fmode(int oflags)
6128{
6129 int fmode = 0;
6130
6131 switch (oflags & O_ACCMODE) {
6132 case O_RDONLY:
6133 fmode = FMODE_READABLE;
6134 break;
6135 case O_WRONLY:
6136 fmode = FMODE_WRITABLE;
6137 break;
6138 case O_RDWR:
6139 fmode = FMODE_READWRITE;
6140 break;
6141 }
6142
6143 if (oflags & O_APPEND) {
6144 fmode |= FMODE_APPEND;
6145 }
6146 if (oflags & O_TRUNC) {
6147 fmode |= FMODE_TRUNC;
6148 }
6149 if (oflags & O_CREAT) {
6150 fmode |= FMODE_CREATE;
6151 }
6152 if (oflags & O_EXCL) {
6153 fmode |= FMODE_EXCL;
6154 }
6155#ifdef O_BINARY
6156 if (oflags & O_BINARY) {
6157 fmode |= FMODE_BINMODE;
6158 }
6159#endif
6160
6161 return fmode;
6162}
6163
6164static int
6165rb_io_fmode_oflags(int fmode)
6166{
6167 int oflags = 0;
6168
6169 switch (fmode & FMODE_READWRITE) {
6170 case FMODE_READABLE:
6171 oflags |= O_RDONLY;
6172 break;
6173 case FMODE_WRITABLE:
6174 oflags |= O_WRONLY;
6175 break;
6176 case FMODE_READWRITE:
6177 oflags |= O_RDWR;
6178 break;
6179 }
6180
6181 if (fmode & FMODE_APPEND) {
6182 oflags |= O_APPEND;
6183 }
6184 if (fmode & FMODE_TRUNC) {
6185 oflags |= O_TRUNC;
6186 }
6187 if (fmode & FMODE_CREATE) {
6188 oflags |= O_CREAT;
6189 }
6190 if (fmode & FMODE_EXCL) {
6191 oflags |= O_EXCL;
6192 }
6193#ifdef O_BINARY
6194 if (fmode & FMODE_BINMODE) {
6195 oflags |= O_BINARY;
6196 }
6197#endif
6198
6199 return oflags;
6200}
6201
6202int
6203rb_io_modestr_oflags(const char *modestr)
6204{
6205 return rb_io_fmode_oflags(rb_io_modestr_fmode(modestr));
6206}
6207
6208static const char*
6209rb_io_oflags_modestr(int oflags)
6210{
6211#ifdef O_BINARY
6212# define MODE_BINARY(a,b) ((oflags & O_BINARY) ? (b) : (a))
6213#else
6214# define MODE_BINARY(a,b) (a)
6215#endif
6216 int accmode;
6217 if (oflags & O_EXCL) {
6218 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "exclusive access mode is not supported");
6219 }
6220 accmode = oflags & (O_RDONLY|O_WRONLY|O_RDWR);
6221 if (oflags & O_APPEND) {
6222 if (accmode == O_WRONLY) {
6223 return MODE_BINARY("a", "ab");
6224 }
6225 if (accmode == O_RDWR) {
6226 return MODE_BINARY("a+", "ab+");
6227 }
6228 }
6229 switch (accmode) {
6230 default:
6231 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "invalid access oflags 0x%x", oflags);
6232 case O_RDONLY:
6233 return MODE_BINARY("r", "rb");
6234 case O_WRONLY:
6235 return MODE_BINARY("w", "wb");
6236 case O_RDWR:
6237 if (oflags & O_TRUNC) {
6238 return MODE_BINARY("w+", "wb+");
6239 }
6240 return MODE_BINARY("r+", "rb+");
6241 }
6242}
6243
6244/*
6245 * Convert external/internal encodings to enc/enc2
6246 * NULL => use default encoding
6247 * Qnil => no encoding specified (internal only)
6248 */
6249static void
6250rb_io_ext_int_to_encs(rb_encoding *ext, rb_encoding *intern, rb_encoding **enc, rb_encoding **enc2, int fmode)
6251{
6252 int default_ext = 0;
6253
6254 if (ext == NULL) {
6255 ext = rb_default_external_encoding();
6256 default_ext = 1;
6257 }
6258 if (ext == rb_ascii8bit_encoding()) {
6259 /* If external is ASCII-8BIT, no transcoding */
6260 intern = NULL;
6261 }
6262 else if (intern == NULL) {
6263 intern = rb_default_internal_encoding();
6264 }
6265 if (intern == NULL || intern == (rb_encoding *)Qnil ||
6266 (!(fmode & FMODE_SETENC_BY_BOM) && (intern == ext))) {
6267 /* No internal encoding => use external + no transcoding */
6268 *enc = (default_ext && intern != ext) ? NULL : ext;
6269 *enc2 = NULL;
6270 }
6271 else {
6272 *enc = intern;
6273 *enc2 = ext;
6274 }
6275}
6276
6277static void
6278unsupported_encoding(const char *name, rb_encoding *enc)
6279{
6280 rb_enc_warn(enc, "Unsupported encoding %s ignored", name);
6281}
6282
6283static void
6284parse_mode_enc(const char *estr, rb_encoding *estr_enc,
6285 rb_encoding **enc_p, rb_encoding **enc2_p, int *fmode_p)
6286{
6287 const char *p;
6288 char encname[ENCODING_MAXNAMELEN+1];
6289 int idx, idx2;
6290 int fmode = fmode_p ? *fmode_p : 0;
6291 rb_encoding *ext_enc, *int_enc;
6292 long len;
6293
6294 /* parse estr as "enc" or "enc2:enc" or "enc:-" */
6295
6296 p = strrchr(estr, ':');
6297 len = p ? (p++ - estr) : (long)strlen(estr);
6298 if ((fmode & FMODE_SETENC_BY_BOM) || io_encname_bom_p(estr, len)) {
6299 estr += bom_prefix_len;
6300 len -= bom_prefix_len;
6301 if (!STRNCASECMP(estr, utf_prefix, utf_prefix_len)) {
6302 fmode |= FMODE_SETENC_BY_BOM;
6303 }
6304 else {
6305 rb_enc_warn(estr_enc, "BOM with non-UTF encoding %s is nonsense", estr);
6306 fmode &= ~FMODE_SETENC_BY_BOM;
6307 }
6308 }
6309 if (len == 0 || len > ENCODING_MAXNAMELEN) {
6310 idx = -1;
6311 }
6312 else {
6313 if (p) {
6314 memcpy(encname, estr, len);
6315 encname[len] = '\0';
6316 estr = encname;
6317 }
6318 idx = rb_enc_find_index(estr);
6319 }
6320 if (fmode_p) *fmode_p = fmode;
6321
6322 if (idx >= 0)
6323 ext_enc = rb_enc_from_index(idx);
6324 else {
6325 if (idx != -2)
6326 unsupported_encoding(estr, estr_enc);
6327 ext_enc = NULL;
6328 }
6329
6330 int_enc = NULL;
6331 if (p) {
6332 if (*p == '-' && *(p+1) == '\0') {
6333 /* Special case - "-" => no transcoding */
6334 int_enc = (rb_encoding *)Qnil;
6335 }
6336 else {
6337 idx2 = rb_enc_find_index(p);
6338 if (idx2 < 0)
6339 unsupported_encoding(p, estr_enc);
6340 else if (!(fmode & FMODE_SETENC_BY_BOM) && (idx2 == idx)) {
6341 int_enc = (rb_encoding *)Qnil;
6342 }
6343 else
6344 int_enc = rb_enc_from_index(idx2);
6345 }
6346 }
6347
6348 rb_io_ext_int_to_encs(ext_enc, int_enc, enc_p, enc2_p, fmode);
6349}
6350
6351int
6352rb_io_extract_encoding_option(VALUE opt, rb_encoding **enc_p, rb_encoding **enc2_p, int *fmode_p)
6353{
6354 VALUE encoding=Qnil, extenc=Qundef, intenc=Qundef, tmp;
6355 int extracted = 0;
6356 rb_encoding *extencoding = NULL;
6357 rb_encoding *intencoding = NULL;
6358
6359 if (!NIL_P(opt)) {
6360 VALUE v;
6361 v = rb_hash_lookup2(opt, sym_encoding, Qnil);
6362 if (v != Qnil) encoding = v;
6363 v = rb_hash_lookup2(opt, sym_extenc, Qundef);
6364 if (v != Qnil) extenc = v;
6365 v = rb_hash_lookup2(opt, sym_intenc, Qundef);
6366 if (v != Qundef) intenc = v;
6367 }
6368 if ((extenc != Qundef || intenc != Qundef) && !NIL_P(encoding)) {
6369 if (!NIL_P(ruby_verbose)) {
6370 int idx = rb_to_encoding_index(encoding);
6371 if (idx >= 0) encoding = rb_enc_from_encoding(rb_enc_from_index(idx));
6372 rb_warn("Ignoring encoding parameter '%"PRIsVALUE"': %s_encoding is used",
6373 encoding, extenc == Qundef ? "internal" : "external");
6374 }
6375 encoding = Qnil;
6376 }
6377 if (extenc != Qundef && !NIL_P(extenc)) {
6378 extencoding = rb_to_encoding(extenc);
6379 }
6380 if (intenc != Qundef) {
6381 if (NIL_P(intenc)) {
6382 /* internal_encoding: nil => no transcoding */
6383 intencoding = (rb_encoding *)Qnil;
6384 }
6385 else if (!NIL_P(tmp = rb_check_string_type(intenc))) {
6386 char *p = StringValueCStr(tmp);
6387
6388 if (*p == '-' && *(p+1) == '\0') {
6389 /* Special case - "-" => no transcoding */
6390 intencoding = (rb_encoding *)Qnil;
6391 }
6392 else {
6393 intencoding = rb_to_encoding(intenc);
6394 }
6395 }
6396 else {
6397 intencoding = rb_to_encoding(intenc);
6398 }
6399 if (extencoding == intencoding) {
6400 intencoding = (rb_encoding *)Qnil;
6401 }
6402 }
6403 if (!NIL_P(encoding)) {
6404 extracted = 1;
6405 if (!NIL_P(tmp = rb_check_string_type(encoding))) {
6406 parse_mode_enc(StringValueCStr(tmp), rb_enc_get(tmp),
6407 enc_p, enc2_p, fmode_p);
6408 }
6409 else {
6410 rb_io_ext_int_to_encs(rb_to_encoding(encoding), NULL, enc_p, enc2_p, 0);
6411 }
6412 }
6413 else if (extenc != Qundef || intenc != Qundef) {
6414 extracted = 1;
6415 rb_io_ext_int_to_encs(extencoding, intencoding, enc_p, enc2_p, 0);
6416 }
6417 return extracted;
6418}
6419
6420typedef struct rb_io_enc_t convconfig_t;
6421
6422static void
6423validate_enc_binmode(int *fmode_p, int ecflags, rb_encoding *enc, rb_encoding *enc2)
6424{
6425 int fmode = *fmode_p;
6426
6427 if ((fmode & FMODE_READABLE) &&
6428 !enc2 &&
6429 !(fmode & FMODE_BINMODE) &&
6430 !rb_enc_asciicompat(enc ? enc : rb_default_external_encoding()))
6431 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "ASCII incompatible encoding needs binmode");
6432
6433 if ((fmode & FMODE_BINMODE) && (ecflags & ECONV_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_MASK)) {
6434 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "newline decorator with binary mode");
6435 }
6436 if (!(fmode & FMODE_BINMODE) &&
6437 (DEFAULT_TEXTMODE || (ecflags & ECONV_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_MASK))) {
6438 fmode |= FMODE_TEXTMODE;
6439 *fmode_p = fmode;
6440 }
6441#if !DEFAULT_TEXTMODE
6442 else if (!(ecflags & ECONV_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_MASK)) {
6443 fmode &= ~FMODE_TEXTMODE;
6444 *fmode_p = fmode;
6445 }
6446#endif
6447}
6448
6449static void
6450extract_binmode(VALUE opthash, int *fmode)
6451{
6452 if (!NIL_P(opthash)) {
6453 VALUE v;
6454 v = rb_hash_aref(opthash, sym_textmode);
6455 if (!NIL_P(v)) {
6456 if (*fmode & FMODE_TEXTMODE)
6457 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "textmode specified twice");
6458 if (*fmode & FMODE_BINMODE)
6459 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "both textmode and binmode specified");
6460 if (RTEST(v))
6461 *fmode |= FMODE_TEXTMODE;
6462 }
6463 v = rb_hash_aref(opthash, sym_binmode);
