9511 rb_warn("Can't rename %"PRIsVALUE" to %"PRIsVALUE": %s, skipping file",
9512 filename, str, strerror(errno));
9513 close(fr);
9514 goto retry;
9515 }
9516#endif
9517 }
9518 else {
9519#ifdef NO_SAFE_RENAME
9520 rb_fatal("Can't do inplace edit without backup");
9521#else
9522 if (unlink(fn) < 0) {
9523 rb_warn("Can't remove %"PRIsVALUE": %s, skipping file",
9524 filename, strerror(errno));
9525 close(fr);
9526 goto retry;
9527 }
9528#endif
9529 }
9530 fw = rb_sysopen(filename, O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_TRUNC, 0666);
9531#ifndef NO_SAFE_RENAME
9532 fstat(fw, &st2);
9533#ifdef HAVE_FCHMOD
9534 fchmod(fw, st.st_mode);
9535#else
9536 chmod(fn, st.st_mode);
9537#endif
9538 if (st.st_uid!=st2.st_uid || st.st_gid!=st2.st_gid) {
9539 int err;
9540#ifdef HAVE_FCHOWN
9541 err = fchown(fw, st.st_uid, st.st_gid);
9542#else
9543 err = chown(fn, st.st_uid, st.st_gid);
9544#endif
9545 if (err && getuid() == 0 && st2.st_uid == 0) {
9546 const char *wkfn = RSTRING_PTR(filename);
9547 rb_warn("Can't set owner/group of %"PRIsVALUE" to same as %"PRIsVALUE": %s, skipping file",
9548 filename, str, strerror(errno));
9549 (void)close(fr);
9550 (void)close(fw);
9551 (void)unlink(wkfn);
9552 goto retry;
9553 }
9554 }
9555#endif
9556 write_io = prep_io(fw, FMODE_WRITABLE, rb_cFile, fn);
9557 rb_ractor_stdout_set(write_io);
9558 if (stdout_binmode) rb_io_binmode(rb_stdout);
9559 }
9560 fmode = FMODE_READABLE;
9561 if (!ARGF.binmode) {
9562 fmode |= DEFAULT_TEXTMODE;
9563 }
9564 ARGF.current_file = prep_io(fr, fmode, rb_cFile, fn);
9565 if (!NIL_P(write_io)) {
9566 rb_io_set_write_io(ARGF.current_file, write_io);
9567 }
9568 RB_GC_GUARD(filename);
9569 }
9570 if (ARGF.binmode) rb_io_ascii8bit_binmode(ARGF.current_file);
9571 GetOpenFile(ARGF.current_file, fptr);
9572 if (ARGF.encs.enc) {
9573 fptr->encs = ARGF.encs;
9574 clear_codeconv(fptr);
9575 }
9576 else {
9577 fptr->encs.ecflags &= ~ECONV_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_MASK;
9578 if (!ARGF.binmode) {
9579 fptr->encs.ecflags |= ECONV_DEFAULT_NEWLINE_DECORATOR;
9580#ifdef TEXTMODE_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_WRITE
9581 fptr->encs.ecflags |= TEXTMODE_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_ON_WRITE;
9582#endif
9583 }
9584 }
9585 ARGF.next_p = 0;
9586 }
9587 else {
9588 ARGF.next_p = 1;
9589 return FALSE;
9590 }
9591 }
9592 else if (ARGF.next_p == -1) {
9593 ARGF.current_file = rb_stdin;
9594 ARGF.filename = rb_str_new2("-");
9595 if (ARGF.inplace) {
9596 rb_warn("Can't do inplace edit for stdio");
9597 rb_ractor_stdout_set(orig_stdout);
9598 }
9599 }
9600 if (ARGF.init_p == -1) ARGF.init_p = 1;
9601 return TRUE;
9602}
9603
9604static VALUE
9605argf_getline(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE argf)
9606{
9607 VALUE line;
9608 long lineno = ARGF.lineno;
9609
9610 retry:
9611 if (!next_argv()) return Qnil;
9612 if (ARGF_GENERIC_INPUT_P()) {
9613 line = forward_current(idGets, argc, argv);
9614 }
9615 else {
9616 if (argc == 0 && rb_rs == rb_default_rs) {
9617 line = rb_io_gets(ARGF.current_file);
9618 }
9619 else {
9620 line = rb_io_getline(argc, argv, ARGF.current_file);
9621 }
9622 if (NIL_P(line) && ARGF.next_p != -1) {
9623 argf_close(argf);
9624 ARGF.next_p = 1;
9625 goto retry;
9626 }
9627 }
9628 if (!NIL_P(line)) {
9629 ARGF.lineno = ++lineno;
9630 ARGF.last_lineno = ARGF.lineno;
9631 }
9632 return line;
9633}
9634
9635static VALUE
9636argf_lineno_getter(ID id, VALUE *var)
9637{
9638 VALUE argf = *var;
9639 return INT2FIX(ARGF.last_lineno);
9640}
9641
9642static void
9643argf_lineno_setter(VALUE val, ID id, VALUE *var)
9644{
9645 VALUE argf = *var;
9646 int n = NUM2INT(val);
9647 ARGF.last_lineno = ARGF.lineno = n;
9648}
9649
9650static VALUE argf_gets(int, VALUE *, VALUE);
9651
9652/*
9653 * call-seq:
9654 * gets(sep=$/ [, getline_args]) -> string or nil
9655 * gets(limit [, getline_args]) -> string or nil
9656 * gets(sep, limit [, getline_args]) -> string or nil
9657 *
9658 * Returns (and assigns to <code>$_</code>) the next line from the list
9659 * of files in +ARGV+ (or <code>$*</code>), or from standard input if
9660 * no files are present on the command line. Returns +nil+ at end of
9661 * file. The optional argument specifies the record separator. The
9662 * separator is included with the contents of each record. A separator
9663 * of +nil+ reads the entire contents, and a zero-length separator
9664 * reads the input one paragraph at a time, where paragraphs are
9665 * divided by two consecutive newlines. If the first argument is an
9666 * integer, or optional second argument is given, the returning string
9667 * would not be longer than the given value in bytes. If multiple
9668 * filenames are present in +ARGV+, <code>gets(nil)</code> will read
9669 * the contents one file at a time.
9670 *
9671 * ARGV << "testfile"
9672 * print while gets
9673 *
9674 * <em>produces:</em>
9675 *
9676 * This is line one
9677 * This is line two
9678 * This is line three
9679 * And so on...
9680 *
9681 * The style of programming using <code>$_</code> as an implicit
9682 * parameter is gradually losing favor in the Ruby community.
9683 */
9684
9685static VALUE
9686rb_f_gets(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE recv)
9687{
9688 if (recv == argf) {
9689 return argf_gets(argc, argv, argf);
9690 }
9691 return forward(argf, idGets, argc, argv);
9692}
9693
9694/*
9695 * call-seq:
9696 * ARGF.gets(sep=$/ [, getline_args]) -> string or nil
9697 * ARGF.gets(limit [, getline_args]) -> string or nil
9698 * ARGF.gets(sep, limit [, getline_args]) -> string or nil
9699 *
9700 * Returns the next line from the current file in +ARGF+.
9701 *
9702 * By default lines are assumed to be separated by <code>$/</code>;
9703 * to use a different character as a separator, supply it as a +String+
9704 * for the _sep_ argument.
9705 *
9706 * The optional _limit_ argument specifies how many characters of each line
9707 * to return. By default all characters are returned.
9708 *
9709 * See IO.readlines for details about getline_args.
9710 *
9711 */
9712static VALUE
9713argf_gets(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE argf)
9714{
9715 VALUE line;
9716
9717 line = argf_getline(argc, argv, argf);
9718 rb_lastline_set(line);
9719
9720 return line;
9721}
9722
9723VALUE
9724rb_gets(void)
9725{
9726 VALUE line;
9727
9728 if (rb_rs != rb_default_rs) {
9729 return rb_f_gets(0, 0, argf);
9730 }
9731
9732 retry:
9733 if (!next_argv()) return Qnil;
9734 line = rb_io_gets(ARGF.current_file);
9735 if (NIL_P(line) && ARGF.next_p != -1) {
9736 rb_io_close(ARGF.current_file);
9737 ARGF.next_p = 1;
9738 goto retry;
9739 }
9740 rb_lastline_set(line);
9741 if (!NIL_P(line)) {
9742 ARGF.lineno++;
9743 ARGF.last_lineno = ARGF.lineno;
9744 }
9745
9746 return line;
9747}
9748
9749static VALUE argf_readline(int, VALUE *, VALUE);
9750
9751/*
9752 * call-seq:
9753 * readline(sep = $/, **line_opts) -> string
9754 * readline(limit, **line_opts) -> string
9755 * readline(sep, limit, **line_opts) -> string
9756 *
9757 * Equivalent to method Kernel#gets, except that it raises an exception
9758 * if called at end-of-stream:
9759 *
9760 * $ cat t.txt | ruby -e "p readlines; readline"
9761 * ["First line\n", "Second line\n", "\n", "Fourth line\n", "Fifth line\n"]
9762 * in `readline': end of file reached (EOFError)
9763 *
9764 */
9765
9766static VALUE
9767rb_f_readline(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE recv)
9768{
9769 if (recv == argf) {
9770 return argf_readline(argc, argv, argf);
9771 }
9772 return forward(argf, rb_intern("readline"), argc, argv);
9773}
9774
9775
9776/*
9777 * call-seq:
9778 * ARGF.readline(sep=$/) -> string
9779 * ARGF.readline(limit) -> string
9780 * ARGF.readline(sep, limit) -> string
9781 *
9782 * Returns the next line from the current file in +ARGF+.
9783 *
9784 * By default lines are assumed to be separated by <code>$/</code>;
9785 * to use a different character as a separator, supply it as a +String+
9786 * for the _sep_ argument.
9787 *
9788 * The optional _limit_ argument specifies how many characters of each line
9789 * to return. By default all characters are returned.
9790 *
9791 * An +EOFError+ is raised at the end of the file.
9792 */
9793static VALUE
9794argf_readline(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE argf)
9795{
9796 VALUE line;
9797
9798 if (!next_argv()) rb_eof_error();
9799 ARGF_FORWARD(argc, argv);
9800 line = argf_gets(argc, argv, argf);
9801 if (NIL_P(line)) {
9802 rb_eof_error();
9803 }
9804
9805 return line;
9806}
9807
9808static VALUE argf_readlines(int, VALUE *, VALUE);
9809
9810/*
9811 * call-seq:
9812 * readlines(sep = $/, **line_opts) -> array
9813 * readlines(limit, **line_opts) -> array
9814 * readlines(sep, limit, **line_opts) -> array
9815 *
9816 * Returns an array containing the lines returned by calling
9817 * Kernel#gets until the end-of-file is reached;
9818 * (see {Lines}[rdoc-ref:IO@Lines]).
9819 *
9820 * With only string argument +sep+ given,
9821 * returns the remaining lines as determined by line separator +sep+,
9822 * or +nil+ if none;
9823 * see {Line Separator}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Separator]:
9824 *
9825 * # Default separator.
9826 * $ cat t.txt | ruby -e "p readlines"
9827 * ["First line\n", "Second line\n", "\n", "Fourth line\n", "Fifth line\n"]
9828 *
9829 * # Specified separator.
9830 * $ cat t.txt | ruby -e "p readlines 'li'"
9831 * ["First li", "ne\nSecond li", "ne\n\nFourth li", "ne\nFifth li", "ne\n"]
9832 *
9833 * # Get-all separator.
9834 * $ cat t.txt | ruby -e "p readlines nil"
9835 * ["First line\nSecond line\n\nFourth line\nFifth line\n"]
9836 *
9837 * # Get-paragraph separator.
9838 * $ cat t.txt | ruby -e "p readlines ''"
9839 * ["First line\nSecond line\n\n", "Fourth line\nFifth line\n"]
9840 *
9841 * With only integer argument +limit+ given,
9842 * limits the number of bytes in the line;
9843 * see {Line Limit}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Limit]:
9844 *
9845 * $cat t.txt | ruby -e "p readlines 10"
9846 * ["First line", "\n", "Second lin", "e\n", "\n", "Fourth lin", "e\n", "Fifth line", "\n"]
9847 *
9848 * $cat t.txt | ruby -e "p readlines 11"
9849 * ["First line\n", "Second line", "\n", "\n", "Fourth line", "\n", "Fifth line\n"]
9850 *
9851 * $cat t.txt | ruby -e "p readlines 12"
9852 * ["First line\n", "Second line\n", "\n", "Fourth line\n", "Fifth line\n"]
9853 *
9854 * With arguments +sep+ and +limit+ given, combines the two behaviors;
9855 * see {Line Separator and Line Limit}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Separator+and+Line+Limit].
9856 *
9857 * For all forms above, optional keyword arguments specify:
9858 *
9859 * - {Line Options}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Options].
9860 * - {Encoding options}[rdoc-ref:encodings.rdoc@Encoding+Options].
9861 *
9862 * Examples:
9863 *
9864 * $ cat t.txt | ruby -e "p readlines(chomp: true)"
9865 * ["First line", "Second line", "", "Fourth line", "Fifth line"]
9866 *
9867 */
9868
9869static VALUE
9870rb_f_readlines(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE recv)
9871{
9872 if (recv == argf) {
9873 return argf_readlines(argc, argv, argf);
9874 }
9875 return forward(argf, rb_intern("readlines"), argc, argv);
9876}
9877
9878/*
9879 * call-seq:
9880 * ARGF.readlines(sep=$/) -> array
9881 * ARGF.readlines(limit) -> array
9882 * ARGF.readlines(sep, limit) -> array
9883 *
9884 * ARGF.to_a(sep=$/) -> array
9885 * ARGF.to_a(limit) -> array
9886 * ARGF.to_a(sep, limit) -> array
9887 *
9888 * Reads +ARGF+'s current file in its entirety, returning an +Array+ of its
9889 * lines, one line per element. Lines are assumed to be separated by _sep_.
9890 *
9891 * lines = ARGF.readlines
9892 * lines[0] #=> "This is line one\n"
9893 */
9894static VALUE
9895argf_readlines(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE argf)
9896{
9897 long lineno = ARGF.lineno;
9898 VALUE lines, ary;
9899
9900 ary = rb_ary_new();
9901 while (next_argv()) {
9902 if (ARGF_GENERIC_INPUT_P()) {
9903 lines = forward_current(rb_intern("readlines"), argc, argv);
9904 }
9905 else {
9906 lines = rb_io_readlines(argc, argv, ARGF.current_file);
9907 argf_close(argf);
9908 }
9909 ARGF.next_p = 1;
9910 rb_ary_concat(ary, lines);
9911 ARGF.lineno = lineno + RARRAY_LEN(ary);
9912 ARGF.last_lineno = ARGF.lineno;
9913 }
9914 ARGF.init_p = 0;
9915 return ary;
9916}
9917
9918/*
9919 * call-seq:
9920 * `command` -> string
9921 *
9922 * Returns the <tt>$stdout</tt> output from running +command+ in a subshell;
9923 * sets global variable <tt>$?</tt> to the process status.
9924 *
9925 * This method has potential security vulnerabilities if called with untrusted input;
9926 * see {Command Injection}[rdoc-ref:command_injection.rdoc].
9927 *
9928 * Examples:
9929 *
9930 * $ `date` # => "Wed Apr 9 08:56:30 CDT 2003\n"
9931 * $ `echo oops && exit 99` # => "oops\n"
9932 * $ $? # => #<Process::Status: pid 17088 exit 99>
9933 * $ $?.status # => 99>
9934 *
9935 * The built-in syntax <tt>%x{...}</tt> uses this method.
9936 *
9937 */
9938
9939static VALUE
9940rb_f_backquote(VALUE obj, VALUE str)
9941{
9942 VALUE port;
9943 VALUE result;
9944 rb_io_t *fptr;
9945
9946 SafeStringValue(str);
9947 rb_last_status_clear();
9948 port = pipe_open_s(str, "r", FMODE_READABLE|DEFAULT_TEXTMODE, NULL);
9949 if (NIL_P(port)) return rb_str_new(0,0);
9950
9951 GetOpenFile(port, fptr);
9952 result = read_all(fptr, remain_size(fptr), Qnil);
9953 rb_io_close(port);
9954 RFILE(port)->fptr = NULL;
9955 rb_io_fptr_finalize(fptr);
9956 RB_GC_GUARD(port);
9957
9958 return result;
9959}
9960
9961#ifdef HAVE_SYS_SELECT_H
9962#include <sys/select.h>
9963#endif
9964
9965static VALUE
9966select_internal(VALUE read, VALUE write, VALUE except, struct timeval *tp, rb_fdset_t *fds)
9967{
9968 VALUE res, list;
9969 rb_fdset_t *rp, *wp, *ep;
9970 rb_io_t *fptr;
9971 long i;
9972 int max = 0, n;
9973 int pending = 0;
9974 struct timeval timerec;
9975
9976 if (!NIL_P(read)) {
9977 Check_Type(read, T_ARRAY);
9978 for (i=0; i<RARRAY_LEN(read); i++) {
9979 GetOpenFile(rb_io_get_io(RARRAY_AREF(read, i)), fptr);
9980 rb_fd_set(fptr->fd, &fds[0]);
9981 if (READ_DATA_PENDING(fptr) || READ_CHAR_PENDING(fptr)) { /* check for buffered data */
9982 pending++;
9983 rb_fd_set(fptr->fd, &fds[3]);
9984 }
9985 if (max < fptr->fd) max = fptr->fd;
9986 }
9987 if (pending) { /* no blocking if there's buffered data */
9988 timerec.tv_sec = timerec.tv_usec = 0;
9989 tp = &timerec;
9990 }
9991 rp = &fds[0];
9992 }
9993 else
9994 rp = 0;
9995
9996 if (!NIL_P(write)) {
9997 Check_Type(write, T_ARRAY);
9998 for (i=0; i<RARRAY_LEN(write); i++) {
9999 VALUE write_io = GetWriteIO(rb_io_get_io(RARRAY_AREF(write, i)));
10000 GetOpenFile(write_io, fptr);
10001 rb_fd_set(fptr->fd, &fds[1]);
10002 if (max < fptr->fd) max = fptr->fd;
10003 }
10004 wp = &fds[1];
10005 }
10006 else
10007 wp = 0;
10008
10009 if (!NIL_P(except)) {
10010 Check_Type(except, T_ARRAY);
10011 for (i=0; i<RARRAY_LEN(except); i++) {
10012 VALUE io = rb_io_get_io(RARRAY_AREF(except, i));
10013 VALUE write_io = GetWriteIO(io);
10014 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
10015 rb_fd_set(fptr->fd, &fds[2]);
10016 if (max < fptr->fd) max = fptr->fd;
10017 if (io != write_io) {
10018 GetOpenFile(write_io, fptr);
10019 rb_fd_set(fptr->fd, &fds[2]);
10020 if (max < fptr->fd) max = fptr->fd;
10021 }
10022 }
10023 ep = &fds[2];
10024 }
10025 else {
10026 ep = 0;
10027 }
10028
10029 max++;
10030
10031 n = rb_thread_fd_select(max, rp, wp, ep, tp);
10032 if (n < 0) {
10033 rb_sys_fail(0);
10034 }
10035 if (!pending && n == 0) return Qnil; /* returns nil on timeout */
10036
10037 res = rb_ary_new2(3);
10038 rb_ary_push(res, rp?rb_ary_new():rb_ary_new2(0));
10039 rb_ary_push(res, wp?rb_ary_new():rb_ary_new2(0));
10040 rb_ary_push(res, ep?rb_ary_new():rb_ary_new2(0));
10041
10042 if (rp) {
10043 list = RARRAY_AREF(res, 0);
10044 for (i=0; i< RARRAY_LEN(read); i++) {
10045 VALUE obj = rb_ary_entry(read, i);
10046 VALUE io = rb_io_get_io(obj);
10047 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
10048 if (rb_fd_isset(fptr->fd, &fds[0]) ||
10049 rb_fd_isset(fptr->fd, &fds[3])) {
10050 rb_ary_push(list, obj);
10051 }
10052 }
10053 }
10054
10055 if (wp) {
10056 list = RARRAY_AREF(res, 1);
10057 for (i=0; i< RARRAY_LEN(write); i++) {
10058 VALUE obj = rb_ary_entry(write, i);
10059 VALUE io = rb_io_get_io(obj);
10060 VALUE write_io = GetWriteIO(io);
10061 GetOpenFile(write_io, fptr);
10062 if (rb_fd_isset(fptr->fd, &fds[1])) {
10063 rb_ary_push(list, obj);
10064 }
10065 }
10066 }
10067
10068 if (ep) {
10069 list = RARRAY_AREF(res, 2);
10070 for (i=0; i< RARRAY_LEN(except); i++) {
10071 VALUE obj = rb_ary_entry(except, i);
10072 VALUE io = rb_io_get_io(obj);
10073 VALUE write_io = GetWriteIO(io);
10074 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
10075 if (rb_fd_isset(fptr->fd, &fds[2])) {
10076 rb_ary_push(list, obj);
10077 }
10078 else if (io != write_io) {
10079 GetOpenFile(write_io, fptr);
10080 if (rb_fd_isset(fptr->fd, &fds[2])) {
10081 rb_ary_push(list, obj);
10082 }
10083 }
10084 }
10085 }
10086
10087 return res; /* returns an empty array on interrupt */
10088}
10089
10090struct select_args {
10091 VALUE read, write, except;
10092 struct timeval *timeout;
10093 rb_fdset_t fdsets[4];
10094};
10095
10096static VALUE
10097select_call(VALUE arg)
10098{
10099 struct select_args *p = (struct select_args *)arg;
10100
10101 return select_internal(p->read, p->write, p->except, p->timeout, p->fdsets);
10102}
10103
10104static VALUE
10105select_end(VALUE arg)
10106{
10107 struct select_args *p = (struct select_args *)arg;
10108 int i;
10109
10110 for (i = 0; i < numberof(p->fdsets); ++i)
10111 rb_fd_term(&p->fdsets[i]);
10112 return Qnil;
10113}
10114
10115static VALUE sym_normal, sym_sequential, sym_random,
10116 sym_willneed, sym_dontneed, sym_noreuse;
10117
10118#ifdef HAVE_POSIX_FADVISE
10119struct io_advise_struct {
10120 int fd;
10121 int advice;
10122 off_t offset;
10123 off_t len;
10124};
10125
10126static VALUE
10127io_advise_internal(void *arg)
10128{
10129 struct io_advise_struct *ptr = arg;
10130 return posix_fadvise(ptr->fd, ptr->offset, ptr->len, ptr->advice);
10131}
10132
10133static VALUE
10134io_advise_sym_to_const(VALUE sym)
10135{
10136#ifdef POSIX_FADV_NORMAL
10137 if (sym == sym_normal)
10138 return INT2NUM(POSIX_FADV_NORMAL);
10139#endif
10140
10141#ifdef POSIX_FADV_RANDOM
10142 if (sym == sym_random)
10143 return INT2NUM(POSIX_FADV_RANDOM);
10144#endif
10145
10146#ifdef POSIX_FADV_SEQUENTIAL
10147 if (sym == sym_sequential)
10148 return INT2NUM(POSIX_FADV_SEQUENTIAL);
10149#endif
10150
10151#ifdef POSIX_FADV_WILLNEED
10152 if (sym == sym_willneed)
10153 return INT2NUM(POSIX_FADV_WILLNEED);
10154#endif
10155
10156#ifdef POSIX_FADV_DONTNEED
10157 if (sym == sym_dontneed)
10158 return INT2NUM(POSIX_FADV_DONTNEED);
10159#endif
10160
10161#ifdef POSIX_FADV_NOREUSE
10162 if (sym == sym_noreuse)
10163 return INT2NUM(POSIX_FADV_NOREUSE);
10164#endif
10165
10166 return Qnil;
10167}
10168
10169static VALUE
10170do_io_advise(rb_io_t *fptr, VALUE advice, off_t offset, off_t len)
10171{
10172 int rv;
10173 struct io_advise_struct ias;
10174 VALUE num_adv;
10175
10176 num_adv = io_advise_sym_to_const(advice);
10177
10178 /*
10179 * The platform doesn't support this hint. We don't raise exception, instead
10180 * silently ignore it. Because IO::advise is only hint.
10181 */
10182 if (NIL_P(num_adv))
10183 return Qnil;
10184
10185 ias.fd = fptr->fd;
10186 ias.advice = NUM2INT(num_adv);
10187 ias.offset = offset;
10188 ias.len = len;
10189
10190 rv = (int)rb_thread_io_blocking_region(io_advise_internal, &ias, fptr->fd);
10191 if (rv && rv != ENOSYS) {
10192 /* posix_fadvise(2) doesn't set errno. On success it returns 0; otherwise
10193 it returns the error code. */
10194 VALUE message = rb_sprintf("%"PRIsVALUE" "
10195 "(%"PRI_OFFT_PREFIX"d, "
10196 "%"PRI_OFFT_PREFIX"d, "
10197 "%"PRIsVALUE")",
10198 fptr->pathv, offset, len, advice);
10199 rb_syserr_fail_str(rv, message);
10200 }
10201
10202 return Qnil;
10203}
10204
10205#endif /* HAVE_POSIX_FADVISE */
10206
10207static void
10208advice_arg_check(VALUE advice)
10209{
10210 if (!SYMBOL_P(advice))
10211 rb_raise(rb_eTypeError, "advice must be a Symbol");
10212
10213 if (advice != sym_normal &&
10214 advice != sym_sequential &&
10215 advice != sym_random &&
10216 advice != sym_willneed &&
10217 advice != sym_dontneed &&
10218 advice != sym_noreuse) {
10219 rb_raise(rb_eNotImpError, "Unsupported advice: %+"PRIsVALUE, advice);
10220 }
10221}
10222
10223/*
10224 * call-seq:
10225 * advise(advice, offset = 0, len = 0) -> nil
10226 *
10227 * Invokes Posix system call
10228 * {posix_fadvise(2)}[https://linux.die.net/man/2/posix_fadvise],
10229 * which announces an intention to access data from the current file
10230 * in a particular manner.
10231 *
10232 * The arguments and results are platform-dependent.
10233 *
10234 * The relevant data is specified by:
10235 *
10236 * - +offset+: The offset of the first byte of data.
10237 * - +len+: The number of bytes to be accessed;
10238 * if +len+ is zero, or is larger than the number of bytes remaining,
10239 * all remaining bytes will be accessed.
10240 *
10241 * Argument +advice+ is one of the following symbols:
10242 *
10243 * - +:normal+: The application has no advice to give
10244 * about its access pattern for the specified data.
10245 * If no advice is given for an open file, this is the default assumption.
10246 * - +:sequential+: The application expects to access the specified data sequentially
10247 * (with lower offsets read before higher ones).
10248 * - +:random+: The specified data will be accessed in random order.
10249 * - +:noreuse+: The specified data will be accessed only once.
10250 * - +:willneed+: The specified data will be accessed in the near future.
10251 * - +:dontneed+: The specified data will not be accessed in the near future.
10252 *
10253 * Not implemented on all platforms.
10254 *
10255 */
10256static VALUE
10257rb_io_advise(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
10258{
10259 VALUE advice, offset, len;
10260 off_t off, l;
10261 rb_io_t *fptr;
10262
10263 rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "12", &advice, &offset, &len);
10264 advice_arg_check(advice);
10265
10266 io = GetWriteIO(io);
10267 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
10268
10269 off = NIL_P(offset) ? 0 : NUM2OFFT(offset);
10270 l = NIL_P(len) ? 0 : NUM2OFFT(len);
10271
10272#ifdef HAVE_POSIX_FADVISE
10273 return do_io_advise(fptr, advice, off, l);
10274#else
10275 ((void)off, (void)l); /* Ignore all hint */
10276 return Qnil;
10277#endif
10278}
10279
10280/*
10281 * call-seq:
10282 * IO.select(read_ios, write_ios = [], error_ios = [], timeout = nil) -> array or nil
10283 *
10284 * Invokes system call {select(2)}[https://linux.die.net/man/2/select],
10285 * which monitors multiple file descriptors,
10286 * waiting until one or more of the file descriptors
10287 * becomes ready for some class of I/O operation.
10288 *
10289 * Not implemented on all platforms.
10290 *
10291 * Each of the arguments +read_ios+, +write_ios+, and +error_ios+
10292 * is an array of IO objects.
10293 *
10294 * Argument +timeout+ is an integer timeout interval in seconds.
10295 *
10296 * The method monitors the \IO objects given in all three arrays,
10297 * waiting for some to be ready;
10298 * returns a 3-element array whose elements are:
10299 *
10300 * - An array of the objects in +read_ios+ that are ready for reading.
10301 * - An array of the objects in +write_ios+ that are ready for writing.
10302 * - An array of the objects in +error_ios+ have pending exceptions.
10303 *
10304 * If no object becomes ready within the given +timeout+, +nil+ is returned.
10305 *
10306 * \IO.select peeks the buffer of \IO objects for testing readability.
10307 * If the \IO buffer is not empty, \IO.select immediately notifies
10308 * readability. This "peek" only happens for \IO objects. It does not
10309 * happen for IO-like objects such as OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket.
10310 *
10311 * The best way to use \IO.select is invoking it after non-blocking
10312 * methods such as #read_nonblock, #write_nonblock, etc. The methods
10313 * raise an exception which is extended by IO::WaitReadable or
10314 * IO::WaitWritable. The modules notify how the caller should wait
10315 * with \IO.select. If IO::WaitReadable is raised, the caller should
10316 * wait for reading. If IO::WaitWritable is raised, the caller should
10317 * wait for writing.
10318 *
10319 * So, blocking read (#readpartial) can be emulated using
10320 * #read_nonblock and \IO.select as follows:
10321 *
10322 * begin
10323 * result = io_like.read_nonblock(maxlen)
10324 * rescue IO::WaitReadable
10325 * IO.select([io_like])
10326 * retry
10327 * rescue IO::WaitWritable
10328 * IO.select(nil, [io_like])
10329 * retry
10330 * end
10331 *
10332 * Especially, the combination of non-blocking methods and \IO.select is
10333 * preferred for IO like objects such as OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket. It
10334 * has #to_io method to return underlying IO object. IO.select calls
10335 * #to_io to obtain the file descriptor to wait.
10336 *
10337 * This means that readability notified by \IO.select doesn't mean
10338 * readability from OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket object.
10339 *
10340 * The most likely situation is that OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket buffers
10341 * some data. \IO.select doesn't see the buffer. So \IO.select can
10342 * block when OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket#readpartial doesn't block.
10343 *
10344 * However, several more complicated situations exist.
10345 *
10346 * SSL is a protocol which is sequence of records.
10347 * The record consists of multiple bytes.
10348 * So, the remote side of SSL sends a partial record, IO.select
10349 * notifies readability but OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket cannot decrypt a
10350 * byte and OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket#readpartial will block.
10351 *
10352 * Also, the remote side can request SSL renegotiation which forces
10353 * the local SSL engine to write some data.
10354 * This means OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket#readpartial may invoke #write
10355 * system call and it can block.
10356 * In such a situation, OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket#read_nonblock raises
10357 * IO::WaitWritable instead of blocking.
10358 * So, the caller should wait for ready for writability as above
10359 * example.
10360 *
10361 * The combination of non-blocking methods and \IO.select is also useful
10362 * for streams such as tty, pipe socket socket when multiple processes
10363 * read from a stream.
10364 *
10365 * Finally, Linux kernel developers don't guarantee that
10366 * readability of select(2) means readability of following read(2) even
10367 * for a single process;
10368 * see {select(2)}[https://linux.die.net/man/2/select]
10369 *
10370 * Invoking \IO.select before IO#readpartial works well as usual.
10371 * However it is not the best way to use \IO.select.
10372 *
10373 * The writability notified by select(2) doesn't show
10374 * how many bytes are writable.
10375 * IO#write method blocks until given whole string is written.
10376 * So, <tt>IO#write(two or more bytes)</tt> can block after
10377 * writability is notified by \IO.select. IO#write_nonblock is required
10378 * to avoid the blocking.
10379 *
10380 * Blocking write (#write) can be emulated using #write_nonblock and
10381 * IO.select as follows: IO::WaitReadable should also be rescued for
10382 * SSL renegotiation in OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket.
10383 *
10384 * while 0 < string.bytesize
10385 * begin
10386 * written = io_like.write_nonblock(string)
10387 * rescue IO::WaitReadable
10388 * IO.select([io_like])
10389 * retry
10390 * rescue IO::WaitWritable
10391 * IO.select(nil, [io_like])
10392 * retry
10393 * end
10394 * string = string.byteslice(written..-1)
10395 * end
10396 *
10397 * Example:
10398 *
10399 * rp, wp = IO.pipe
10400 * mesg = "ping "
10401 * 100.times {
10402 * # IO.select follows IO#read. Not the best way to use IO.select.
10403 * rs, ws, = IO.select([rp], [wp])
10404 * if r = rs[0]
10405 * ret = r.read(5)
10406 * print ret
10407 * case ret
10408 * when /ping/
10409 * mesg = "pong\n"
10410 * when /pong/
10411 * mesg = "ping "
10412 * end
10413 * end
10414 * if w = ws[0]
10415 * w.write(mesg)
10416 * end
10417 * }
10418 *
10419 * Output:
10420 *
10421 * ping pong
10422 * ping pong
10423 * ping pong
10424 * (snipped)
10425 * ping
10426 *
10427 */
10428
10429static VALUE
10430rb_f_select(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE obj)
10431{
10432 VALUE timeout;
10433 struct select_args args;
10434 struct timeval timerec;
10435 int i;
10436
10437 rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "13", &args.read, &args.write, &args.except, &timeout);
10438 if (NIL_P(timeout)) {
10439 args.timeout = 0;
10440 }
10441 else {
10442 timerec = rb_time_interval(timeout);
10443 args.timeout = &timerec;
10444 }
10445
10446 for (i = 0; i < numberof(args.fdsets); ++i)
10447 rb_fd_init(&args.fdsets[i]);
10448
10449 return rb_ensure(select_call, (VALUE)&args, select_end, (VALUE)&args);
10450}
10451
10452#ifdef IOCTL_REQ_TYPE
10453 typedef IOCTL_REQ_TYPE ioctl_req_t;
10454#else
10455 typedef int ioctl_req_t;
10456# define NUM2IOCTLREQ(num) ((int)NUM2LONG(num))
10457#endif
10458
10459#ifdef HAVE_IOCTL
10460struct ioctl_arg {
10461 int fd;
10462 ioctl_req_t cmd;
10463 long narg;
10464};
10465
10466static VALUE
10467nogvl_ioctl(void *ptr)
10468{
10469 struct ioctl_arg *arg = ptr;
10470
10471 return (VALUE)ioctl(arg->fd, arg->cmd, arg->narg);
10472}
10473
10474static int
10475do_ioctl(int fd, ioctl_req_t cmd, long narg)
10476{
10477 int retval;
10478 struct ioctl_arg arg;
10479
10480 arg.fd = fd;
10481 arg.cmd = cmd;
10482 arg.narg = narg;
10483
10484 retval = (int)rb_thread_io_blocking_region(nogvl_ioctl, &arg, fd);
10485
10486 return retval;
10487}
10488#endif
10489
10490#define DEFAULT_IOCTL_NARG_LEN (256)
10491
10492#if defined(__linux__) && defined(_IOC_SIZE)
10493static long
10494linux_iocparm_len(ioctl_req_t cmd)
10495{
10496 long len;
10497
10498 if ((cmd & 0xFFFF0000) == 0) {
10499 /* legacy and unstructured ioctl number. */
10500 return DEFAULT_IOCTL_NARG_LEN;
10501 }
10502
10503 len = _IOC_SIZE(cmd);
10504
10505 /* paranoia check for silly drivers which don't keep ioctl convention */
10506 if (len < DEFAULT_IOCTL_NARG_LEN)
10507 len = DEFAULT_IOCTL_NARG_LEN;
10508
10509 return len;
10510}
10511#endif
10512
10513#ifdef HAVE_IOCTL
10514static long
10515ioctl_narg_len(ioctl_req_t cmd)
10516{
10517 long len;
10518
10519#ifdef IOCPARM_MASK
10520#ifndef IOCPARM_LEN
10521#define IOCPARM_LEN(x) (((x) >> 16) & IOCPARM_MASK)
10522#endif
10523#endif
10524#ifdef IOCPARM_LEN
10525 len = IOCPARM_LEN(cmd); /* on BSDish systems we're safe */
10526#elif defined(__linux__) && defined(_IOC_SIZE)
10527 len = linux_iocparm_len(cmd);
10528#else
10529 /* otherwise guess at what's safe */
10530 len = DEFAULT_IOCTL_NARG_LEN;
10531#endif
10532
10533 return len;
10534}
10535#endif
10536
10537#ifdef HAVE_FCNTL
10538#ifdef __linux__
10539typedef long fcntl_arg_t;
10540#else
10541/* posix */
10542typedef int fcntl_arg_t;
10543#endif
10544
10545static long
10546fcntl_narg_len(ioctl_req_t cmd)
10547{
10548 long len;
10549
10550 switch (cmd) {
10551#ifdef F_DUPFD
10552 case F_DUPFD:
10553 len = sizeof(fcntl_arg_t);
10554 break;
10555#endif
10556#ifdef F_DUP2FD /* bsd specific */
10557 case F_DUP2FD:
10558 len = sizeof(int);
10559 break;
10560#endif
10561#ifdef F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC /* linux specific */
10562 case F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC:
10563 len = sizeof(fcntl_arg_t);
10564 break;
10565#endif
10566#ifdef F_GETFD
10567 case F_GETFD:
10568 len = 1;
10569 break;
10570#endif
10571#ifdef F_SETFD
10572 case F_SETFD:
10573 len = sizeof(fcntl_arg_t);
10574 break;
10575#endif
10576#ifdef F_GETFL
10577 case F_GETFL:
10578 len = 1;
10579 break;
10580#endif
10581#ifdef F_SETFL
10582 case F_SETFL:
10583 len = sizeof(fcntl_arg_t);
10584 break;
10585#endif
10586#ifdef F_GETOWN
10587 case F_GETOWN:
10588 len = 1;
10589 break;
10590#endif
10591#ifdef F_SETOWN
10592 case F_SETOWN:
10593 len = sizeof(fcntl_arg_t);
10594 break;
10595#endif
10596#ifdef F_GETOWN_EX /* linux specific */
10597 case F_GETOWN_EX:
10598 len = sizeof(struct f_owner_ex);
10599 break;
10600#endif
10601#ifdef F_SETOWN_EX /* linux specific */
10602 case F_SETOWN_EX:
10603 len = sizeof(struct f_owner_ex);
10604 break;
10605#endif
10606#ifdef F_GETLK
10607 case F_GETLK:
10608 len = sizeof(struct flock);
10609 break;
10610#endif
10611#ifdef F_SETLK
10612 case F_SETLK:
10613 len = sizeof(struct flock);
10614 break;
10615#endif
10616#ifdef F_SETLKW
10617 case F_SETLKW:
10618 len = sizeof(struct flock);
10619 break;
10620#endif
10621#ifdef F_READAHEAD /* bsd specific */
10622 case F_READAHEAD:
10623 len = sizeof(int);
10624 break;
10625#endif
10626#ifdef F_RDAHEAD /* Darwin specific */
10627 case F_RDAHEAD:
10628 len = sizeof(int);
10629 break;
10630#endif
10631#ifdef F_GETSIG /* linux specific */
10632 case F_GETSIG:
10633 len = 1;
10634 break;
10635#endif
10636#ifdef F_SETSIG /* linux specific */
10637 case F_SETSIG:
10638 len = sizeof(fcntl_arg_t);
10639 break;
10640#endif
10641#ifdef F_GETLEASE /* linux specific */
10642 case F_GETLEASE:
10643 len = 1;
10644 break;
10645#endif
10646#ifdef F_SETLEASE /* linux specific */
10647 case F_SETLEASE:
10648 len = sizeof(fcntl_arg_t);
10649 break;
10650#endif
10651#ifdef F_NOTIFY /* linux specific */
10652 case F_NOTIFY:
10653 len = sizeof(fcntl_arg_t);
10654 break;
10655#endif
10656
10657 default:
10658 len = 256;
10659 break;
10660 }
10661
10662 return len;
10663}
10664#else /* HAVE_FCNTL */
10665static long
10666fcntl_narg_len(ioctl_req_t cmd)
10667{
10668 return 0;
10669}
10670#endif /* HAVE_FCNTL */
10671
10672#define NARG_SENTINEL 17
10673
10674static long
10675setup_narg(ioctl_req_t cmd, VALUE *argp, long (*narg_len)(ioctl_req_t))
10676{
10677 long narg = 0;
10678 VALUE arg = *argp;
10679
10680 if (!RTEST(arg)) {
10681 narg = 0;
10682 }
10683 else if (FIXNUM_P(arg)) {
10684 narg = FIX2LONG(arg);
10685 }
10686 else if (arg == Qtrue) {
10687 narg = 1;
10688 }
10689 else {
10690 VALUE tmp = rb_check_string_type(arg);
10691
10692 if (NIL_P(tmp)) {
10693 narg = NUM2LONG(arg);
10694 }
10695 else {
10696 char *ptr;
10697 long len, slen;
10698
10699 *argp = arg = tmp;
10700 len = narg_len(cmd);
10701 rb_str_modify(arg);
10702
10703 slen = RSTRING_LEN(arg);
10704 /* expand for data + sentinel. */
10705 if (slen < len+1) {
10706 rb_str_resize(arg, len+1);
10707 MEMZERO(RSTRING_PTR(arg)+slen, char, len-slen);
10708 slen = len+1;
10709 }
10710 /* a little sanity check here */
10711 ptr = RSTRING_PTR(arg);
10712 ptr[slen - 1] = NARG_SENTINEL;
10713 narg = (long)(SIGNED_VALUE)ptr;
10714 }
10715 }
10716
10717 return narg;
10718}
10719
10720static VALUE
10721finish_narg(int retval, VALUE arg, const rb_io_t *fptr)
10722{
10723 if (retval < 0) rb_sys_fail_path(fptr->pathv);
10724 if (RB_TYPE_P(arg, T_STRING)) {
10725 char *ptr;
10726 long slen;
10727 RSTRING_GETMEM(arg, ptr, slen);
10728 if (ptr[slen-1] != NARG_SENTINEL)
10729 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "return value overflowed string");
10730 ptr[slen-1] = '\0';
10731 }
10732
10733 return INT2NUM(retval);
10734}
10735
10736#ifdef HAVE_IOCTL
10737static VALUE
10738rb_ioctl(VALUE io, VALUE req, VALUE arg)
10739{
10740 ioctl_req_t cmd = NUM2IOCTLREQ(req);
10741 rb_io_t *fptr;
10742 long narg;
10743 int retval;
10744
10745 narg = setup_narg(cmd, &arg, ioctl_narg_len);
10746 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
10747 retval = do_ioctl(fptr->fd, cmd, narg);
10748 return finish_narg(retval, arg, fptr);
10749}
10750
10751/*
10752 * call-seq:
10753 * ioctl(integer_cmd, argument) -> integer
10754 *
10755 * Invokes Posix system call {ioctl(2)}[https://linux.die.net/man/2/ioctl],
10756 * which issues a low-level command to an I/O device.
10757 *
10758 * Issues a low-level command to an I/O device.
10759 * The arguments and returned value are platform-dependent.
10760 * The effect of the call is platform-dependent.
10761 *
10762 * If argument +argument+ is an integer, it is passed directly;
10763 * if it is a string, it is interpreted as a binary sequence of bytes.
10764 *
10765 * Not implemented on all platforms.
10766 *
10767 */
10768
10769static VALUE
10770rb_io_ioctl(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
10771{
10772 VALUE req, arg;
10773
10774 rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "11", &req, &arg);
10775 return rb_ioctl(io, req, arg);
10776}
10777#else
10778#define rb_io_ioctl rb_f_notimplement
10779#endif
10780
10781#ifdef HAVE_FCNTL
10782struct fcntl_arg {
10783 int fd;
10784 int cmd;
10785 long narg;
10786};
10787
10788static VALUE
10789nogvl_fcntl(void *ptr)
10790{
10791 struct fcntl_arg *arg = ptr;
10792
10793#if defined(F_DUPFD)
10794 if (arg->cmd == F_DUPFD)
10795 return (VALUE)rb_cloexec_fcntl_dupfd(arg->fd, (int)arg->narg);
10796#endif
10797 return (VALUE)fcntl(arg->fd, arg->cmd, arg->narg);
10798}
10799
10800static int
10801do_fcntl(int fd, int cmd, long narg)
10802{
10803 int retval;
10804 struct fcntl_arg arg;
10805
10806 arg.fd = fd;
10807 arg.cmd = cmd;
10808 arg.narg = narg;
10809
10810 retval = (int)rb_thread_io_blocking_region(nogvl_fcntl, &arg, fd);
10811 if (retval != -1) {
10812 switch (cmd) {
10813#if defined(F_DUPFD)
10814 case F_DUPFD:
10815#endif
10816#if defined(F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC)
10817 case F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC:
10818#endif
10819 rb_update_max_fd(retval);
10820 }
10821 }
10822
10823 return retval;
10824}
10825
10826static VALUE
10827rb_fcntl(VALUE io, VALUE req, VALUE arg)
10828{
10829 int cmd = NUM2INT(req);
10830 rb_io_t *fptr;
10831 long narg;
10832 int retval;
10833
10834 narg = setup_narg(cmd, &arg, fcntl_narg_len);
10835 GetOpenFile(io, fptr);
10836 retval = do_fcntl(fptr->fd, cmd, narg);
10837 return finish_narg(retval, arg, fptr);
10838}
10839
10840/*
10841 * call-seq:
10842 * fcntl(integer_cmd, argument) -> integer
10843 *
10844 * Invokes Posix system call {fcntl(2)}[https://linux.die.net/man/2/fcntl],
10845 * which provides a mechanism for issuing low-level commands to control or query
10846 * a file-oriented I/O stream. Arguments and results are platform
10847 * dependent.
10848 *
10849 * If +argument is a number, its value is passed directly;
10850 * if it is a string, it is interpreted as a binary sequence of bytes.
10851 * (Array#pack might be a useful way to build this string.)
10852 *
10853 * Not implemented on all platforms.
10854 *
10855 */
10856
10857static VALUE
10858rb_io_fcntl(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
10859{
10860 VALUE req, arg;
10861
10862 rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "11", &req, &arg);
10863 return rb_fcntl(io, req, arg);
10864}
10865#else
10866#define rb_io_fcntl rb_f_notimplement
10867#endif
10868
10869#if defined(HAVE_SYSCALL) || defined(HAVE___SYSCALL)
10870/*
10871 * call-seq:
10872 * syscall(integer_callno, *arguments) -> integer
10873 *
10874 * Invokes Posix system call {syscall(2)}[https://linux.die.net/man/2/syscall],
10875 * which calls a specified function.
10876 *
10877 * Calls the operating system function identified by +integer_callno+;
10878 * returns the result of the function or raises SystemCallError if it failed.
10879 * The effect of the call is platform-dependent.
10880 * The arguments and returned value are platform-dependent.
10881 *
10882 * For each of +arguments+: if it is an integer, it is passed directly;
10883 * if it is a string, it is interpreted as a binary sequence of bytes.
10884 * There may be as many as nine such arguments.
10885 *
10886 * Arguments +integer_callno+ and +argument+, as well as the returned value,
10887 * are platform-dependent.
10888 *
10889 * Note: Method +syscall+ is essentially unsafe and unportable.
10890 * The DL (Fiddle) library is preferred for safer and a bit
10891 * more portable programming.
10892 *
10893 * Not implemented on all platforms.
10894 *
10895 */
10896
10897static VALUE
10898rb_f_syscall(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE _)
10899{
10900 VALUE arg[8];
10901#if SIZEOF_VOIDP == 8 && defined(HAVE___SYSCALL) && SIZEOF_INT != 8 /* mainly *BSD */
10902# define SYSCALL __syscall
10903# define NUM2SYSCALLID(x) NUM2LONG(x)
10904# define RETVAL2NUM(x) LONG2NUM(x)
10905# if SIZEOF_LONG == 8
10906 long num, retval = -1;
10907# elif SIZEOF_LONG_LONG == 8
10908 long long num, retval = -1;
10909# else
10910# error ---->> it is asserted that __syscall takes the first argument and returns retval in 64bit signed integer. <<----
10911# endif
10912#elif defined(__linux__)
10913# define SYSCALL syscall
10914# define NUM2SYSCALLID(x) NUM2LONG(x)
10915# define RETVAL2NUM(x) LONG2NUM(x)
10916 /*
10917 * Linux man page says, syscall(2) function prototype is below.
10918 *
10919 * int syscall(int number, ...);
10920 *
10921 * But, it's incorrect. Actual one takes and returned long. (see unistd.h)
10922 */
10923 long num, retval = -1;
10924#else
10925# define SYSCALL syscall
10926# define NUM2SYSCALLID(x) NUM2INT(x)
10927# define RETVAL2NUM(x) INT2NUM(x)
10928 int num, retval = -1;
10929#endif
10930 int i;
10931
10932 if (RTEST(ruby_verbose)) {
10933 rb_category_warning(RB_WARN_CATEGORY_DEPRECATED,
10934 "We plan to remove a syscall function at future release. DL(Fiddle) provides safer alternative.");
10935 }
10936
10937 if (argc == 0)
10938 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "too few arguments for syscall");
10939 if (argc > numberof(arg))
10940 rb_raise(rb_eArgError, "too many arguments for syscall");
10941 num = NUM2SYSCALLID(argv[0]); ++argv;
10942 for (i = argc - 1; i--; ) {
10943 VALUE v = rb_check_string_type(argv[i]);
10944
10945 if (!NIL_P(v)) {
10946 SafeStringValue(v);
10947 rb_str_modify(v);
10948 arg[i] = (VALUE)StringValueCStr(v);
10949 }
10950 else {
10951 arg[i] = (VALUE)NUM2LONG(argv[i]);
10952 }
10953 }
10954
10955 switch (argc) {
10956 case 1:
10957 retval = SYSCALL(num);
10958 break;
10959 case 2:
10960 retval = SYSCALL(num, arg[0]);
10961 break;
10962 case 3:
10963 retval = SYSCALL(num, arg[0],arg[1]);
10964 break;
10965 case 4:
10966 retval = SYSCALL(num, arg[0],arg[1],arg[2]);
10967 break;
10968 case 5:
10969 retval = SYSCALL(num, arg[0],arg[1],arg[2],arg[3]);
10970 break;
10971 case 6:
10972 retval = SYSCALL(num, arg[0],arg[1],arg[2],arg[3],arg[4]);
10973 break;
10974 case 7:
10975 retval = SYSCALL(num, arg[0],arg[1],arg[2],arg[3],arg[4],arg[5]);
10976 break;
10977 case 8:
10978 retval = SYSCALL(num, arg[0],arg[1],arg[2],arg[3],arg[4],arg[5],arg[6]);
10979 break;
10980 }
10981
10982 if (retval == -1)
10983 rb_sys_fail(0);
10984 return RETVAL2NUM(retval);
10985#undef SYSCALL
10986#undef NUM2SYSCALLID
10987#undef RETVAL2NUM
10988}
10989#else
10990#define rb_f_syscall rb_f_notimplement
10991#endif
10992
10993static VALUE
10994io_new_instance(VALUE args)
10995{
10996 return rb_class_new_instance(2, (VALUE*)args+1, *(VALUE*)args);
10997}
10998
10999static rb_encoding *
11000find_encoding(VALUE v)
11001{
11002 rb_encoding *enc = rb_find_encoding(v);
11003 if (!enc) rb_warn("Unsupported encoding %"PRIsVALUE" ignored", v);
11004 return enc;
11005}
11006
11007static void
11008io_encoding_set(rb_io_t *fptr, VALUE v1, VALUE v2, VALUE opt)
11009{
11010 rb_encoding *enc, *enc2;
11011 int ecflags = fptr->encs.ecflags;
11012 VALUE ecopts, tmp;
11013
11014 if (!NIL_P(v2)) {
11015 enc2 = find_encoding(v1);
11016 tmp = rb_check_string_type(v2);
11017 if (!NIL_P(tmp)) {
11018 if (RSTRING_LEN(tmp) == 1 && RSTRING_PTR(tmp)[0] == '-') {
11019 /* Special case - "-" => no transcoding */
11020 enc = enc2;
11021 enc2 = NULL;
11022 }
11023 else
11024 enc = find_encoding(v2);
11025 if (enc == enc2) {
11026 /* Special case - "-" => no transcoding */
11027 enc2 = NULL;
11028 }
11029 }
11030 else {
11031 enc = find_encoding(v2);
11032 if (enc == enc2) {
11033 /* Special case - "-" => no transcoding */
11034 enc2 = NULL;
11035 }
11036 }
11037 SET_UNIVERSAL_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_IF_ENC2(enc2, ecflags);
11038 ecflags = rb_econv_prepare_options(opt, &ecopts, ecflags);
11039 }
11040 else {
11041 if (NIL_P(v1)) {
11042 /* Set to default encodings */
11043 rb_io_ext_int_to_encs(NULL, NULL, &enc, &enc2, 0);
11044 SET_UNIVERSAL_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_IF_ENC2(enc2, ecflags);
11045 ecopts = Qnil;
11046 }
11047 else {
11048 tmp = rb_check_string_type(v1);
11049 if (!NIL_P(tmp) && rb_enc_asciicompat(enc = rb_enc_get(tmp))) {
11050 parse_mode_enc(RSTRING_PTR(tmp), enc, &enc, &enc2, NULL);
11051 SET_UNIVERSAL_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_IF_ENC2(enc2, ecflags);
11052 ecflags = rb_econv_prepare_options(opt, &ecopts, ecflags);
11053 }
11054 else {
11055 rb_io_ext_int_to_encs(find_encoding(v1), NULL, &enc, &enc2, 0);
11056 SET_UNIVERSAL_NEWLINE_DECORATOR_IF_ENC2(enc2, ecflags);
11057 ecopts = Qnil;
11058 }
11059 }
11060 }
11061 validate_enc_binmode(&fptr->mode, ecflags, enc, enc2);
11062 fptr->encs.enc = enc;
11063 fptr->encs.enc2 = enc2;
11064 fptr->encs.ecflags = ecflags;
11065 fptr->encs.ecopts = ecopts;
11066 clear_codeconv(fptr);
11067
11068}
11069
11070struct io_encoding_set_args {
11071 rb_io_t *fptr;
11072 VALUE v1;
11073 VALUE v2;
11074 VALUE opt;
11075};
11076
11077static VALUE
11078io_encoding_set_v(VALUE v)
11079{
11080 struct io_encoding_set_args *arg = (struct io_encoding_set_args *)v;
11081 io_encoding_set(arg->fptr, arg->v1, arg->v2, arg->opt);
11082 return Qnil;
11083}
11084
11085static VALUE
11086pipe_pair_close(VALUE rw)
11087{
11088 VALUE *rwp = (VALUE *)rw;
11089 return rb_ensure(io_close, rwp[0], io_close, rwp[1]);
11090}
11091
11092/*
11093 * call-seq:
11094 * IO.pipe(**opts) -> [read_io, write_io]
11095 * IO.pipe(enc, **opts) -> [read_io, write_io]
11096 * IO.pipe(ext_enc, int_enc, **opts) -> [read_io, write_io]
11097 * IO.pipe(**opts) {|read_io, write_io] ...} -> object
11098 * IO.pipe(enc, **opts) {|read_io, write_io] ...} -> object
11099 * IO.pipe(ext_enc, int_enc, **opts) {|read_io, write_io] ...} -> object
11100 *
11101 * Creates a pair of pipe endpoints, +read_io+ and +write_io+,
11102 * connected to each other.
11103 *
11104 * If argument +enc_string+ is given, it must be a string containing one of:
11105 *
11106 * - The name of the encoding to be used as the external encoding.
11107 * - The colon-separated names of two encodings to be used as the external
11108 * and internal encodings.
11109 *
11110 * If argument +int_enc+ is given, it must be an Encoding object
11111 * or encoding name string that specifies the internal encoding to be used;
11112 * if argument +ext_enc+ is also given, it must be an Encoding object
11113 * or encoding name string that specifies the external encoding to be used.
11114 *
11115 * The string read from +read_io+ is tagged with the external encoding;
11116 * if an internal encoding is also specified, the string is converted
11117 * to, and tagged with, that encoding.
11118 *
11119 * If any encoding is specified,
11120 * optional hash arguments specify the conversion option.
11121 *
11122 * Optional keyword arguments +opts+ specify:
11123 *
11124 * - {Open Options}[rdoc-ref:IO@Open+Options].
11125 * - {Encoding Options}[rdoc-ref:encodings.rdoc@Encoding+Options].
11126 *
11127 * With no block given, returns the two endpoints in an array:
11128 *
11129 * IO.pipe # => [#<IO:fd 4>, #<IO:fd 5>]
11130 *
11131 * With a block given, calls the block with the two endpoints;
11132 * closes both endpoints and returns the value of the block:
11133 *
11134 * IO.pipe {|read_io, write_io| p read_io; p write_io }
11135 *
11136 * Output:
11137 *
11138 * #<IO:fd 6>
11139 * #<IO:fd 7>
11140 *
11141 * Not available on all platforms.
11142 *
11143 * In the example below, the two processes close the ends of the pipe
11144 * that they are not using. This is not just a cosmetic nicety. The
11145 * read end of a pipe will not generate an end of file condition if
11146 * there are any writers with the pipe still open. In the case of the
11147 * parent process, the <tt>rd.read</tt> will never return if it
11148 * does not first issue a <tt>wr.close</tt>:
11149 *
11150 * rd, wr = IO.pipe
11151 *
11152 * if fork
11153 * wr.close
11154 * puts "Parent got: <#{rd.read}>"
11155 * rd.close
11156 * Process.wait
11157 * else
11158 * rd.close
11159 * puts 'Sending message to parent'
11160 * wr.write "Hi Dad"
11161 * wr.close
11162 * end
11163 *
11164 * <em>produces:</em>
11165 *
11166 * Sending message to parent
11167 * Parent got: <Hi Dad>
11168 *
11169 */
11170
11171static VALUE
11172rb_io_s_pipe(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE klass)
11173{
11174 int pipes[2], state;
11175 VALUE r, w, args[3], v1, v2;
11176 VALUE opt;
11177 rb_io_t *fptr, *fptr2;
11178 struct io_encoding_set_args ies_args;
11179 int fmode = 0;
11180 VALUE ret;
11181
11182 argc = rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "02:", &v1, &v2, &opt);
11183 if (rb_pipe(pipes) < 0)
11184 rb_sys_fail(0);
11185
11186 args[0] = klass;
11187 args[1] = INT2NUM(pipes[0]);
11188 args[2] = INT2FIX(O_RDONLY);
11189 r = rb_protect(io_new_instance, (VALUE)args, &state);
11190 if (state) {
11191 close(pipes[0]);
11192 close(pipes[1]);
11193 rb_jump_tag(state);
11194 }
11195 GetOpenFile(r, fptr);
11196
11197 ies_args.fptr = fptr;
11198 ies_args.v1 = v1;
11199 ies_args.v2 = v2;
11200 ies_args.opt = opt;
11201 rb_protect(io_encoding_set_v, (VALUE)&ies_args, &state);
11202 if (state) {
11203 close(pipes[1]);
11204 io_close(r);
11205 rb_jump_tag(state);
11206 }
11207
11208 args[1] = INT2NUM(pipes[1]);
11209 args[2] = INT2FIX(O_WRONLY);
11210 w = rb_protect(io_new_instance, (VALUE)args, &state);
11211 if (state) {
11212 close(pipes[1]);
11213 if (!NIL_P(r)) rb_io_close(r);
11214 rb_jump_tag(state);
11215 }
11216 GetOpenFile(w, fptr2);
11217 rb_io_synchronized(fptr2);
11218
11219 extract_binmode(opt, &fmode);
11220
11221 if ((fmode & FMODE_BINMODE) && NIL_P(v1)) {
11222 rb_io_ascii8bit_binmode(r);
11223 rb_io_ascii8bit_binmode(w);
11224 }
11225
11226#if DEFAULT_TEXTMODE
11227 if ((fptr->mode & FMODE_TEXTMODE) && (fmode & FMODE_BINMODE)) {
11228 fptr->mode &= ~FMODE_TEXTMODE;
11229 setmode(fptr->fd, O_BINARY);
11230 }
11231#if RUBY_CRLF_ENVIRONMENT
11232 if (fptr->encs.ecflags & ECONV_DEFAULT_NEWLINE_DECORATOR) {
11233 fptr->encs.ecflags |= ECONV_UNIVERSAL_NEWLINE_DECORATOR;
11234 }
11235#endif
11236#endif
11237 fptr->mode |= fmode;
11238#if DEFAULT_TEXTMODE
11239 if ((fptr2->mode & FMODE_TEXTMODE) && (fmode & FMODE_BINMODE)) {
11240 fptr2->mode &= ~FMODE_TEXTMODE;
11241 setmode(fptr2->fd, O_BINARY);
11242 }
11243#endif
11244 fptr2->mode |= fmode;
11245
11246 ret = rb_assoc_new(r, w);
11247 if (rb_block_given_p()) {
11248 VALUE rw[2];
11249 rw[0] = r;
11250 rw[1] = w;
11251 return rb_ensure(rb_yield, ret, pipe_pair_close, (VALUE)rw);
11252 }
11253 return ret;
11254}
11255
11256struct foreach_arg {
11257 int argc;
11258 VALUE *argv;
11259 VALUE io;
11260};
11261
11262static void
11263open_key_args(VALUE klass, int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE opt, struct foreach_arg *arg)
11264{
11265 VALUE path, v;
11266 VALUE vmode = Qnil, vperm = Qnil;
11267
11268 path = *argv++;
11269 argc--;
11270 FilePathValue(path);
11271 arg->io = 0;
11272 arg->argc = argc;
11273 arg->argv = argv;
11274 if (NIL_P(opt)) {
11275 vmode = INT2NUM(O_RDONLY);
11276 vperm = INT2FIX(0666);
11277 }
11278 else if (!NIL_P(v = rb_hash_aref(opt, sym_open_args))) {
11279 int n;
11280
11281 v = rb_to_array_type(v);
11282 n = RARRAY_LENINT(v);
11283 rb_check_arity(n, 0, 3); /* rb_io_open */
11284 rb_scan_args_kw(RB_SCAN_ARGS_LAST_HASH_KEYWORDS, n, RARRAY_CONST_PTR(v), "02:", &vmode, &vperm, &opt);
11285 }
11286 arg->io = rb_io_open(klass, path, vmode, vperm, opt);
11287}
11288
11289static VALUE
11290io_s_foreach(VALUE v)
11291{
11292 struct getline_arg *arg = (void *)v;
11293 VALUE str;
11294
11295 while (!NIL_P(str = rb_io_getline_1(arg->rs, arg->limit, arg->chomp, arg->io))) {
11296 rb_lastline_set(str);
11297 rb_yield(str);
11298 }
11299 rb_lastline_set(Qnil);
11300 return Qnil;
11301}
11302
11303/*
11304 * call-seq:
11305 * IO.foreach(path, sep = $/, **opts) {|line| block } -> nil
11306 * IO.foreach(path, limit, **opts) {|line| block } -> nil
11307 * IO.foreach(path, sep, limit, **opts) {|line| block } -> nil
11308 * IO.foreach(command, sep = $/, **opts) {|line| block } -> nil
11309 * IO.foreach(command, limit, **opts) {|line| block } -> nil
11310 * IO.foreach(command, sep, limit, **opts) {|line| block } -> nil
11311 * IO.foreach(...) -> an_enumerator
11312 *
11313 * Calls the block with each successive line read from the stream.
11314 *
11315 * When called from class \IO (but not subclasses of \IO),
11316 * this method has potential security vulnerabilities if called with untrusted input;
11317 * see {Command Injection}[rdoc-ref:command_injection.rdoc].
11318 *
11319 * The first argument must be a string that is one of the following:
11320 *
11321 * - Path: if +self+ is a subclass of \IO (\File, for example),
11322 * or if the string _does_ _not_ start with the pipe character (<tt>'|'</tt>),
11323 * the string is the path to a file.
11324 * - Command: if +self+ is the class \IO,
11325 * and if the string starts with the pipe character,
11326 * the rest of the string is a command to be executed as a subprocess.
11327 * This usage has potential security vulnerabilities if called with untrusted input;
11328 * see {Command Injection}[rdoc-ref:command_injection.rdoc].
11329 *
11330 * With only argument +path+ given, parses lines from the file at the given +path+,
11331 * as determined by the default line separator,
11332 * and calls the block with each successive line:
11333 *
11334 * File.foreach('t.txt') {|line| p line }
11335 *
11336 * Output: the same as above.
11337 *
11338 * For both forms, command and path, the remaining arguments are the same.
11339 *
11340 * With argument +sep+ given, parses lines as determined by that line separator
11341 * (see {Line Separator}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Separator]):
11342 *
11343 * File.foreach('t.txt', 'li') {|line| p line }
11344 *
11345 * Output:
11346 *
11347 * "First li"
11348 * "ne\nSecond li"
11349 * "ne\n\nThird li"
11350 * "ne\nFourth li"
11351 * "ne\n"
11352 *
11353 * Each paragraph:
11354 *
11355 * File.foreach('t.txt', '') {|paragraph| p paragraph }
11356 *
11357 * Output:
11358 *
11359 * "First line\nSecond line\n\n"
11360 * "Third line\nFourth line\n"
11361 *
11362 * With argument +limit+ given, parses lines as determined by the default
11363 * line separator and the given line-length limit
11364 * (see {Line Limit}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Limit]):
11365 *
11366 * File.foreach('t.txt', 7) {|line| p line }
11367 *
11368 * Output:
11369 *
11370 * "First l"
11371 * "ine\n"
11372 * "Second "
11373 * "line\n"
11374 * "\n"
11375 * "Third l"
11376 * "ine\n"
11377 * "Fourth l"
11378 * "line\n"
11379 *
11380 * With arguments +sep+ and +limit+ given,
11381 * parses lines as determined by the given
11382 * line separator and the given line-length limit
11383 * (see {Line Separator and Line Limit}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Separator+and+Line+Limit]):
11384 *
11385 * Optional keyword arguments +opts+ specify:
11386 *
11387 * - {Open Options}[rdoc-ref:IO@Open+Options].
11388 * - {Encoding options}[rdoc-ref:encodings.rdoc@Encoding+Options].
11389 * - {Line Options}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Options].
11390 *
11391 * Returns an Enumerator if no block is given.
11392 *
11393 */
11394
11395static VALUE
11396rb_io_s_foreach(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE self)
11397{
11398 VALUE opt;
11399 int orig_argc = argc;
11400 struct foreach_arg arg;
11401 struct getline_arg garg;
11402
11403 argc = rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "12:", NULL, NULL, NULL, &opt);
11404 RETURN_ENUMERATOR(self, orig_argc, argv);
11405 extract_getline_args(argc-1, argv+1, &garg);
11406 open_key_args(self, argc, argv, opt, &arg);
11407 if (NIL_P(arg.io)) return Qnil;
11408 extract_getline_opts(opt, &garg);
11409 check_getline_args(&garg.rs, &garg.limit, garg.io = arg.io);
11410 return rb_ensure(io_s_foreach, (VALUE)&garg, rb_io_close, arg.io);
11411}
11412
11413static VALUE
11414io_s_readlines(VALUE v)
11415{
11416 struct getline_arg *arg = (void *)v;
11417 return io_readlines(arg, arg->io);
11418}
11419
11420/*
11421 * call-seq:
11422 * IO.readlines(command, sep = $/, **opts) -> array
11423 * IO.readlines(command, limit, **opts) -> array
11424 * IO.readlines(command, sep, limit, **opts) -> array
11425 * IO.readlines(path, sep = $/, **opts) -> array
11426 * IO.readlines(path, limit, **opts) -> array
11427 * IO.readlines(path, sep, limit, **opts) -> array
11428 *
11429 * Returns an array of all lines read from the stream.
11430 *
11431 * When called from class \IO (but not subclasses of \IO),
11432 * this method has potential security vulnerabilities if called with untrusted input;
11433 * see {Command Injection}[rdoc-ref:command_injection.rdoc].
11434 *
11435 * The first argument must be a string;
11436 * its meaning depends on whether it starts with the pipe character (<tt>'|'</tt>):
11437 *
11438 * - If so (and if +self+ is \IO),
11439 * the rest of the string is a command to be executed as a subprocess.
11440 * - Otherwise, the string is the path to a file.
11441 *
11442 * With only argument +command+ given, executes the command in a shell,
11443 * parses its $stdout into lines, as determined by the default line separator,
11444 * and returns those lines in an array:
11445 *
11446 * IO.readlines('| cat t.txt')
11447 * # => ["First line\n", "Second line\n", "\n", "Third line\n", "Fourth line\n"]
11448 *
11449 * With only argument +path+ given, parses lines from the file at the given +path+,
11450 * as determined by the default line separator,
11451 * and returns those lines in an array:
11452 *
11453 * IO.readlines('t.txt')
11454 * # => ["First line\n", "Second line\n", "\n", "Third line\n", "Fourth line\n"]
11455 *
11456 * For both forms, command and path, the remaining arguments are the same.
11457 *
11458 * With argument +sep+ given, parses lines as determined by that line separator
11459 * (see {Line Separator}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Separator]):
11460 *
11461 * # Ordinary separator.
11462 * IO.readlines('t.txt', 'li')
11463 * # =>["First li", "ne\nSecond li", "ne\n\nThird li", "ne\nFourth li", "ne\n"]
11464 * # Get-paragraphs separator.
11465 * IO.readlines('t.txt', '')
11466 * # => ["First line\nSecond line\n\n", "Third line\nFourth line\n"]
11467 * # Get-all separator.
11468 * IO.readlines('t.txt', nil)
11469 * # => ["First line\nSecond line\n\nThird line\nFourth line\n"]
11470 *
11471 * With argument +limit+ given, parses lines as determined by the default
11472 * line separator and the given line-length limit
11473 * (see {Line Limit}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Limit]):
11474 *
11475 * IO.readlines('t.txt', 7)
11476 * # => ["First l", "ine\n", "Second ", "line\n", "\n", "Third l", "ine\n", "Fourth ", "line\n"]
11477 *
11478 * With arguments +sep+ and +limit+ given,
11479 * parses lines as determined by the given
11480 * line separator and the given line-length limit
11481 * (see {Line Separator and Line Limit}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Separator+and+Line+Limit]):
11482 *
11483 * Optional keyword arguments +opts+ specify:
11484 *
11485 * - {Open Options}[rdoc-ref:IO@Open+Options].
11486 * - {Encoding options}[rdoc-ref:encodings.rdoc@Encoding+Options].
11487 * - {Line Options}[rdoc-ref:IO@Line+Options].
11488 *
11489 */
11490
11491static VALUE
11492rb_io_s_readlines(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
11493{
11494 VALUE opt;
11495 struct foreach_arg arg;
11496 struct getline_arg garg;
11497
11498 argc = rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "12:", NULL, NULL, NULL, &opt);
11499 extract_getline_args(argc-1, argv+1, &garg);
11500 open_key_args(io, argc, argv, opt, &arg);
11501 if (NIL_P(arg.io)) return Qnil;
11502 extract_getline_opts(opt, &garg);
11503 check_getline_args(&garg.rs, &garg.limit, garg.io = arg.io);
11504 return rb_ensure(io_s_readlines, (VALUE)&garg, rb_io_close, arg.io);
11505}
11506
11507static VALUE
11508io_s_read(VALUE v)
11509{
11510 struct foreach_arg *arg = (void *)v;
11511 return io_read(arg->argc, arg->argv, arg->io);
11512}
11513
11514struct seek_arg {
11515 VALUE io;
11516 VALUE offset;
11517 int mode;
11518};
11519
11520static VALUE
11521seek_before_access(VALUE argp)
11522{
11523 struct seek_arg *arg = (struct seek_arg *)argp;
11524 rb_io_binmode(arg->io);
11525 return rb_io_seek(arg->io, arg->offset, arg->mode);
11526}
11527
11528/*
11529 * call-seq:
11530 * IO.read(command, length = nil, offset = 0, **opts) -> string or nil
11531 * IO.read(path, length = nil, offset = 0, **opts) -> string or nil
11532 *
11533 * Opens the stream, reads and returns some or all of its content,
11534 * and closes the stream; returns +nil+ if no bytes were read.
11535 *
11536 * When called from class \IO (but not subclasses of \IO),
11537 * this method has potential security vulnerabilities if called with untrusted input;
11538 * see {Command Injection}[rdoc-ref:command_injection.rdoc].
11539 *
11540 * The first argument must be a string;
11541 * its meaning depends on whether it starts with the pipe character (<tt>'|'</tt>):
11542 *
11543 * - If so (and if +self+ is \IO),
11544 * the rest of the string is a command to be executed as a subprocess.
11545 * - Otherwise, the string is the path to a file.
11546 *
11547 * With only argument +command+ given, executes the command in a shell,
11548 * returns its entire $stdout:
11549 *
11550 * IO.read('| cat t.txt')
11551 * # => "First line\nSecond line\n\nThird line\nFourth line\n"
11552 *
11553 * With only argument +path+ given, reads and returns the entire content
11554 * of the file at the given path:
11555 *
11556 * IO.read('t.txt')
11557 * # => "First line\nSecond line\n\nThird line\nFourth line\n"
11558 *
11559 * For both forms, command and path, the remaining arguments are the same.
11560 *
11561 * With argument +length+, returns +length+ bytes if available:
11562 *
11563 * IO.read('t.txt', 7) # => "First l"
11564 * IO.read('t.txt', 700)
11565 * # => "First line\r\nSecond line\r\n\r\nFourth line\r\nFifth line\r\n"
11566 *
11567 * With arguments +length+ and +offset+, returns +length+ bytes
11568 * if available, beginning at the given +offset+:
11569 *
11570 * IO.read('t.txt', 10, 2) # => "rst line\nS"
11571 * IO.read('t.txt', 10, 200) # => nil
11572 *
11573 * Optional keyword arguments +opts+ specify:
11574 *
11575 * - {Open Options}[rdoc-ref:IO@Open+Options].
11576 * - {Encoding options}[rdoc-ref:encodings.rdoc@Encoding+Options].
11577 *
11578 */
11579
11580static VALUE
11581rb_io_s_read(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
11582{
11583 VALUE opt, offset;
11584 struct foreach_arg arg;
11585
11586 argc = rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "13:", NULL, NULL, &offset, NULL, &opt);
11587 open_key_args(io, argc, argv, opt, &arg);
11588 if (NIL_P(arg.io)) return Qnil;
11589 if (!NIL_P(offset)) {
11590 struct seek_arg sarg;
11591 int state = 0;
11592 sarg.io = arg.io;
11593 sarg.offset = offset;
11594 sarg.mode = SEEK_SET;
11595 rb_protect(seek_before_access, (VALUE)&sarg, &state);
11596 if (state) {
11597 rb_io_close(arg.io);
11598 rb_jump_tag(state);
11599 }
11600 if (arg.argc == 2) arg.argc = 1;
11601 }
11602 return rb_ensure(io_s_read, (VALUE)&arg, rb_io_close, arg.io);
11603}
11604
11605/*
11606 * call-seq:
11607 * IO.binread(command, length = nil, offset = 0) -> string or nil
11608 * IO.binread(path, length = nil, offset = 0) -> string or nil
11609 *
11610 * Behaves like IO.read, except that the stream is opened in binary mode
11611 * with ASCII-8BIT encoding.
11612 *
11613 * When called from class \IO (but not subclasses of \IO),
11614 * this method has potential security vulnerabilities if called with untrusted input;
11615 * see {Command Injection}[rdoc-ref:command_injection.rdoc].
11616 *
11617 */
11618
11619static VALUE
11620rb_io_s_binread(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
11621{
11622 VALUE offset;
11623 struct foreach_arg arg;
11624 enum {
11625 fmode = FMODE_READABLE|FMODE_BINMODE,
11626 oflags = O_RDONLY
11627#ifdef O_BINARY
11628 |O_BINARY
11629#endif
11630 };
11631 convconfig_t convconfig = {NULL, NULL, 0, Qnil};
11632
11633 rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "12", NULL, NULL, &offset);
11634 FilePathValue(argv[0]);
11635 convconfig.enc = rb_ascii8bit_encoding();
11636 arg.io = rb_io_open_generic(io, argv[0], oflags, fmode, &convconfig, 0);
11637 if (NIL_P(arg.io)) return Qnil;
11638 arg.argv = argv+1;
11639 arg.argc = (argc > 1) ? 1 : 0;
11640 if (!NIL_P(offset)) {
11641 struct seek_arg sarg;
11642 int state = 0;
11643 sarg.io = arg.io;
11644 sarg.offset = offset;
11645 sarg.mode = SEEK_SET;
11646 rb_protect(seek_before_access, (VALUE)&sarg, &state);
11647 if (state) {
11648 rb_io_close(arg.io);
11649 rb_jump_tag(state);
11650 }
11651 }
11652 return rb_ensure(io_s_read, (VALUE)&arg, rb_io_close, arg.io);
11653}
11654
11655static VALUE
11656io_s_write0(VALUE v)
11657{
11658 struct write_arg *arg = (void *)v;
11659 return io_write(arg->io,arg->str,arg->nosync);
11660}
11661
11662static VALUE
11663io_s_write(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE klass, int binary)
11664{
11665 VALUE string, offset, opt;
11666 struct foreach_arg arg;
11667 struct write_arg warg;
11668
11669 rb_scan_args(argc, argv, "21:", NULL, &string, &offset, &opt);
11670
11671 if (NIL_P(opt)) opt = rb_hash_new();
11672 else opt = rb_hash_dup(opt);
11673
11674
11675 if (NIL_P(rb_hash_aref(opt,sym_mode))) {
11676 int mode = O_WRONLY|O_CREAT;
11677#ifdef O_BINARY
11678 if (binary) mode |= O_BINARY;
11679#endif
11680 if (NIL_P(offset)) mode |= O_TRUNC;
11681 rb_hash_aset(opt,sym_mode,INT2NUM(mode));
11682 }
11683 open_key_args(klass, argc, argv, opt, &arg);
11684
11685#ifndef O_BINARY
11686 if (binary) rb_io_binmode_m(arg.io);
11687#endif
11688
11689 if (NIL_P(arg.io)) return Qnil;
11690 if (!NIL_P(offset)) {
11691 struct seek_arg sarg;
11692 int state = 0;
11693 sarg.io = arg.io;
11694 sarg.offset = offset;
11695 sarg.mode = SEEK_SET;
11696 rb_protect(seek_before_access, (VALUE)&sarg, &state);
11697 if (state) {
11698 rb_io_close(arg.io);
11699 rb_jump_tag(state);
11700 }
11701 }
11702
11703 warg.io = arg.io;
11704 warg.str = string;
11705 warg.nosync = 0;
11706
11707 return rb_ensure(io_s_write0, (VALUE)&warg, rb_io_close, arg.io);
11708}
11709
11710/*
11711 * call-seq:
11712 * IO.write(command, data, **opts) -> integer
11713 * IO.write(path, data, offset = 0, **opts) -> integer
11714 *
11715 * Opens the stream, writes the given +data+ to it,
11716 * and closes the stream; returns the number of bytes written.
11717 *
11718 * When called from class \IO (but not subclasses of \IO),
11719 * this method has potential security vulnerabilities if called with untrusted input;
11720 * see {Command Injection}[rdoc-ref:command_injection.rdoc].
11721 *
11722 * The first argument must be a string;
11723 * its meaning depends on whether it starts with the pipe character (<tt>'|'</tt>):
11724 *
11725 * - If so (and if +self+ is \IO),
11726 * the rest of the string is a command to be executed as a subprocess.
11727 * - Otherwise, the string is the path to a file.
11728 *
11729 * With argument +command+ given, executes the command in a shell,
11730 * passes +data+ through standard input, writes its output to $stdout,
11731 * and returns the length of the given +data+:
11732 *
11733 * IO.write('| cat', 'Hello World!') # => 12
11734 *
11735 * Output:
11736 *
11737 * Hello World!
11738 *
11739 * With argument +path+ given, writes the given +data+ to the file
11740 * at that path:
11741 *
11742 * IO.write('t.tmp', 'abc') # => 3
11743 * File.read('t.tmp') # => "abc"
11744 *
11745 * If +offset+ is zero (the default), the file is overwritten:
11746 *
11747 * IO.write('t.tmp', 'A') # => 1
11748 * File.read('t.tmp') # => "A"
11749 *
11750 * If +offset+ in within the file content, the file is partly overwritten:
11751 *
11752 * IO.write('t.tmp', 'abcdef') # => 3
11753 * File.read('t.tmp') # => "abcdef"
11754 * # Offset within content.
11755 * IO.write('t.tmp', '012', 2) # => 3
11756 * File.read('t.tmp') # => "ab012f"
11757 *
11758 * If +offset+ is outside the file content,
11759 * the file is padded with null characters <tt>"\u0000"</tt>:
11760 *
11761 * IO.write('t.tmp', 'xyz', 10) # => 3
11762 * File.read('t.tmp') # => "ab012f\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000xyz"
11763 *
11764 * Optional keyword arguments +opts+ specify:
11765 *
11766 * - {Open Options}[rdoc-ref:IO@Open+Options].
11767 * - {Encoding options}[rdoc-ref:encodings.rdoc@Encoding+Options].
11768 *
11769 */
11770
11771static VALUE
11772rb_io_s_write(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
11773{
11774 return io_s_write(argc, argv, io, 0);
11775}
11776
11777/*
11778 * call-seq:
11779 * IO.binwrite(command, string, offset = 0) -> integer
11780 * IO.binwrite(path, string, offset = 0) -> integer
11781 *
11782 * Behaves like IO.write, except that the stream is opened in binary mode
11783 * with ASCII-8BIT encoding.
11784 *
11785 * When called from class \IO (but not subclasses of \IO),
11786 * this method has potential security vulnerabilities if called with untrusted input;
11787 * see {Command Injection}[rdoc-ref:command_injection.rdoc].
11788 *
11789 */
11790
11791static VALUE
11792rb_io_s_binwrite(int argc, VALUE *argv, VALUE io)
11793{
11794 return io_s_write(argc, argv, io, 1);
11795}
11796
11797struct copy_stream_struct {
11798 VALUE src;
11799 VALUE dst;
11800 off_t copy_length; /* (off_t)-1 if not specified */
11801 off_t src_offset; /* (off_t)-1 if not specified */
11802
11803 rb_io_t *src_fptr;
11804 rb_io_t *dst_fptr;
11805 unsigned close_src : 1;
11806 unsigned close_dst : 1;
11807 int error_no;
11808 off_t total;
11809 const char *syserr;
11810 const char *notimp;
11811 VALUE th;
11812 struct stat src_stat;
11813 struct stat dst_stat;
11814#ifdef HAVE_FCOPYFILE
11815 copyfile_state_t copyfile_state;
11816#endif
11817};
11818
11819static void *
11820exec_interrupts(void *arg)
11821{
11822 VALUE th = (VALUE)arg;
11823 rb_thread_execute_interrupts(th);
11824 return NULL;
11825}
11826
11827/*
11828 * returns TRUE if the preceding system call was interrupted
11829 * so we can continue. If the thread was interrupted, we
11830 * reacquire the GVL to execute interrupts before continuing.
11831 */
11832static int
11833maygvl_copy_stream_continue_p(int has_gvl, struct copy_stream_struct *stp)
11834{
11835 switch (errno) {
11836 case EINTR:
11837#if defined(ERESTART)
11838 case ERESTART:
11839#endif
11840 if (rb_thread_interrupted(stp->th)) {
11841 if (has_gvl)
11842 rb_thread_execute_interrupts(stp->th);
11843 else
11844 rb_thread_call_with_gvl(exec_interrupts, (void *)stp->th);
11845 }
11846 return TRUE;
11847 }
11848 return FALSE;
11849}
11850
11851struct wait_for_single_fd {
11852 VALUE scheduler;
11853
11854 rb_io_t *fptr;
11855 short events;
11856
11857 VALUE result;
11858};
11859
11860static void *
11861rb_thread_fiber_scheduler_wait_for(void * _args)
11862{
11863 struct wait_for_single_fd *args = (struct wait_for_single_fd *)_args;
11864
11865 args->result = rb_fiber_scheduler_io_wait(args->scheduler, args->fptr->self, INT2NUM(args->events), Qnil);
11866
11867 return NULL;
11868}
11869
11870#if USE_POLL
11871# define IOWAIT_SYSCALL "poll"
11872STATIC_ASSERT(pollin_expected, POLLIN == RB_WAITFD_IN);
11873STATIC_ASSERT(pollout_expected, POLLOUT == RB_WAITFD_OUT);
11874static int
11875nogvl_wait_for(VALUE th, rb_io_t *fptr, short events)
11876{
11877 VALUE scheduler = rb_fiber_scheduler_current_for_thread(th);
11878 if (scheduler != Qnil) {
11879 struct wait_for_single_fd args = {.scheduler = scheduler, .fptr = fptr, .events = events};
11880 rb_thread_call_with_gvl(rb_thread_fiber_scheduler_wait_for, &args);
11881 return RTEST(args.result);
11882 }
11883
11884 int fd = fptr->fd;
11885 if (fd == -1) return 0;
11886
11887 struct pollfd fds;
11888
11889 fds.fd = fd;
11890 fds.events = events;
11891
11892 return poll(&fds, 1, -1);
11893}
11894#else /* !USE_POLL */
11895# define IOWAIT_SYSCALL "select"
11896static int
11897nogvl_wait_for(VALUE th, rb_io_t *fptr, short events)
11898{
11899 VALUE scheduler = rb_fiber_scheduler_current_for_thread(th);
11900 if (scheduler != Qnil) {
11901 struct wait_for_single_fd args = {.scheduler = scheduler, .fptr = fptr, .events = events};
11902 rb_thread_call_with_gvl(rb_thread_fiber_scheduler_wait_for, &args);
11903 return RTEST(args.result);
11904 }
11905
11906 int fd = fptr->fd;
11907 if (fd == -1) return 0;
11908
11909 rb_fdset_t fds;
11910 int ret;
11911
11912 rb_fd_init(&fds);
11913 rb_fd_set(fd, &fds);
11914
11915 switch (events) {
11916 case RB_WAITFD_IN:
11917 ret = rb_fd_select(fd + 1, &fds, 0, 0, 0);
11918 break;
11919 case RB_WAITFD_OUT:
11920 ret = rb_fd_select(fd + 1, 0, &fds, 0, 0);
11921 break;
11922 default:
11923 VM_UNREACHABLE(nogvl_wait_for);
11924 }
11925
11926 rb_fd_term(&fds);
11927 return ret;
11928}
11929#endif /* !USE_POLL */
11930
11931static int
11932maygvl_copy_stream_wait_read(int has_gvl, struct copy_stream_struct *stp)
11933{
11934 int ret;
11935
11936 do {
11937 if (has_gvl) {
11938 ret = RB_NUM2INT(rb_io_wait(stp->src, RB_INT2NUM(RUBY_IO_READABLE), Qnil));
11939 }
11940 else {
11941 ret = nogvl_wait_for(stp->th, stp->src_fptr, RB_WAITFD_IN);
11942 }
11943 } while (ret < 0 && maygvl_copy_stream_continue_p(has_gvl, stp));
11944
11945 if (ret < 0) {
11946 stp->syserr = IOWAIT_SYSCALL;
11947 stp->error_no = errno;
11948 return ret;
11949 }
11950 return 0;
11951}
11952
11953static int
11954nogvl_copy_stream_wait_write(struct copy_stream_struct *stp)
11955{
11956 int ret;
11957
11958 do {
11959 ret = nogvl_wait_for(stp->th, stp->dst_fptr, RB_WAITFD_OUT);
11960 } while (ret < 0 && maygvl_copy_stream_continue_p(0, stp));
11961
11962 if (ret < 0) {
11963 stp->syserr = IOWAIT_SYSCALL;
11964 stp->error_no = errno;
11965 return ret;
11966 }
11967 return 0;
11968}
11969
11970#ifdef USE_COPY_FILE_RANGE
11971
11972static ssize_t
11973simple_copy_file_range(int in_fd, off_t *in_offset, int out_fd, off_t *out_offset, size_t count, unsigned int flags)
11974{
11975#ifdef HAVE_COPY_FILE_RANGE
11976 return copy_file_range(in_fd, in_offset, out_fd, out_offset, count, flags);
11977#else
11978 return syscall(__NR_copy_file_range, in_fd, in_offset, out_fd, out_offset, count, flags);
11979#endif
11980}
11981
11982static int
11983nogvl_copy_file_range(struct copy_stream_struct *stp)
11984{
11985 ssize_t ss;
11986 off_t src_size;
11987 off_t copy_length, src_offset, *src_offset_ptr;
11988
11989 if (!S_ISREG(stp->src_stat.st_mode))
11990 return 0;
11991
11992 src_size = stp->src_stat.st_size;
11993 src_offset = stp->src_offset;
11994 if (src_offset >= (off_t)0) {
11995 src_offset_ptr = &src_offset;
11996 }
11997 else {
11998 src_offset_ptr = NULL; /* if src_offset_ptr is NULL, then bytes are read from in_fd starting from the file offset */
11999 }
12000
12001 copy_length = stp->copy_length;
12002 if (copy_length < (off_t)0) {
12003 if (src_offset < (off_t)0) {
12004 off_t current_offset;
12005 errno = 0;
12006 current_offset = lseek(stp->src_fptr->fd, 0, SEEK_CUR);
12007 if (current_offset < (off_t)0 && errno) {
12008 stp->syserr = "lseek";
12009 stp->error_no = errno;
12010 return (int)current_offset;
12011 }
12012 copy_length = src_size - current_offset;
12013 }
12014 else {
12015 copy_length = src_size - src_offset;
12016 }
12017 }
12018
12019 retry_copy_file_range:
12020# if SIZEOF_OFF_T > SIZEOF_SIZE_T
12021 /* we are limited by the 32-bit ssize_t return value on 32-bit */
12022 ss = (copy_length > (off_t)SSIZE_MAX) ? SSIZE_MAX : (ssize_t)copy_length;
12023# else
12024 ss = (ssize_t)copy_length;
12025# endif
12026 ss = simple_copy_file_range(stp->src_fptr->fd, src_offset_ptr, stp->dst_fptr->fd, NULL, ss, 0);
12027 if (0 < ss) {
12028 stp->total += ss;
12029 copy_length -= ss;
12030 if (0 < copy_length) {
12031 goto retry_copy_file_range;
12032 }
12033 }
12034 if (ss < 0) {
12035 if (maygvl_copy_stream_continue_p(0, stp)) {
12036 goto retry_copy_file_range;
12037 }
12038 switch (errno) {
12039 case EINVAL:
12040 case EPERM: /* copy_file_range(2) doesn't exist (may happen in
12041 docker container) */
12042#ifdef ENOSYS
12043 case ENOSYS:
12044#endif
12045#ifdef EXDEV
12046 case EXDEV: /* in_fd and out_fd are not on the same filesystem */
12047#endif
12048 return 0;
12049 case EAGAIN:
12050#if EWOULDBLOCK != EAGAIN
12051 case EWOULDBLOCK:
12052#endif
12053 {
12054 int ret = nogvl_copy_stream_wait_write(stp);
12055 if (ret < 0) return ret;
12056 }
12057 goto retry_copy_file_range;
12058 case EBADF:
12059 {
12060 int e = errno;
12061 int flags = fcntl(stp->dst_fptr->fd, F_GETFL);
12062
12063 if (flags != -1 && flags & O_APPEND) {
12064 return 0;
12065 }
12066 errno = e;
12067 }
12068 }
12069 stp->syserr = "copy_file_range";
12070 stp->error_no = errno;
12071 return (int)ss;
12072 }
12073 return 1;
12074}
12075#endif
12076
12077#ifdef HAVE_FCOPYFILE
12078static int
12079nogvl_fcopyfile(struct copy_stream_struct *stp)
12080{
12081 off_t cur, ss = 0;
12082 const off_t src_offset = stp->src_offset;
12083 int ret;
12084
12085 if (stp->copy_length >= (off_t)0) {
12086 /* copy_length can't be specified in fcopyfile(3) */
12087 return 0;
12088 }
12089
12090 if (!S_ISREG(stp->src_stat.st_mode))
12091 return 0;
12092
12093 if (!S_ISREG(stp->dst_stat.st_mode))
12094 return 0;
12095 if (lseek(stp->dst_fptr->fd, 0, SEEK_CUR) > (off_t)0) /* if dst IO was already written */
12096 return 0;
12097 if (fcntl(stp->dst_fptr->fd, F_GETFL) & O_APPEND) {
12098 /* fcopyfile(3) appends src IO to dst IO and then truncates
12099 * dst IO to src IO's original size. */
12100 off_t end = lseek(stp->dst_fptr->fd, 0, SEEK_END);
12101 lseek(stp->dst_fptr->fd, 0, SEEK_SET);
12102 if (end > (off_t)0) return 0;
12103 }
12104
12105 if (src_offset > (off_t)0) {
12106 off_t r;
12107
12108 /* get current offset */
12109 errno = 0;
12110 cur = lseek(stp->src_fptr->fd, 0, SEEK_CUR);
12111 if (cur < (off_t)0 && errno) {
12112 stp->error_no = errno;
12113 return 1;
12114 }
12115
12116 errno = 0;
12117 r = lseek(stp->src_fptr->fd, src_offset, SEEK_SET);
12118 if (r < (off_t)0 && errno) {
12119 stp->error_no = errno;
12120 return 1;
12121 }
12122 }
12123
12124 stp->copyfile_state = copyfile_state_alloc(); /* this will be freed by copy_stream_finalize() */
12125 ret = fcopyfile(stp->src_fptr->fd, stp->dst_fptr->fd, stp->copyfile_state, COPYFILE_DATA);
12126 copyfile_state_get(stp->copyfile_state, COPYFILE_STATE_COPIED, &ss); /* get copied bytes */
12127
12128 if (ret == 0) { /* success */
12129 stp->total = ss;
12130 if (src_offset > (off_t)0) {
12131 off_t r;
12132 errno = 0;
12133 /* reset offset */
12134 r = lseek(stp->src_fptr->fd, cur, SEEK_SET);
12135 if (r < (off_t)0 && errno) {
12136 stp->error_no = errno;
12137 return 1;
12138 }
12139 }
12140 }
12141 else {
12142 switch (errno) {
12143 case ENOTSUP:
12144 case EPERM:
12145 case EINVAL:
12146 return 0;
12147 }
12148 stp->syserr = "fcopyfile";
12149 stp->error_no = errno;
12150 return (int)ret;
12151 }
12152 return 1;
12153}
12154#endif
12155
12156#ifdef HAVE_SENDFILE
12157
12158# ifdef __linux__
12159# define USE_SENDFILE
12160
12161# ifdef HAVE_SYS_SENDFILE_H
12162# include <sys/sendfile.h>
12163# endif
12164
12165static ssize_t
12166simple_sendfile(int out_fd, int in_fd, off_t *offset, off_t count)
12167{
12168 return sendfile(out_fd, in_fd, offset, (size_t)count);
12169}
12170
12171# elif 0 /* defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__DragonFly__) */ || defined(__APPLE__)
12172/* This runs on FreeBSD8.1 r30210, but sendfiles blocks its execution
12173 * without cpuset -l 0.
12174 */
12175# define USE_SENDFILE
12176
12177static ssize_t
12178simple_sendfile(int out_fd, int in_fd, off_t *offset, off_t count)
12179{
12180 int r;
12181 off_t pos = offset ? *offset : lseek(in_fd, 0, SEEK_CUR);
12182 off_t sbytes;
12183# ifdef __APPLE__
12184 r = sendfile(in_fd, out_fd, pos, &count, NULL, 0);
12185 sbytes = count;
12186# else
12187 r = sendfile(in_fd, out_fd, pos, (size_t)count, NULL, &sbytes, 0);
12188# endif
12189 if (r != 0 && sbytes == 0) return r;
12190 if (offset) {
12191 *offset += sbytes;
12192 }
12193 else {
12194 lseek(in_fd, sbytes, SEEK_CUR);
12195 }
12196 return (ssize_t)sbytes;
12197}
12198
12199# endif
12200
12201#endif
12202
12203#ifdef USE_SENDFILE
12204static int
12205nogvl_copy_stream_sendfile(struct copy_stream_struct *stp)
12206{
12207 ssize_t ss;
12208 off_t src_size;
12209 off_t copy_length;
12210 off_t src_offset;
12211 int use_pread;
12212
12213 if (!S_ISREG(stp->src_stat.st_mode))
12214 return 0;
12215
12216 src_size = stp->src_stat.st_size;
12217#ifndef __linux__
12218 if ((stp->dst_stat.st_mode & S_IFMT) != S_IFSOCK)
12219 return 0;
12220#endif
12221
12222 src_offset = stp->src_offset;
12223 use_pread = src_offset >= (off_t)0;
12224
12225 copy_length = stp->copy_length;
12226 if (copy_length < (off_t)0) {
12227 if (use_pread)
12228 copy_length = src_size - src_offset;
12229 else {
12230 off_t cur;
12231 errno = 0;
12232 cur = lseek(stp->src_fptr->fd, 0, SEEK_CUR);
12233 if (cur < (off_t)0 && errno) {
